loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 49 years old. She is married and has one son. Her husband works as an independent carpenter. She buys clothing and sells it to the people in her community. She also makes tamales in her home and sells them door-to-door in nearby communities. She is part of the “María del Carmen Group 2”, along with Laura de la Cruz Vasquez, who has a small grocery store in her house. With the loan, Teresa wants to buy more clothes to sell in the surrounding communities. Laura wants to buy merchandise like cooking oil, conserves, and non-perishable foods in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

TERESA DE JESUS, TIENE 49 AÑOS , CASADA UN HIJO, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO CARPINTERO EN FORMA INDEPENDIENTE. ELLA COMPRA ROPA Y LA VENDE ENTRE LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD ADEMAS HACE TAMALES EN SU CASA Y LA VENDE PUERTA A PUERTA ENTRE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS .PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 , JUNTO CON LA SEÑORA LAURA DE LA CRUZ VASQUEZ QUIEN TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO TERESA COMPRAR MAS ROPA PARA SALIR A VENDER A LAS COMUNIDADES Y LAURA COMPRAR MERCADERIA COMO ACEITE , CONSERVAS Y ALIMENTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise for resale; To buy merchandise for a small grocery store

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en:
Pascuala is 48 years old, married, and has tour children. Her husband is a bus driver. She sells foodstuffs from her house (cooking oil, salt, sugar). She is part of the “María del Carmen Group 2”. The other member is Neyvi Guadelupe Pérez Villafuerte, who sells women’s accessories from her home. With the loan, each hopes to increase her income. Neyvi will buy more accessories and perfumes to sell to women in the community. Pascuala wants to build a small grocery story, along with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

PASCUALA ES CASADA TIENE 48 AÑOS Y CUATRO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA, ELLA ACTUALMENTE VENDE COMESTIBLES EN SU CASA ( ACEITE , SAL, AZUCAR, ) PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 SU OTRA INTEGRANTE ES DOÑA NEYVI GUADALUPE PEREZ VILLAFUERTE QUIEN VENDE ADORNOS Y ACCESORIOS PARA LA MUJER EN SU CASAAMBAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS . NEYVI COMPRAR MAS ACCESORIOS Y PERFUMES PARA VENDER A LAS MUJERES DE LA COMUNIDAD, EN CAMBIO PASCUALA QUIERE INSTALAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE ABARROTES JUNTO A SU ESPOSO..

loans.use: To build a small grocery store; To buy women's accessories for resale

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
My name is Julieta Rodríguez and for the past four years I've been selling used clothing for children, men and women. My customers are very loyal, in my community people are very poor and they don't have enough money to buy expensive things, and I sell clothing that is almost new at a very low price. My goal is to purchase more clothes so as to have a greater stock available and make more sales. With the earnings I want to remodel my shop and make it bigger so that my customers are more comfortable. Since my shop is in my own home, it will be easy to remodel.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Julieta R. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad que tengo de realizar durante 4 años, los clientes son excelentes ya que nuestra comunidad es muy pobre y la gente no tiene mucho dinero para comprar cosas muy caras y ellos me prefieren a mi porque vendo la ropa casi nueva y de calidad a un precio muy bajo, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, hacerlo mas grande para tener una mejor atencion a mis clientes y como mi negocio es en mi casa de habitacion me resulta mas facil remodelarlo

loans.use: purchasing used clothes

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
Romelia is 28 years old and has five children. Her husband works as a mason’s assistant. She has sells foodstuffs to her neighbors. With the loan, she would like to build a small grocery store. She belongs to the “María del Carmen Group 2”, along with Hanne Isabel Pérez Gutierrez, who sells cosmetic products from her home. With her portion of the loan, Hanne wants to buy more cosmetics, perfumes, and creams that she can sell from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

ROMELIA TIENE CINCO HIJOS Y 28 AÑOS DE EDAD SU ESPOSO SE DESEMPEÑA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL, ELLA ACTUALMENTE TIENE EN SU CASA ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS ALIMENTICIOS PARA VENDER ENTRE SUS VECINOS CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INSTALARSE CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 2 JUNTO A DOÑA HANNE ISABEL PEREZ GUTIERREZ QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COSMETICOS EN SU CASA.HANNE QUIERE CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS COSMETICOS, PERFUMES Y CREMAS PARA COLOCAR UNA TIENDITA EN SU CASA.

loans.use: To add a small grocery store on to a house; To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Maria Casta

texts.en:
My name is María M. and I sell ladies' products such as lotions, shampoos, deodorants and perfumes. I've been in this business for the past two years, because in my city it is very tough for a person my age to find a job. So, I decided to sell cosmetic products and now I want to increase my product stock, but I need money to be able to purchase more products. With the income I will be able to pay my home expenses.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Maria M. me dedico a la venta de productos para damas como ser cremas, shampoos, desodorantes, perfumes, actividad que realizo desde hace 2 años, en nuestra ciudad es bien dificil conseguir trabajo para una persona de mi edad por lo que decidi vender productos cosmeticos pero para mejorar necesito capital para poder comprar mas productos, con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: purchasing lotions, shampoos, soaps, deodorants, perfumes

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is 17 years old and is single. She and her parents have a small bakery in their home. With the loan, she wants to invest in more kitchen equipment, which will help improve production and sales of bread. She wants to use a part of the loan to finance her studies. She belongs to the “María del Carmen Group 3”, along with Zoila Esperanza Pérez Gutierrez, who sells cosmetics to women in the community. With the loan, she wants build a small business in her home where she can sell cosmetics and creams.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

IRMA TIENE 17 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y JUNTO CON SUS PADRES TIENEN UNA PEQUEÑA PANADERIA CASERA EN SU HOGAR CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIR EN MAS INSTRUMENTALES DE COCINA Y ASI AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y VENTA DE PAN Y ADEMAS COSTEARSE SUS ESTUDIOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 3 JUNTO CON ZOILA ESPERANZA P. GUTIERREZ QUIEN VENDE COSMETICOS ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE LA COMUNIDAD , ELLA ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN SU CASA EN LA VENTA DE COSMETICOS Y CREMAS .

loans.use: To buy kitchen equipment for a small bakery; To add a small store on to a house for the purpose of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.en:
My name is Martha G. and I sell ladies' and girls' new shoes and clothing, such as sandals, dresses, blouses, shirts, etc... I've been in this business for the past two years and I sell good products so my customers are loyal. My goal is to purchase more clothing and shoes so that I can make more sales and earn more money to feed my family and pay for my daughter's college education.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Martha G. me dedico a la venta de ropa y zapatos nuevos para dama y niñas como ser zandalias, blusas, vestiditos, camisetitas, actividad que la realizo hace unos 2 años, tengo buen producto por eso me prefieren mis clientes, mi meta es poder comprar mas ropa para tener mas variedad y asi mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagarle la universidad a mi hija.

loans.use: purchasing ladies' and girls' clothing and shoes

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
My name is Adriana Z. and I sell groceries. I've had my business for the past three years, and the sales are very good since I hardly have competition. However, I need a greater variety of products so I can make more sales and earn more money, since I want to save up and remodel my business and keep on maintaining my family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Adriana Z. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que no tengo mucha competencia pero necesito tener mas variedad de productos y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias, deseo poder ahorrar dinero para remodelar mi negocio aparte de mantener mi familia.

loans.use: Purchasing eggs, beans, rice, sugar, salt, sodas, lard, etc...

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Ana B. and I make a living selling new clothes. I've had my business for the past three years. Because I am located near the bus station, in one of the busiest streets of my city, I have a lot of good customers. My goal is to increase my product stock and thus increase my sales. With my earnings I will feed my family and buy wood to fix my shop.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Ana B. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, estoy ubicada cerca de una estacion de buses en un lugar muy transitado de mi ciudad por lo tanto tengo muchos clientes muy buenos, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y mis ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y comprar madera para arreglar mi negocio.

loans.use: purchasing new clothes for ladies, men and children

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is 39 and her husband is 48 years old. They have 3 children between 17 and 12. They only have 2000 square meters of growing rice land. Cong, her husband works as a daily laborer but he only can find the work in the dry season so their first and second stopped going to school. The third child is going to school in grade 5. So Lien’s selling vegetable is thus important to increase income about $1/person/month. Average is low at $8/person/month. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling.

loans.use: selling vegetable

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Miss Hue is 18 years old. She is the first daughter in the family. Her father is mentally retarded and her mother suffers gall-stone. Her mother had 3 surgery times and the family has paid $25.000 for her medical treatment. So Hue and her brother had to stop going to school. Her brother works as a daily month. So Hue’s selling vegetable at the local market is thus important to increase income about $6/person/month. Average income is $12/person/month. Now, Hue wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: selling vegetable

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has four years experience in his business of selling sandals as a traveling salesman. Since he was very small, 12 years old, he decided to become more independent of his family. He began to work only to support himself. He recieved the help of a friend, who loaned him the money in order for him to start working. He has had good success. He works every day of the week from 8am until 3pm.

Jorge wishes to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise on wholesale. With this purchase he can make higher earnings. He hopes to make enough money to begin to travel to other areas to sell his products.

Jorge is separated. He is 57 years old and has one son who is 9, who goes to school. His son spends his mornings with his grandmother and his afternoons with Jorge, doing his homework. His wish is to give his son a better education. He also has a room to rent and wishes to make repairs in it so that the people who rent it can live without inconveniences.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Jorge tiene una experiencia de 4 años con su negocio de venta de sandalias de manera ambulante. Desde muy pequeño a la edad de 12 años decide independizarse de su familia. Comienza a trabajar solo para mantenerse. Recibe la ayuda de un amigo el cual le presta dinero para que tenga capital de trabajo. Le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m.

Jorge desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor. Con lo que obtendría mayor ganancia. Espera poder tener mayor capital para comenzar a viajar a otras partes para vender sus productos

Jorge es separado. Tiene 57 años y un hijo de 9. El cual estudia. Por las mañanas pasa con su abuela. Por las tardes Jorge se encarga de enseñarles las tareas. Su deseo es poder darle una buena educación a su hijo. Y también el posee un cuarto de arriendo y desea arreglarlo para que las personas que se lo alquilan vivan sin inconvenientes.

loans.use: Buy his products wholesale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs Maria has a store where she sells all sorts of every day necessities and also sells folders, stationary, perfumes, and cosmetics. Her business is located on a road with heavy traffic and because of which her sales increase every day.

Mrs. Maria began her business three years ago with the money she gained from being a traveling saleswoman, in various sections of the central city, but this job was too tiring and so she decided to begin a business out of her own home.

She wants to use part of the credit to buy a glass display case to display her products and to push her merchandise better. The other part she will use to purchase merchandise to meet her customers' demands.

Her current goal is to see her business grow and is confident that this will happen with the loan. Mrs. Maria is 26 years old, her house is made of reed and she has a good location for her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. Maria tiene una tienda donde vende todo lo relacionado a productos de primera necesidad y también se ayuda con la venta de cuadernos, papelería, perfumes y cosméticos. Su negocio esta ubicado en una calle muy transitada por lo cual sus ventas mejoran cada día. La señora Maria inicio su negocio hace tres años con un dinero que obtuvo producto de la venta de mercadería ambulante en varios sectores céntricos de la ciudad, pero este trabajo era demasiado agotador por lo cual decidió iniciar con su negocio en su propia casa. Ella quiere usar parte de su crédito en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y de esta manera se pueda apreciar mejor su mercadería, la otra parte va a comprar mercadería para poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. En la actualidad su meta es crecer su negocio y confia en el credito para poder lograrlo. La señora Maria tiene 26 años y dos hijos, su casa es de caña y tiene una buena ubicación para sus ventas.

loans.use: To purchase a glass show case to display products.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia has store from which she sells supplies, her locale is located in a commercial center and near to an education center, from which she has many customers. Her husband helps her with her business as well as her eldest daughter after school.

She began her business by selling vegetables one year ago, with money from the liquidation of a job she had as domestic worker. Since then, her sales have increased and every day she sees more customers.

With the loan, she hopes to buy more merchandise in order to stock her store as her customers increase every day and her location allows her businees to be profitable. Sonia's goal is to have a large locale through which she could make higher earnings and to give a better education to her children.

Sonia is 37 years old and has four children, who all go to local schools, her home is made of cement and she has a stable family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. Sonia tiene una tienda de los cuales vende víveres, su local esta ubicado en un sector comercial y cercano a un centro educativo por lo cual tiene gran afluencia de clientes, en su negocio le ayuda el esposo y su hija mayor después de sus estudios Ella inicio su negocio con la venta de legumbres hace un año con un dinero producto de la liquidación de un trabajo que tenia como empleada domestica, desde entonces sus ventas han crecido y cada día por ende sus clientes. Con el crédito que le otorguen quiere comprar mas mercadería para surtir su local ya que sus clientes aumentan cada día y su ubicación permite que su negocio sea rentable. La meta de Sonia es tener un local grande para de esta manera pueda mejorar su economía y poderles dar un mejor estudio a sus hijos La señora tiene 37 años, y 4 hijos, de los cuales estudian en centros educativos cercanos, su casa es de cemento y tiene una estabilidad familiar

loans.use: Buy her food in bulk

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Don Ricardo has a locale in his home, from which he sells articles of necessity and school supplies. He began his business two years ago when he recieved a bonus from the company where he worked for $500 with which he started to work.

At the beginning he only sold vegetables and dry grains, which he bought on wholesale. These days, he continues to sell groceries, as well as other items. With the advantage of living in front of a school, he decided to sell school supplies and stationary, which attracted more customers.With the loan, Ricardo hopes to purchase more products and start a small line of toys, that he noticed were in high demand.

Ricardo is certain that this the loan opportunity he will increase his sales and improve the conditions of his store. Ricardo is 28 years old and has four children, one son who is "special needs" and two who go to school. His home is made of cement, and he is certain that with the prosperity of his business he will be able to give a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Don Ricardo tiene un local en su casa donde vende articulos de primera necesidad y artículos escolares. El empezó su negocio desde hace dos años cuando recibio utilidades de la empresa donde trabajaba $500 con los que comenzó a trabajar.

Al comienzo solo vendía legumbres y granos secos que compraba a precio de mayorista. En estos dias continúa vendiendo productos de abarrotes, ademas ha incrementado más productos y con la ventaja de vivir frente a una escuela decidio vender artículos escolares y papelería lo cual le ha traído mayor clientela. Con este prestamo Ricardo espera comprar más productos y y agregar una pequeña linea de juguetes que ha notado tiene gran demanda.

Ricardo confia que con la oportunidad del prestamo va a incrementar sus ventas y asi mejorar las condiciones del negocio que tiene. Ricardo tiene 28 años y 4 hijos de los cuales uno es niño especial y dos estudian su casa de cemento el tiene la certeza que con la prosperidad de su negocio podra dar a su familia una mejores opciones de vida.

loans.use: Buy more products for his store

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Mr. Angel is a traveling salesman of watchbands, women's belts and shoes, which in his zone where he works are from the province of Guayas. He began selling only sunglasses, with a loan from a friend for $100, but after requests augmented, he began to carry other items as well.

At first he only sold sunglasses, then watchbands. Now he also sells other items such as shoes and imitation jewelery which his customers request. With this loan, Angel wishes to purchase more merchandise, because his actual stock doesn't always meet his customers' needs, and as he gives them an excellent service and good prices, his products are highly sought after.

He is confident that the increase in merchandise will aide him win more satisfied customers and higher earnings. Angel is 36 years old, has five children, three of whom are in school, and his home is made of reed. He is sur that with the progress of his business he will be able to give a higher quality of life to his family and a better education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Angel se dedica a la venta ambulante de de correas, cinturones para mujeres y zapatos que sus zonas de trabajo son los balnearios de la provincia del Guayas. El con $100 que presto a un amigo comenzo vendiendo solo gafas y luego debido a los pedidos y necesidades llevo otros productos.

Primero solo vendia gafas, luego vendio correas. Actualmente vende a más de los otros articulos, zapatos y bisuteria playera que han sido solicitados por sus clientes. Con este crédito Angel quiere comprar mas mercaderia pues con la que compra actualmente deja a muchos clientes sin atender y como les da una excelente atencio y un buen precio sus productos son muy solicitados.

El tiene la certeza que con el incremento de mercaderia que le haga a su negocio seguramente podra tener mayor cantidad de clientes satisfechos y mejores ganancias. Angel tiene 36 años, cinco hijos de los cuales estan estudiando tres y su casa es de caña, El esta seguro que con el progreso de su negocio dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y mejor educacion a sus hijos.

loans.use: Supply his store.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Mr. Felix has a store from which he sells articles of necessity as well as school supplies. The store was originally owned by his father, and Felix worked helping in the store, and when his father retired, he gave it to Felix.

At the beginning he only sold vegetables and then began to sell groceries up until today when he now sells school supplies. With this loan, Angel wishes to purchase more merchandise, because his current stocks often do not meet his customers needs, and because he gives his customers excellent service and very good prices, his merchandise is very sought after.

He is sure that with the injection of stationary items on his shelves, he will be able to increase his number of customers as well as his profits. Felix is 28 years old, has two children who are not school aged yet, and his home is made of cement. He is confident that with the progress of his business he will be able to give a better life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Felix tiene una despensa donde vende articulos de primera necesidad y articulos escolares. Esta despenda en primera instancia era del papa y Felix trabajaba ayudando en el negocio luego el papa le regalo la tienda cuando el se hizo de compromiso.

Al principio solo vendia legumbres y luego empezo a vender abarrotes hasta que en la actualidad vende articulos escolares. Con este credito Angel quire comprar mas mercaderia pues con la que compra actualmente deja a muchos clientes sin atender y como les da una excelente atencio y un buen precio sus productos son muy solicitados.

El tiene la seguridad que con la inyeccionde articulos de papeleria que haga a su negocio positivamente podra tener mayor cantidad de clientes y asi mejores ganancias. Felix tiene 28 años, dos hijos que aun no estudia y su casa es de cemento, El confia que con el progreso de su negocio dara a su familia una vida en mejores condiciones de las que tiene ahora.

loans.use: To adquire more merchandise.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Sovann has been married for more than 22 years. She has 4 children, 1 daughter and 3 sons. Her daughter is also married and lives with her husband. Sovann is busy with her farm. Her husband, when free from the farm, plays classical Khmer music with his team in the same village, and he is also a motor taxi driver. After receiving loans from MAXIMA for the second time, the living of the family is getting better and they have some money to buy one cow. She continues to borrow for the third loan with the total amount of $700. She is going to use this loan amount to prepare her farm by plowing the land,  cutting grasses, continuing to plant vegetables and constructing a shed for the cow. This family will not have any problem to repay the loan.

loans.use: Plow the land, cut grasses and construct a shed for the cow

payments.comment:
Dear lenders,

Mrs. Sovann EK already paid off her loan. Thank you very much to all lenders.

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Mr. Washinton has a bar where he sells snacks, within a school in his community. This bar originally belonged to his brother-in-law, but after he left, Mr. Washington took charge.

At the beginning he sold snacks and later he began to sell bagged lunches, which he prepared alongside his wife. He now sells lunches on commission from various parents who children go to the school and who cannot prepare the lunches themselves. With the loan, he wishes to buy more supplies, as the demand for school lunches has increased and every time he offers higher quality products, his business increases.

Washington is sure that with the additional supplies, he will attract more customers and earn higher profits. Washington is 35 years old, has three children and his home is made of reed. He is sure that with the progress of his business he will be able to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El Sr. Washington tiene un bar donde vende golosina (snacks) dentro de una escuela de su localidad. Este bar en primer pertenecia al concuñado pero despues de quedar despedido lo asumio el.

En un principio vendia golosina y despues empezo hacer fiambres (bagged lunches) que preparaba junto con su esposa. Actualmente vende almuerzos a pedido de varios padres de familia de la escula que no les pueden preparar el almuerzo a sus hijos. Con el prestamo quiere comprar más mercaderia pues la cantidad de niños ha aumentado y como cada vez ofrece mejores productos la clientela esta aumentando.

Washington tiene la seguridad que con el incremento de que haga a su negocio positivamente podra tener mayor cantidad de clientes y asi mejores ganancias. Washington tiene 35 años, tres hijos que estudian y su casa es de caña. El tiene la certeza que con el progreso de su negocio dara a su familia una vidad mejor.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Vannary

texts.en: Vannary has been married for 28 years and has 4 children, 1 daughter and 3 sons. She is a pharmacist and medical practitioner. She is selling medicine at home and treating people in the villages. She has succeeded in providing medical services in her village. Her husband is a driver and works at the Road and Bridge Construction Company. Two of her sons are also drivers. One son is in the business of transporting bricks in villages, and he has 5 workers for this business. With the given loan amount of $600, Vannary can add with her saved money in order to buy one truck for her son in the business of transporting bricks. She is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem. The current loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Buy one truck for transporting brick to clients in the villages.

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Vannary YAB has enough money to pay off her loan early before contract.
Thank you.

loans.name: Rohimas

texts.en: Rohimas has been married for 32 years and has 7 children, 4 daughters and 3 sons. Both she and her husband are doing business as fishermen. They continued from their old generation. They have been engaged in this business since 1979. Some of their children are also assisting them in fishing in the river. One of their daughters brings fish to sell in the market. She will use the given loan of $600 to purchase more fishing nets and one boat engine and spend some amount for repairing the fishing boat. She is capable of handling the loan and could repay it without any problem. The current loan term is 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing more fishing nets and one boat engine and for repairing the fishing boat

payments.comment: This loan has been paid in full as of early December.  Mrs. Lors has since applied for a new loan of $1000 to further expand her and her husband's business.  Thank you very much for your support.

loans.name: Chran

texts.en: Mrs. Chran N. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and seven children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  N. and her husband work as merchants, buying coconuts and rice crops from farmers.   They then take these crops to the market, where they re-sell them for a profit.  However, their business is limited because they can only transport a small amount of crops on their motorcycle.  As such, they are requesting a loan in order to purchase a small car for business transportation.  They currently can make about $7.50 per day (comibined), but with a car they would be able to expand their business.  To help with the family's finances, three of their children work at a nearby garment factory, where they can each make about $60 per month.  The remaining four children are students.  In the future, N. and her husband hope that they will be able to further expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase a small car in order to transport crops from farm to market

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Chran Nak for repaying her loan early! Because of your loan, she was able to purchase a car to transport more goods to market, raising the family's daily income.

Chran Nak and her family appreciate you offering him a loan, without which she would not be able to expand her business. 

We thank you for supporting poor Cambodian entrepreneurs and hope you will invest in CREDIT MFI clients in the future!

Many thanks,
Jordyan Edmiston, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia
and the entire CREDIT MFI staff

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes N. is an active member of Life In Africa at We center Gulu. She is a married woman, living with her husband and two children. In addition, she is also raising another child who is her husband's from a previous marriage.

Agnes was born in 1975 in a village called Lace-kocot in Pader district, Northern Uganda. She was not able to get much education because of lack of finances, and she married much earlier than she would have wished. But she is a hard worker and has learned a great deal from Life in Africa and their many craft projects. She has also grown in self-esteem through her contact with the LiA group.

At one time, Agnes ran a small kiosk selling foodstuffs, but she and her husband sold this business to buy a motorcycle. Her husband earns income providing transport in the area. To suplement their income, Agnes sells charcoal and also sells crafts to LiA. However, she knows that the small income she earns, about 80,000 Uganda shillings per month, is not enough to fully support the family.

Agnes' plan is to open a restaraunt. She has selected a good location in Kanyagoga, near the army and the hospital. This will give her a good customer base since the army, hospital staff, patients, and families of patients are in need of cooked food. She will serve a variety of local dishes and she is confident that she will be able to make a profit of at least 100,000 Uganda shillings per month which will greatly improve the living standard for the family.

To start this business, Agnes is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 150), which she will use to purchase the utensils and equipment needed. She plans to employ two waitresses which will also leave her free to continue with her other income-generating activities. Agnes believes she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months.

Below is her budget plan (amounts indicated are in Uganda shillings (Ush)--the = symbol means Ush):

Saucepan..............................30,000=

Plates................................9,000=@2dozen

Cups..................................9,000=@2dozen ,br>
Spoons/forks............................9,000=

Two water containers..................4,000=

10 chairs..............................20,000= ,br>
Tables................................10,000=

Charcoal..............................13,000=

Charcoal stove........................10,000=
br> Water... ..............................8,000=

2 waitresses............................@20,000=each a month

Food items.............................50,000=

2 Flasks................................23,000=

Medical test............................5,000=

Licence................................10,000=a year

Total................................**250,000=** (US$ 150) .

loans.use: Buying utensils, etc.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Minh's husband has asthma and epilepsy so he can’t earn money. Because his illness is serious, he needs his relatives  to take care of him and must spend much money for his medicines. They have two children, the son is still going to school. The youngest daughter must quit her class to work . They cannot  farm because they do not have the capital and because of the family health issues. Minh works as a cleaner at a public toilet in a local market and earns average 600.000vnd/month. She dreams of having a small electric motor to be able to quickly clean  the floor of toilet.

loans.use: service

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris started working with Charity for Peace in 2003. He is originally from one of the villages in the Amuru district called Anaka. The 1986 war made them seek refuge in Karuma in one of the refugees camps. It wasn't until the year 2001 when Morris moved to Gulu with his family for education. He attended Gulu central high school for his A-levels and is currently single.

Morris started working at World Food Programme for 6 months, then he was with Caritas Gulu for a further 6 months. When his contract ended, he came back with the money raised and established a small barber shop together with a water tap. In this way, he has earned a living to supplement occasional short-term contracts with humanitarian organizations in Gulu. Throughout this time he also volunteered in the evenings, taking care of night commuter children at Chatrity for Peace Foundation. In August 2006, he joined Life in Africa where he is currently working.as a gallery salesman and store manager.

Because of the unreliable power in the district, Moris intends to get a loan of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 150) to stablise power to run his machines. He believes that his barbershop would be able to attract more customers because of the stable power. In case of power outages, other barbershops nearby would fail to operate. Morris says the labor cost would be cut as he had employed someone earlier to operate the barber shop.

During the times when there was no power, Morris used to earn only 15,000 Uganda shillings a day, but he believes if he is given the loan he would double his daily income. Morris plans to repay the loan after a period of 3 months.

Below is his budget plan (note that the symbol = means Uganda shillings):

Generator.......................120,000=

Hollow section (container frame)..................100,000=

Fuel.............................30,000=

Total...........................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying a generator

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James O. is 35 years old and is a member of Life in Africa. He is currently working with LIFE IN AFRICA WE Center Gulu (Uganda) as a security guard and he also is a volunteer with LiA's partner, Charity For Peace, which is a non-profit organization caring for night commuter children in Northern Uganda. James lives in Koro Lapainat village with his family.

James' mother died when he was young and he grew up living only with his father. James is married now and has seven children of his own. His main challenge is paying school fees for his children. He is working and can feed them but in order to provide school fees for seven children, he knows he will need additional money. To earn this extra money, he plans to start a business as a produce trader.

James plans to buy sesame from the producers and then bring it to Koro where he will sell it from a space he will rent. His wife will be helping him run this business while he continues with his current job. Sesame is a common ingredient in many local dishes, so there is a market for it even in very poor households.

According his business plan, James will earn a profit of 30% of the capital injected. This, added to his regular salary, will enable him to improve the lives of his family and provide needed school fees. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 250,000 Uganda shillings (US$ 150) to start this business. He believes he will be able to repay this loan in 3 months.

Business plan (note that the amounts are listed in Uganda shillings, indicated by the symbol =):

Buying empty bags.............................................5,000=

Transport....................................................30,000=

Market dues..................................................20,000=

Rent.............................................20,000=

Ropes................................................5,000=

Buying sesame.............................170,000=

Grand total.........................................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: to buy produce

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George O. is Director of Ugandan Communities at LIFE IN AFRICA. He is married with five children. All the children are in school. With his wife and children, George lives in the industrial area Kirombe parish, where he is operating a small grocery shop business that earns a stable additional income for his family.

George is helped at the shop by his aunt whom he pays at the end of the month. George has a stock worth 1,000,000 = (Uganda shillings). He buys the merchandise from Gulu town, and sells it to the community in the industrial area. His place of business is a very busy place because of many activities around which give him a very good atmosphere for his business.

George's plan for his loan is to add on some more stock and he normally gets 60% profit per month. He is requesting a loan of 250,000= (Uganda shillings), and he intends to pay it back within 3 months

Business plan (note that all amounts are in Uganda shillings indicated by the symbol =):

Buying the merchandise:

(sugar, soap, salt, cooking oil, soda, water,).......................245,000=

Transport:......................................................5,000=

Total: ......................................................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Restocking Shop

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny N. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia.  N. and her husband run a business where they purchase cabinets from furniture-makers, then sell these cabinets to people throughout the province of Kampong Cham.  They are able to make about $7 per day from this business activity.  The couple has three children, all of whom are students.  N. and her husband hope to use this loan in order to expand their business by purchasing more cabinets to sell.  Additionally, they hope that they will have leftover money from the loan to repair their house to protect it from leaking during the rainy season.  In the future, N.'s husband hopes to use his skills to work as a mechanic and open a shop from the family's home.

loans.use: To purchase more cabinets to sell for her business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Ny Nak for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Stora

texts.en: Stora lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a tailor and she has good work experience. She is a widow supporting her family since her husband's death 8 years ago during the war. She took her first cycle group loan and bought sewing machines and does a good business and helps her family. Now she wants to take anther loan to expand her business and buy extra materials for tailoring.  She wants  make a better future for her children. She is happy with all her family.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for tailoring

loans.name: Joska

texts.en:
Joska A. is a 35-year-old member of Life in Africa's WE Centre Gulu. Her husband died of an operation in 1996, but she does not know what sickness he was suffering from. Joska has seven children and three dependants who are orphans (from her brother who died of HIV/AIDs). Her three youngest plus those of her brother are in primary school.

Joska sells produce (rice) to get money to cover school fees and daily needs. She buys this rice from a market in Amuru District and sells it to consumers in one of the markets within Gulu Town. She also makes paper beads at Life in Africa and gets some money out of this, which has been helping her with the expenses of daily life. Her problem is paying school fees for these children she is left with.

Joska has saved 80,000= (Uganda shillings) from her business of selling rice. She is requesting a loan of 250,000= (Ush) to add on to her savings and expand her business. Her business location is in a strategic position near the prison barracks and school, so she believes she can sell more than her current capital allows. She hopes to get 40% of her capital in profit per month. She will be selling the rice herself since she does not have much work to do elsewhere and she will believes she will be able to pay back that loan within six months

Her business plan is below (amounts in Ush; = means Uganda shillings):

Transport .........................................40,000=

Buying rice........................................130,000=

Rice Hulling .......................................70,000=

Market dues...........................................4,000=

Contingency..........................................6,000=

Total..............................................250,000= (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying Rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary L. was born on December 24, 1973 in Padhe district which is located in the northern part of Uganda. She is a responsible widow with a daughter age 13 in primary seven. Mary was forced to stop her own studies very young because her parents died and this left no one to pay her school fees. The parents died when there was crossfire between LRA rebels and the Government troops in 1986.

In 2003 Mary became involved with the Charity for Peace night commuter center where she was handling over 2,500 kids who come there seeking night shelter because they fear the rebel group called the LRA. Mary volunteered as a caregiver for the children and became a member of Life in Africa when they opened the WE Center on the Charity of Peace property. This is a real voluntary service that she performed without payment.

During the daytime, Mary is a committed farmer, and she also does some petty businesses in the market place after her garden work is finished. She does well, but she now needs to expand her business to increase her savings, especially since her daughter will enter high school next year.

Mary is seeking a loan in the amount of 250,000/= (USD 150). This money will make it possible to buy more goods for her produce business to add to what she grows, and it will provide her with a store in which to sell her goods. She is confident that with her experience she will be a success and will be able to provide more for her daughter. She believes she will be able to repay this loan in 6 months. She will be getting a profit of 135,000/= monthly from the business.

Below is her loan plan:-

04 Empty sacks : ................4,000/=Ushillings.

01Basin :........................3,000/=Ushillings .

05 Cups : ........................2,200/=Ushillings.

Store:...........................18,000/=U shillings.

Transport: .......................30,000/=U shillings.

Buying simsim:...................90,000/=Ushillings.

Buying 1 sack of beans :...........80,000 Ushillings.

Market dues :...............13,000 Ushillings per month.

Contigency:..........................9,800 Ushillings.

Total:...........................250,000/=Ushillings (US$ 150)

loans.use: Buying produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more lemons for her business

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en: Z. Tofiq is 53  and married with 7 children. His small store of women’s clothes brings him good profit but for a big family, the store's earnings are only enough to sustain a hand-to-mouth existence. To improve his family's situation and help provide better conditions for them, Tofiq has borrowed 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To enlarge his clothes store and buy more stock for it.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima Z. is proud to be the owner of a small store selling women's clothes in Sabirabad Central Bazaar. She is married and has 3 children. She has a dream to open her own store and for this aim she applied for a $1,200 loan.

loans.use: To repair her store

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mrs. Mean S. is 33 years old, married and a mother of four children, who all attend school. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia and makes her living by running a grocery store with about $1.30/day in revenue. Meanwhile, her husband works on a farm raising pigs and other domestic animals for a meager sum. To service her family's expenses and keep investing in her business, S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase rice seeds for her plantation and to purchase different grocery products to meet her clients' demands. In the future, she hopes to have sufficient money to improve her farm by adding more pigs and seeds to generate an additional income.

loans.use: To purchase rice crops and grocery products to invest in her store

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem S. is 28 years old, married and  a mother of three children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell water convolvulus and fruits at a market and typically make about $3/day in revenue. One of her children is a student and the rest are too young to attend school. S. is asking for a $400 loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport her vegetables from and to market. For the next year, she plans to save enough money to buy another stand and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport  her water convovulus to the market.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Kem Sophal start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Phet

texts.en: Mrs. Phet V., 26-year-old mother of one child, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is talented and has experience working in a tailoring business which contributes to her about $3/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, is a motor-taxi driver and typically makes about $2 extra for his household. In order to get additional money and keep improving her tailoring business, V. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a motorcycle for her husband and clothes for her inventory. She hopes, for the next coming year, to have enough money to own a tailoring store at a market, where she can increase her savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to run a business

payments.comment: Congratulations to Phet Vandy for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung T. is 44 years old, married  and a mother of five children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, cooking meals and looking after the children, while her husband (pictured here because T. was unavailable) is the one who supports the entire family by working as a construction foreman. He typically makes around $3/day in revenue. Furthermore, two of her children are employed at the local garment factory, and the rest are students. Because he needs some construction tools to operate his business, Kung T. hopes the loan will help her and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a spinning wheel and fleece

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en: Faiq A. is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorny-Karabakh. He is 32 and married with 5 children. He opened his small pharmacy in 2000 by borrowing some money from a friend. He has now decided to enlarge his shop to include a new section for optics.  To reach this goal, he borrowed $1,200 in 2002 from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To enlarge his pharmacy

loans.name: Phau

texts.en: Mrs. Phau P. is 36 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a farm growing crops and a variety of vegetables. Typically, she makes a meager sum from her output, while her husband is a construction foreman and makes about $3/day in revenue. To help in financing and servicing the family's expenses, Phau P. is asking for a loan amount of $500 to purchase a motorcycle for one of her children to operate a business as a motor-taxi driver. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family's savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her child to run a business

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Phau Phal start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Jemiyyet

texts.en: A. Jemiyyet is 39 and married with a big family of 4 children. He has one calf and to make his small business successful, he has applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase a cow and an additional calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: A. Ruslan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 2003. He is married with one child. He purchased a cow some time ago but his poor financial situation has prevented him  from buying a calf to expand his business. Therefore, he has applied to Aqroinvest CU and borrowed 1200 USD  to buy another cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad H. is a farmer in Bilasuvar city. He is married and has 6 children. He is very happy that he is the owner of  a small flock of sheep. However, he would like to improve his family 's life by purchasing one more cow and calf so that he can open a farm. The need to buy these animals was why he applied for a $1,200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Osman

texts.en: I. Osman  is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He is the very successful business owner of a small bakery. Here, in a small, narrow room, his older daughter and wife bake bread from early morning till late night.Therefore, Osman has applied for a 1200 USD loan to improve his wife and daughter's working conditions by purchasing a ventilation system.

loans.use: To enlarge his bakery and purchase a ventilation system for better working conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more charcoal stock

loans.name: Qarib

texts.en: Qarib I. is proud of his small farm where he has 1 cow producing good milk and a calf. Qarib is 52 and married with 5 children. He is planning in the future to purchase another cow and calf and start to sell milk to the local people. He applied for a $1,200 loan from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en: I. Zeynab is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which she left in 1993. She is 5 and married with 5 children. She has 3 cows and a small shed in which to keep the cattle. She applied for a 1200 USD loan to build a new shed and buy one cow.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and a new shed

loans.name: Mikayil

texts.en: M. Mikayil is 38 and married with 4 children. He is the owner of a small food store in Bilasuvar. His dream is to enlarge his store and start to sell gifts and accessories. To approach his dream, he has decided to borrow 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: Going to broaden his food store

loans.name: Ching

texts.en: Mrs. Ching K., 58 years old and a widow with four children, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a struggling mother, since her husband passed away many years ago. She makes her living by growing rice crops and vegetables and usually earns around $2/day. To supplement the entire household, 3 of her children work at a garment factory and contribute their salary every month. The rest attend school. Eventually, Ching K. hopes the loan will help her purchase a piece of land to maximize her crops as well as increasing her output. In the future, she would like to own another piece of land so that she will make additional income to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow crops

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng C. is 35 years old, married and a mother of 3 children, who are students. She makes her living by selling Khmer noodles and porridge along the roadside of her village and typically makes a meager profit. To service the family's expenses, her husband is both a construction worker and a farmer who normally makes about $4/day. Meanwhile,  C. is asking for $300 in order to purchase a piece of land to grow a variety of crops. With this, she hopes her family will make more income to increase the family's savings. It is important to say that her family would like to own another piece of land to increase her crops for the next coming year.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow crops

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
3 years ago, Mrs. N., 42  years old, opened her own shoe shop and  small, shoe factory.  She sells different kinds of women's shoes like sandles, closed shoes and others .Her monthly rent is Rs 5000($77). She began her business with a loan from BPW Patan. Now she is requesting her third loan to further expand her business for purchasing raw materials. Her economic condition is low so she needs a loan to further expand her business. With her increased income she plans to help her husband in the family's financial matters.
Her husband's name is Sobiyat Man N.. He is college teacher at the Patan Campus. Mrs. N. has two son,13 and 8 year old.The youngest daughter is in grade 6 and  the oldest daughter is in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe making

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en: H. Mahammadali is 46 years old and married with 5 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. H. runs a small food store and has applied for a 1200 USD loan to improve his business and cover his large family's needs.

loans.use: Going to enlarge his food store

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim M. was born in Bilasuvar and has lived there his entire life. He is married and has 5 children. His farm has just 2 cows, the proceeds from which are not enough to cover his family's needs. Added to this, he needs to improve the quality of the conditions in which he houses and breeds his cattle. For this purpose, Nazim applied for a $1,200 loan.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: M. Nabi is 46 and has a large family of 6. He has one cow, but his family's weak financial situation inspired him to purchase another cow and a calf. To do so, he borrowed 1200USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Semendar

texts.en: N. Semendar lives and runs his small business in Saatli. He has one cow. His family consists of 4 children. To feed such a big family he needs one more cow and a calf. Therefore, to achieve better living conditions for his family, he has applied for a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhagabati L., 42 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 15 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. 
Before starting her own business, Mrs L. took a 6 month training course in tailoring when she was younger from Sunita tailor shop  near her town.
She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add  to her family's income and support her children's education.
Her husband's name is Sahadev L. and he is a tourist guide. She has two daughters and one son, 19 ,20 and 21 years old respectively. The two daughters just took the +2 education exam and  the oldest son is working and studying abroad.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Khaqani

texts.en: O. Khaqani is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. He is 28 and has 1 child. His small business consists of two sheep, a cow and a calf. He is hoping to broaden his business and open a small farm. He has borrowed 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to buy 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and on calf

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en: M. Sabir  is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. He is 41 and is married with 5 children. Since 1994, he has owned a small farm business with 1 cow and 1 calf. He is going to purchase one more cow and another calf. He has applied for a loan of 1200USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita K., 50 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 25 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. 
Before starting her own business, Mrs K. took a 6 month training course in tailoring near her town. Several years ago, her husband, Uttam K., died and now she has sole responsibility for her 5 children.
She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. Her economic condition is very low to fulfill the basic need for her family. So she need loan to expand her business to earn more profit to fulfill her family basic need.
She has two sons and three daughters. All  four children have completed SLC level and the youngest son is in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy raw material for tailoring shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase stock (detergents and disinfectant) and packaging materials

loans.name: Chandra Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandra Laxmi S., 40 years old, is a tailor in the town of Volakhel in Patan.  She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, Blouse, Ladies long dress, Makhshi, and others. 
Before starting her own business, Mrs S. took a 6 month training course in tailoring when she was younger.
She plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.
Her husband's name is Bidya Ratna S. and he makes brass religious statues. She has two daughters, 17 and 11 years old. The youngest daughter is in grade 7 and the oldest daughter just took the SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam this year. The oldest daughter also helps her mother in her shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring shop

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Q. Ramil is 22 and has been a young businessman since 2004. The idea of opening a small store came to him when he was a child. Now he is the owner of a food store in Bilasuvar. To improve the conditions of his store he applied for a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To improve the conditions of his store

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en: Q. Oktay is 25 and has lived in Saatli since his childhood. His weak financial situation prompted him to buy a cow some years ago. Now he is broadening his business by buying another cow and a calf. He applied for a loan of 1200USD from Aqroinvest CU.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Shirkhan

texts.en: Q. Shirkhan is a 41 year old father of 4 children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He began his business by buying a cow, and later decided to purchase another cow and a calf.  To reach his plans, he borrowed 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en: R. Khanlar is 27 and married with 2 children. He runs a small cattle business consisting of 1 cow. He likes his job and plans to broaden it by buying another cow and a calf in the future. To approach this goal, he applied for a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Sabit

texts.en: S. Sabit is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 1993. He is married and has 2 children. His small business consists of 1 cow. He is going to purchase another cow and a calf. In 2002, he borrowed 1200 USD to cover his business needs.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru:
Masuda N. started her business selling chewing gum, batteries and other small items. In 2003 she became a client of MicroInvest. Today she has her own shop, located in the ‘Ozodi’ market place. She personally travels to Uratube to buy her stock & supplies.

Masuda N. is very punctual and promptly pays back her loans. She is married with two growing children. She would like to receive a $1000 loan to help increase her inventory and sales.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Негматова Маъсуда начинала свой бизнес с продажи: жвачек, батареек и разных мелочей. В 2003 г. Маъсуда стала клиенткой Микроинвест. В настоящее время у нее свой магазин, расположенный на рынке «Озоди». За товарами ездит сама в Ура-тюбе. Негматова Маъсуда очень пунктуальна и вовремя погашает свой займ. Она замужем и у нее подрастают двое детей. Она хочет получить 1000$ для увеличения объема товара.

loans.use: Increase inventory and sales

loans.name: Banovsha

texts.en: V. Banovsha is the proud owner of a small herd of sheep. Banovsha is married and has 4 children. She is 43 and is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh. She has borrowed 1200 USD from Aqroinvest CU to purchase one cow and one calf.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Sarigul

texts.en: Z. Sarigul is a very energetic women of 51. She lives in Sabirabad and is married with 3 children. Sarigul's one cow produces good milk. She has applied for a 1200USD loan to buy another cow and a calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop and start a kiosk

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.ru:
Khairullo M. became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. Before joining MicroInvest he sold sweets/candy, cookies etc. Today he sells rice in the ‘Ozodi’ market place. He has been doing this for two years and his business is flourishing. He is married with three children. His wife helps out in his business.

In addition to selling rice, Khairullo also works as a builder, renovating apartments.

Khairullo would like a loan of $867 to increase his inventory and sales, as well as to maximize profits. P.S. The photo is of his wife.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

В 2005 г. Мирзоев Хайрулло стал клиентом Микроинвест. До вступления он продавал: конфеты, вафли и т.д. В настоящий момент он занимается продажей риса на рынке «Озоди». В этом бизнесе он уже 2 года, его бизнес процветает. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена помогает ему по бизнесу. Кроме продажи риса Хайрулло занимается ремонтом квартир. Хйрулло хочет получить 867$ для расширения и увеличения товарооборота, а также получения максимальной прибыли. P. S. На фотографии его жена.

loans.use:
Expansion of his business

расширения своего бизнеса

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en: P. Tuty is 49 years old, divorced and has 5 children. She is engaged in business for over 11 years. She lives with her aging parents, who helped her to started business and gave her money. Tuty faced many difficulties but after some time she expanded and developed her business well. Two of her children are old enough to help her. They sell her products when she is away to buy at the wholesale market. For the summer season she plans to buy clothes, for which she would like a loan. Also she intends to expand her business by trading in children shoes. For this she needs a place, where her daughter will work and be part owner.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: Tojiniso is married and has 2 children. She worked at a clothing factory for over 8 years but after the collapse of USSR, the salary of seamstress was not enough to support a family. In 1994 Tojiniso borrowed $100 from relatives and started her business. From the beginning she knew the success in her business depended on variety of goods she sold. Often, she took individual orders to meet the special request of her customers. Today Tojiniso has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She brings her goods from Istaravshan,Tadjikistan. Tojiniso would like to borrow $1200 to purchase modern clothes for the summer season. In future she wishes to open a shop in the center of Khujand.

loans.use: Purchase modern clothes

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is engaged in business for over 5 years. She is mother of 3 children. Her trade place located at the 3 floor of the crowded central market at Badri Munir. She is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur, selling women’s clothes. She has a lot of clients. She always has a variety of beautiful goods Her goods are high quality and meet the demand for modern clothes. She brings her goods from Bishkek, Kirgisistan. Her monthly income comes to around $800.
She would like to increase her turnover of goods and requests additional $1200 for her next purchase from the wholesale market.

loans.use: Purchase modern clothes

loans.name: Abdugaffur

texts.en: Abdugafuris is married and has 4 children. They all live with his parents. His parents are pensioners and his children go to school. Abdugafur and his wife earn money for his big familyby selling toys and children clothes. At first it was difficult to start but soon he expanded and developed his business well. He became a client of MicroInvest in 2005 and step-by-step he has increased the loan amount from $100 to $700. He and his wife have 2 places for trade in open-air market of  Mastchoh. Of course today they have constant clients and satisfied of their place. In the future Abdugafur plans to use a loan for buying seasonal (summer) goods.  He plans to use the profit for the reconstruction of his house. After that he can stay there with his family and one of the rooms he can equip for the shop. His parents and children can help him by the trading in this shop.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Ambaroy

texts.en:
Ambaroy has owned her business for over 11 years.  Befor,e she worked in a carpet knitting association. She is married and has 4 children.  All of them go to school. Due the difficulties of supporting a family Ambaroy started her business in the open-air market. She worked without days off in winter and in summer.
Today she rents a small place in little open-air shop and sells her goods there. She sells summer women shoes. She has regular clients and tries to satisfy their requirements. In winter she sells a national rubber overshoes (galoshes) and slippers for outdoors.
Ambaroy became a client of Micro Invest in 2005 and her first loan was $160. Today she wants to increase the turnover of her goods and she requests $500. She plans to buy 200 pairs of summer shoes (chips), 300 pairs of open summer slippers and 100 pairs of children shoes.

loans.use: Increase the turnover of goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
My name is Beatriz M.. I worked as a corn miller, this work is very good because many people need to mill their corn to make tortilla dough. Because of tortillas are part of the basic meal in our communities, people mill a lot of corn. At this moment, I have problem with the miller engine and I need to repair it to worker better with my customers and therefore to generate more revenue; which is necessary to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Beatriz M. me dedico a moler maiz, este trabajo es muy bueno ya que mucha gente necesita moler su maiz para hacer masa para las tortillas y como las tortillas son un alimento indispensable en nuestra comunidad la gente muele mucho maiz, en estos momentos tengo problemas con el motor de mi molino y necesito repararlo para poder atender mejor a mis clientes y asi generar mas ganancias las cuales las necesito para alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motor of my mill, water, and oil.

loans.name: Digxi Xiomara

texts.en:
My name is Digxi B., I work selling used clothing. I own my business for two years. My customers prefer to buy from me because I carry good quality clothing at a low price. But at this moment I need to increase my inventory to increase my sells and profits to pay the education of my son who is starting school and to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Digxi B. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes me prefieren ya que vendo buena ropa y a precios muy bajos, pero en estos momentos necesito tener mas inventario para tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias ya que tengo que pagar los estudios de mi hijo que esta ingresando a la escuela y tambien para la alimentacion de mi familia.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Dilma Maribel

texts.en:
My name is Dilma P.. I sell plastic goods like tubs, glasses, plates, bags, sheets, pichers, baskets, buckets, hooks, and garbage bins. I've been doing this for 3 years and my daughter helps me to sell my products. At this moment I'd like to increase my inventory because the demand for these products is high and I sell a lot. With the profits I make I want to remodel my business and provide for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dilma P. me dedico a la venta de utencilios de plastico como ser pilas, vasos, platos, bolsas, panas, picheles, canastas, baldes, ganchos, baldes para basura, actividad que realizo desde hace unos 3 años, tengo la ayuda de mi hija para la venta de mi producto, en estos momentos necesito tener mas inventario ya que la demanda de estos productos es buena y hay muchas ventas, con las ganancias que obtenga deseo remodelar mi negocio y alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy all sorts of plastic goods

loans.name: Dunia Aracely

texts.en:
My name is Dunia M.. I sell ladies cosmetics. I've owned my business for 1 year now. This time of the year, sales are good and I want to increase my inventory to be able to sell more. With the profits I'd like to pay for schooling of my two children and also to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dunia M., me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos para dama, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, en esta epoca del año son buenas las ventas y necesito tener mas inventario para poder vender mas y con las ganancias que obtenga deseo pagar la escuela de mis dos hijos y tambien cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: To buy cremes, perfumes, deodorants, lotions, shampoo, and baby sandals.

loans.name: Evelminda

texts.en:
My name is Evelminda Z.. I product and sell tortillas. I've owned my business for 1 year now. In my community, people eat lots of tortillas and that why I'm in this business. At this point, I need to buy more dough and firewood to increase my production. With my profits I want to remodel the stove that I use to make my tortillas, and I will use them to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Evelminda Z. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, en nuestra comunidad la gente come mucha tortilla y por eso es que me dedico a este trabajo pero en estos momentos necesito comprar mas masa y leña para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi fogon en el cual hago mis tortillas tambien cubrir con los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar,.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, caulk, salt, water, firewood, and matches

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en:
My name is Fidelia G.. I sell groceries and I have had my business for 3 years. I have many customers as I sell my products at a low price. At this moment I would like to have a broader assortment of products are these days sales is good. With the profits I hope to be able to employ someone to help me tend the store because I can't even get a rest with this many customers. In addition, I hope to use my profits to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fidelia G. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo a un precio bajo mis productos, en estos momentos necesito tener mas variedad de productos ya que estos dias son buenos para las ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder contratar una muchacha que me ayude para la atencio de mi negocio porque no me doy abasto con tantos clientes tambien con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, barley, margarine, bread, milk, salt, sugar, rice, beans, eggs, oil, cheese, peppers, sardines, tortillas, soap, refreshments, bathroom tissue, and marmelade.

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.en:
My name is Filiberto G.. I develop film, sell film rolls for cameras, batteries, cameras, and camera bags. I've been in business for 4 years now. I have many customers because I am close to two schools and several companies. This helps a lot as many people come to take pictures for legal procedures and school work. At this moment I'm having problems with my photo printer and I have to get it fixed in order to provide better service to my customer. With my profits I would like to buy another printer, and more importantly, to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Filiberto G. me dedico a revelar fotos, vender royos fotograficos para camaras, baterias, camaras, bolsas para camaras, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya estoy ubicado cerca de dos colegios y varias empresas privadas, esto me ayuda mucho ya que la gente se toma muchas fotos para tramites personales y colegiales, en estos momentos tengo problemas con mis impresoras de fotos y necesito arreglarlas para darle un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otra impresora y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy film for cameras, chemicals, spare parts for printers, and cameras.

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.en:
My name is Glora N.. I sell spare parts for bicycles like tires, inner tubes, breaks, chains, oil, pedals, bolts, screws, and steering wheels. I've had my business for 4 years and it's going well because where I live, the majority of people go on bike since it's too expensive to buy a car or go in taxi. At this moment I need to increase my inventory because sales are good due to the extra month of salary paid to private and state employees this month. People take advantage of this to repaid broken things.

With the profits I will make, I will pay for household expenses and for the schooling of my two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Gloria N. me dedico a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas como ser llantas, neumaticos, breques, cables de freno, cadenas, aceite, pedales, tuercas, tornillos, timones, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, el cual es muy bueno ya que en donde vivo la mayoria de la gente se transporta en bicicleta porque es muy caro comprar carros o pagar taxis, en estos momentos necesito mas inventario porque estos dias son muy buenos para las ventas ya que a los empleados privados y estatales lesdan un suelo de mas en este mes, y la gente aprovecha para arreglar las cosas que tienen malas.

Con las ganancias que obtenga poder pagar los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar y pagarle los estudios a mis dos hijas.

loans.use: to buy spare bicycle parts: tires, repair kits, chains, brakes, and break cables

loans.name: Ilzer Anarda

texts.en:
My name is Ilzer M.. I sell krullers, refreshments, chewing gum, cookies, bonbons, and I am also starting to sell used clothing. This is a very good business because people buy lots of used clothing and I sell a lot. I need to buy more used clothing as I have been buying this only little by little bit. With the profits I will be able to feed my family and pay for household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ilzer M. me dedico a la venta de churros, refrescos, chicles, galletas, bombones y tambien estoy empezando a vender ropa usada ya que este es un muy negocio porque la gente compra mucho ropa usada y estoy vendiendo bastante, pero necesito comprar mas ropa usada ya que en esos momentos he estado comprando poca, pero es un muy buen negocio, y asi tener muchas ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar,.

loans.use: To buy used clothing, krullers, refreshments, candy, gum, bonbons, and cookies.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.en:
My name is José H. and I sell seafood like fish and shellfish. I've owned my business for 1 year. The sales of these products is going very well; many people eat fish because it is healthy. Since I live close to the Gulf of Fonseca, it is easy to obtain fresh fish of high quality. I need extra capital to buy more and increase my revenue, and with the profits I'll be able to feed my lovely family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jose H. me dedico a la venta de mariscos como ser pescado y curiles, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, la venta de estos productos es muy buena ya que mucha gente come pescado por saludable y como vivo en un lugar cerca del golfo de fonseca consigo mucho pescado fresco y bueno, pero necesito capiital para poder comprar mas y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi querida familia.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is married, 32 years old and has four children. Together with her husband, they sell fruits and vegetables door to door in their neighborhood. With the loan, they are planning to put up a small sales stand at their house so they can spend more time taking care of their kids.

They belong to the Maria del Carmen group along with the other women - Patricia Ruiz Gomez (who buys and sells calves), Victoria Hernandez Gomez (who has a grocery store). Both will invest the part of the loan pertaining to them. Patricia will buy more animals to raise and increase her sales, and Victoria is planning to buy canned goods, pastas, frozen foods, and drinks, to keep her store stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARICELA ES CASADA TIENE 32 AÑOS Y CUATRO HIJOS.
