JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO VENDEN FRUTAS Y VERDURAS PUERTA A PUERTA EN LAS CASAS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SU HOGAR CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE PONER UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DE VENTA EN SU CASA Y ASI PODER DEDICAR MAS TIEMPO AL CUIDADO DE SUS HIJOS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 3 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : PATRICIA RUIZ GOMEZ ( TRABAJA EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE BECERROS ) VICTORIA HERNANDEZ GOMEZ ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) AMBAS CON LA PARTE QUE LES CORRESPONDE DEL PRESTAMO VAN A INVERTIR ; PATRICIA COMPRANDO MAS ANIMALES PARA CRIAR Y AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y A SU VEZ VICTORIA PIENSA COMPRAR ALIMENTOS ENLATADOS, PASTAS,ALIMENTOS CONGELADOS, BEBIDAS, PARA MANTENER MAS SURTIDO SU LOCAL

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Maria Oralia

texts.en:
Maria Oralia is a married mother of two and is 23 years old. Her husband as a driver in public transportation. She sells energy supplements via catalogue. Maria is part of the Concepcion 1 group. The other members are Amanda del Rosario Moreno Gutierrez, Mari Janeth Hernandez Morales, Reyna Vellalith P. G. and Amalia P. G.. The only member of the group who has a different type of business is Mrs. Maria G. Pathistan who has a convenience store in her home. With the loan which will be divided among the members of the group, Maria will invest it in purchasing merchandise like salt, oil, and non-perishable products for her business. The rest of the members bought energy supplements in bulk to distribute among themselves. This results in decreased purchase cost, so they can get better earnings from the product sales to their customers, who are generally people from nearby communities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA ORALIA ESTA CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS Y 23 AÑOS DE EDAD SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE SUSTITUTIVOS ALIMENTICIOS ENERGETICOS POR CATALOGO AL IGUAL QUE LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO CONCEPCION 1 LAS QUE SON : AMANDA DEL ROSARIO MORENO GUTIERREZ, MARI JANETH .HERNANDEZ MORALES , REYNA VELLALITH P. G. Y AMALIA P. G. . LA UNICA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO QUE POSEE UNA ACTIVIDAD DIFERENTE ES DOÑA MARIA G. PATHISTAN QUIEN POSEE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA. CON EL PRESTAMO QUE SERA DIVIDIDO ENTRE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO DOÑA MARIA LO INVERTIRA EN COMPRAR MERCADERIA COMO SAL. ACEITE , PRODUCTOS NO PERECIBLES PARA SU NEGOCIO . EL RESTO DE LAS INTEGRANTES COMPRARAN ALIMENTOS ENERGETICOS AL POR MAYOR QUE DESPUES DISTRIBUIRAN ENTRE ELLAS LO QUE LES IMPLICARA DISMINUIR EL COSTO DE COMPRA Y ASI OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS CON LAS VENTAS DE LOS PRODUCTOS ENTRE SUS CLIENTES QUE GENERALMENTE SON GENTES DE COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A DONDE ELLAS VIVEN.,

loans.use: Purchase food supplements

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.en:
Silvia is 30 years old, has three kids and is separated from her husband. She covers household expenses by making and selling pozole, a popular regional dish made with corn, out of her home. She also makes and sells drinks. Silvia is part of a collective with three other people who have similar work who would use the loan to invest in more supplies for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

SILVIA TIENE 30 AÑOS TIENE 3 HIJOS SE ENCUENTRA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO DEBIDO A ESTO ELLA MANTIENE SU HOGAR TRABAJANDO EN SU CASA PREPARANDO UN ALIMENTO TIPICO DE LA ZONA LLAMADO POZOLE QUE ES UNA ESPECIE DE MASA DE MAIZ QUE SE VENDE Y POSTERIORMENTE SE LICUA PARA PREPARAR UNA BEBIDA ALIMENTICIA QUE SE CONSUME FRECUENTEMENTE EN LAS COMUNIDADES . SILVIA TRABAJA COMO VENDEDORA AMBULANTE EN LAS GASOLINERAS DEL SECTOR PERTENECE AL GRUPO CONCEPCION 2 LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON : MARIA DEL CARMEN BERMUDEZ LOPEZ ( COMPRA MAIZ , CACAO Y VENDE DULCES DE PANELA ) VICTORIA H. H. ( VENTA DE SUSTITUTIVOS ALIMENTICIOS POR CATALOGO) Y LAURA GUADALUPE S. H. ( TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) TODAS CON EL PRESTAMO PIENSAN INVERTIR EN MEJORAR LAS GANANCIAS DE SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO MATERIAS PRIMAS PARA MEJOR ELABORAR SUS PRODUCTOS LAS QUE HACEN ALIMENTOS ARTESANALES Y LAURA COMPRANDO MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU LOCAL

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make popular foods

loans.name: Jose Patrocinio

texts.en:
My name is José G.. I am a corn miller. I've owned my business for 3 years, and it is going very well because in order to make tortillas, one first has to grind the corn to produce dough. Tortillas are a basic food staple in our community and business is going well. At this moment I need to perform maintenance on the motor which forms the core of my business.

With the profits that I will have, I want to buy another corn grinding machine to be able to serve all of my customers; the demand is high and most importantly, it allows me to provide for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Jose G. me dedico a moler maiz, tengo mi negocio hace 3 anos, el cual es muy bueno porque para hacer tortillas hay que moler el maiz para hacer la masa, y como las tortillas son un alimento primordial en nuestra comunidad este es buen negocio, en estos momento necesito darle mantenimiento a mi motor que es el corazon de mi negocio, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otro moledor de maiz para atender todos mis clientes porque la demanda es grande y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motor, water, and oil.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Mrs. Cruz is the owner of a store in which she sells all sorts of general supplies. She works at her store from 6am to 10pm. Her business has been run out of her home for 12 years. She began her business with some money her husband gave her and she began to buy products little by little, and even though she is located near a market, she has seen a constant increase in business.

Mrs. Cruz needs a loan in order to purchase more supplies, as her store sees rapid sales, furthermore, she would like to be able to sell to certain loyal customers on credit, and she also hopes to attract more customers.

Mrs. Cruz is 60 years old, married and has 9 children, all of whom are indpendent. Her husband is a steel-worker and vender, who helps with the household expenses. She also enjoys the help of her children. Her home is clean, well adapted and made of a variety of construction material. She hopes to work and to grow in all possible ways with us and through which improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Cruz es propietaria de una tienda ella vende todo tipo de víveres en general. Ella atiende en su negocio desde las 6am a 10pm. Su negocio funciona en su domicilio hace 12 años. Ella atiende desde las 6am a 10pm. Ella inicio su negocio con un dinero que su esposo le dio. y empezó a comprar poco a poco productos y con la constancia que ha tenido a pesar de estar ubicado cerca del mercado su negocio esta en marcha.

Doña Cruz necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar mas víveres, ya que su negocio tiene buen movimiento, además que desea poder veder a crédito a ciertos clientes fieles que ella tiene hace mucho tiempo, adicionalmente quiere captar mas clientes.

La señora Cruz tiene 60 años es casada, tiene 9 hijos, todos son independientes y su esposo es albañil y comerciante quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Ella además recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. La casa en la que vive es propia, la esta adecuando, es de construcción mixta. Ella desea trabajar y crecer en todos los aspectos con nosotros y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.en:
My name is Juana R.. I produce and sell bread that I make in my clay oven. I have owned this business for 2 years. It is doing well because the bread that I produce tastes very good and my customers like it a lot.

At this moment, I need to remodel my oven (to make it bigger) to increase my production and sales. With the profits, I feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana R. me dedico a la produccion y venta de pan hecho en horno de adobe, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años el cual me va muy bien ya que el pan que fabrico es muy rico y a mis clientes les gusta mucho, en estos momentos necesito remodelar mi horno (hacerlo mas grande) para tener una mayor produccion y venta, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy firewood, barley flour, yeast, margarine, butter, salt, and oil.

loans.name: Bachita

texts.en:
Bachita has her own general store, located in her home. She began it with money that her husband left her when he passed away. She sells school-supplies, sweets, colas, beers and other items. She works from 7am-10pm. She has been involved in this activity for 10 years. Her business is well located because in the area where her home is located, there are no other general stores.

Bachita wishes to buy more gift items and more drinks; because above all else, the demand for drinks is the greatest, as her home is next to an eatery.

Bachita is 35 years old, and a young widow. But 11 years ago, she re-married. Her husband today is a taxi driver and retired from the Armed Forces. He is a support for her and helps her with the household expenses. They have 3 children who all attend school. Their home is a 2 story cement house, but the second floor is still under contruction. Her 13 year old daughter helps her in the mornings to mind the store. She hopes to be able to grow with us and to give a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Bachita tiene una tienda general en su domicilio, lo inicio con un dinero que le dieron cuando su esposo falleció. Ella vende útiles escolares, confiterías, colas, cervezas y otros. Atiende de 7am – 10pm. Ella lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad. Atiende su negocio de 7am a 10pm. Su negocio esta bien ubicado ya que cerca de su domicilio no hay otra tienda general.

Bachita quiere comprar lo que es artículos para regalos y mas bebidas. Porque tiene sobre todo mase demanda bebidas por encontrarse su domicilio a lado de un comedor.

Bachita tiene 35 años, quedo viuda muy joven. Pero hace 11 años se unió a su nueva pareja. Su actual esposo es taxista y retirado de las Fuerzas Armadas. El es un soporte para ella y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Tienen 3 hijos y todos estudian. Su vivienda es de cemento de 2 pisos, pero el segundo piso aun esta en construcción. Su hija de 13 años le ayuda por las mañanas en la atención del negocio. Ella aspirar lograr crecer con nosotros y darle mejor educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy products to re-sell.

loans.name: Juana Leonarda

texts.en:
My name is Juana Z.. I sell a variety of products for ladies and gentlemen. I have owned my business for 4 years, and I have a lot of clients because I am located on the outside of the communal market place of our city. At this moment, I want to buy more merchandise to have a better variety of products because sales are very good these days. With the profits, I intend to feel my family and to buy medicines for my mother, who is ill.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Juana Z. me dedico a la venta de productos varios para damas y caballeros, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi clientes son excelentes ya que estoy ubicada en las afueras del mercado comunal de nuestra ciudad, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas mercaderia para tener una mayor variedad de productos porque estos dias son muy buenos para vender, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y comprar medicinas a mi madre que esta enferma.

loans.use: to buy talcum, hair clips, earrings, necklaces, tooth paste, cotton tips, shampoos, soaps, nail polish, toys, and deodorants.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
My name is Julio P.. I sell spare parts for bicycles. I've owned my business for 4 years. It is doing very well: bicycles is a transport mode that is oftenused by our people because it is cheap and efficient. At this moment, I need to increase m y inventory because it is high season.

With the profits, I want to remodel my business, feed my three children, and -most importantly- pay for private school for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Julio P. me dedico a la venta de repuestos para bicicletas, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, en el cual me va muy bien ya que la bicicleta es un medio de transporte muy utilizado por nuestra gente ya que es muy comodo y eficiente. en estos momentos necesito incrementar mi inventario porque es una epoca de muchas ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi negocio, alimentar mis tres hijos y lo mas importante pagarles un estudio privado.

loans.use: To buy chains, oil, tires, pedals, repair kits, glue, handle bars, tensors, keys, reflectos, screws, and bolts.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
My name is Leticia E.. I sell used clothing and I started this business a year ago. The business is not doing great because I don't have enough inventory. I would like to buy more clothing to increase my sales because used clothing is easy to sell. With the profits I will be able to feed my family and pay for the school of my two children.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Leticia E. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada actividad que realizo desde hace un año, el cual me va un poco bien porque no tengo mucho inventario, pero deseo comprar mas ropa para tener mayores ventas ya que la ropa usada es facil de vender, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagarles el estudio a mis dos hijos

loans.use: to buy ladies' and men's used clothing

loans.name: Lidia Rufina

texts.en:
My name is Lidia M. and I have dedicated myself to selling new clothes for women, men and children such as t-shirts, button down shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, shorts, caps, socks and shoes. I have been involved in this activity for the last four years, with very good clients and I am able to sell my products in different private and state offices. At this moment I need more inventory in order to offer a better variety of products that are selling well. With the profits I will be able to cover the costs of expenditures as well as have a bit of money to remodel my home in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Lidia M. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballer y niños como ser camisetas, camisas de vestir, blusas, pantalones, jeans, shorts, gorras, calcetines, zapatos, actividad que realizo hace unos 4 años atras, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que vendo mi producto en diferentes oficinas del estado y privadas, en estos momentos necesito mas inventario para tener mayor variedad de productos ya que estos dias son buenos para las ventas, y con las ganancias que tenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar y tambien quiero ahorrar dinero para en un futuro remodelar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for women, men and children.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria cooks food at home and sells it to workers at various construction sites. Her daughter helps her with some of the cooking. She lives in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz. This is her fourth loan from IMPRO. She repaid the previous three loans in full earning herself status as a first-class borrower. She will use the loan to buy rice, noodles, potatoes and traditional Bolivian freeze dried potatoes (chuño and tunta) as well as cooking pots. Her work experience and track record as a borrower give her access to this loan. She will have sufficient income to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Victoria elabora comida en su domicilio y vende a los albañiles en las construcciones, también prepara almuerzos y platos extras con la ayuda su hija. Ella vive en la zona de Irpavi II, y su puesto es ambulante ya que vende la comida en cada construcción. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito; los tres créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de Insumos (Arroz, fideo, papa, chuño, tunta. Y ollas) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and cooking pots.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Clent will apply for a new loan

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.en:
My name is Luis H. and I have dedicated myself to the reparation and installation of window frames. I have had my business for two years, with very good clients since I am the only one in my community who is dedicated to window repairs. My goal is to increase my inventory as the demand in this moment is great and I do not have much capital in order to acquire the materials necessary for my work. With the profits that I would obtain I could help feed my family whom are the people I love the most in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Luis H. me dedico a la reparacion e instalacion de marcos para ventanas, celocias, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que en mi comunidad solo yo me dedico a la reparacion de ventanas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario ya que la demanda en este momento es grande y no tengo mucho capital para adquirir los materiales que necesito para mi trabajo y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia que es lo que mas quiero en este mundo.

loans.use: Purchase of frames for windows

loans.name: Mamerto

texts.en:
My name is Mamerto and I have been dedicated to buying and selling loaves of bread and pastries for the last three years. This business is going well with client that prefer to purchase my products because I bring them to their work and homes. My goal is to increase my inventory and increase my sales. I will use the profits to buy a used motorcycle and a wheelbarrow to transport more bread as well as the most important thing which is feeding my family.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Mamerto me dedico a la compra y venta de pan blanco y dulce, actividad que tengo de realizar hace 3 años, en el cual me va muy bien ya que mis clientes prefieren comprarme mi producto porque se los llevo a sus trabajos y hogares, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que tenga poder comprarme una moto usada y una carretilla para llevar mas pan y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase bread loaves and pastries

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene buys pig skins and dries and toasts them to make edible pork rinds which she sells by weight. She works by herself. Her husband is a cook. They live in the Irpavi Bajo neighborhood in La Paz. She doesn't have a fixed place of business but hawks her snacks door to door and at local fairs. This is her third loan from IMPRO. She repaid her previous loans on time and has a first-class record as a borrower. She will use the loan to buy more pig skins. Her work experience and prior history as a borrower give her access to this loan and she will have sufficient income to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Irene compra cuero de chancho, lo hace secar para luego tostarlo y venderlo como chicharrón seco, por libras. Ella trabaja sola; su esposo es cocinero. Vive en la zona de Irpavi Bajo y no tiene un puesto fijo ya que ambula casa por casa vendiendo su producto; también hace lo mismo en los mercados de su barrio. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. Sus anteriores dos créditos fueron pagados puntualmente. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de insumos (cuero de chancho) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy pig skins to make into pork rinds.

payments.comment: loan pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana makes woolen shawls. She works by herself. Her husband is a laborer and they have school-aged children. They live in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz where her workshop is located. She would like to increase her working capital and make more shawls. This is her third loan from IMPRO. She is a first-class borrower with a good record of repayment--she repaid her two previous loans in full. She hopes to use this loan to buy wool, cloth and thread. She has good experience and a good track record as a borrower and will earn enough to cover the loan in addition to all her personal and household expenses.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Valeriana elabora mantas de tela y lana, trabaja sola ya que su esposo es albañil, sus hijos están en edad escolar. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II donde tiene su taller; su objetivo es contar con más capital y así poder elaborar mantas en cantidad. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. Los anteriores dos créditos han sido pagados en su totalidad. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, lana e hilo) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos necesarios para cubrir el préstamo y todas las necesidades personales y del hogar.

loans.use: To buy wool, cloth and thread.

payments.comment: early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Margarita O. and I sell natural fruit ice bars and refreshments. I have had my business for about two years. Business is doing well since the city that I live in reaches very high temperatures and people usually eat ice bars and chilled natural refreshments. Mi goal is to increment inventory in order to have bigger sales. With the extra earnings I'll be able to cover my home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Margarita O. me dedico a la venta de paletas y refrescos de frutas naturales, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años en el cual es muy bueno porque en la ciudad que vivo la temperatura es muy alta y la gente acostumbra a comer paletas y tomar refrescos naturales helados, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, water, sugar, ice bars, artificial colors and flavors.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta buys alpaca and vicuña wool and spins it herself then uses the yarn to weave shawls which she sells on order. She contracts with someone else to make braid and trim for her. Her children are grown and work to support themselves. Modesta lives and works in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. She has been an IMPRO client since 2005 with a first-class borrowing record, meaning she has a good repayment history. She will use the funds to buy alpaca and vicuña wool. She has work experience and a good record as a borrower and her cash flow will suffice to cover both loan payments and her personal expenses.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Modesta compra lana de vicuña y alpaca. La lana es hilada por ella misma para poder tejer las mantas y para trenzado y flecadura contrata a una persona; sus hijos ya son independientes y trabajan por cuenta propia. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz donde tiene su taller y las mantas que elabora son a pedido. Es cliente de Impro desde diciembre de 2005 Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana de vicuña y lana de alpaca) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El análisis de su flujo de caja muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus obligaciones personales.

loans.use: To buy alpaca wool.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
My name is Maria C. and I sell farming products. I have had my business for four years. My business is doing good. However, right now I need to purchase medicines and poisons since I run out of inventory. My husband helps me attend to my business and with the earnings I make I'll be able to feed my family and cover my home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria C. me dedico a la venta de productos agropecuarios, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, en el cual me va bien, pero en estos momentos necesito comprar varias medicinas y venenos ya que me quede sin inventario, tengo la yuda de mi esposo para atender mi negocio, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase medicines, concetrate, flea and bug poison, chains and collars

loans.name: Maria Ventura

texts.en:
My name is Maria P. and I sell new clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children. I have been selling articles such as shirts, blouses, pants, jeans, socks and dresses for about three years. My sells are good because I am well located near the center of the town where I live. I wish to buy more clothes in order to have bigger sales because this time of the year is good for commerce and I could use the extra earnings to feed my family and give my son private university schooling since he is about to go into college

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria P. me dedico a la venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y niños como ser camisetas, blusas, pantalones, jeans, calcetines, vestidos actividad que realizo desde hace unos 3 años atras, mis ventas son buenas ya que estoy ubicada cerca de el centro de la ciudad en que vivo, deseo comprar mas ropa para tener mayores ventas ya que esta epoca del año es buena para el comercio y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y darle un estudio en universidad privada a mi hijo que esta por ingresar a la universidad.

loans.use: Purchase new male, female and kids clothing

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.en:
Mi name is Maria Vilma G. and I produce and sell donuts. I have had my business for two years. My goal is to increment my inventory to producer more donuts and increase my earnings in order to remodel my oven (enlarge it) . Donut demand is very good because most of the tourists that come to our community buy lots of donuts. I also want to be able to cover my home's food expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Vilma G. me dedico a la produccion y venta de rosquillas tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion de rosquillas y tener mayores ganancias ya que deseo remodelar mi horno (hacerlo mas grande) porque la demanda es buena ya que la mayoria de los turistas que vienen a nuestra comunidad compran muchas rosquillas, asi mismo cubrir con los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, flour, salt, oil, butter, margarine

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
My name is Norma P. and I produce and sell tortillas. I have had my business for 3 years. My clients are very good because tortillas are a staple food that people consume during lunch and dinner. My goal is to increment inventory in order to have larger sales and be able to provide sustenance for my family with the extra earnings I make.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Norma P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que la tortilla es un alimento que mucha gente lo concume durante el almuerzo y la cena, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase corn flour, cal, salt, firewood, matches

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
My name is Norma O. and I work as a female cosmetic products saleswoman. I have had my business for one year. My clients are very good because I can sell my product in various private businesses. My goal is to increment my inventory because these days are good for sales. Since I am a single mother, I plan to feed my baby with the extra earnings I make.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Norma O. me dedico a la venta de productos cosmeticos para dama, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mi s clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto lo vendo en varias empresas privadas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario ya que estos dias son buenos para las ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar a mi pequeña bebe ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: Purchase creams, lotions, perfumes, deodorants, nail polish, shampoos and soaps

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Dr. Elsa is the owner of a bazar, which is located in her home. She began her business with money she earned from her orothodontist practice. With the earnings she made from her practice, she was able to invest in merchandise. She works from 7am-9pm. She also continues to practice her profession from her home. She sells gift items, stationary, pens and also has a photocopier where she can make copies. She has been involved in this activity for ten years.

Dr. Elsa wishes to adquire more products for her bazar, because she has been re-furbishing her home and her capital has seen a decrease. What's more, she has to meet the demand for more gift products and to do this, she needs to stock her business and tend to her customers.

Dr. Elsa is 35 years old, has four children, but only 3 are in school. She lives with her husband who helps her with maintenence work in the house. Her 13 year old daughter helps her in the bazar when Elsa is seeing patients. Her house is a two story cement home, which has recently seen some improvement works. The Doctor hopes to work with us and through which, improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Dra. Elsa es propietaria de un bazar que se encuentra en su domicilio. Lo inicio con el dinero que ganaba con su consultorio odontológico. Ella con la ganancia que tenia de su consultorio fue invirtiendo en mercadería. Atiende de 7am – 9pm.Además sigue ejerciendo su profesión allí en su domicilio. En el bazar vende todo lo que es artículos para regalos, papelería, plumas y también tiene una fotocopiadora y saca copias. Ella lleva 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.

La Dra. Elsa desea adquirir más productos para su bazar, porque ha estado adecuando su casa y su capital ha bajado un poco. Además ella tiene demanda de otros productos como mas artículos para regalos por eso quiere abastecerse y atender a sus clientes.

La Dra. Elsa tiene 35 años, de edad y 4 hijos, solo 3 estudian. Ella vive con su esposo quien le ayuda en la manutención del hogar. Su hija de 13 años le ayuda en el negocio cuando ella esta atendiendo a pacientes. Su casa es de 2 pisos de cemento y recién ha hecho algunas adecuaciones. La Dra. aspira trabajar con nosotros de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Supply her business.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.en:
My name is Maria M. and I work as a male and female used clothing saleswoman. I have had my business for about two years. My clients are very good because I can sell my high quality product at a low price. My goal is to increment my inventory because this business is very good. With the extra earnings, I plan to buy wood to remodel my store and more importantly, to feed my two little daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria M. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada para dama y caballero, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque vendo mi producto a un precio muy bajo y de buena calidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario ya que este negocio es muy bueno y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar madera para remodelar mi puesto de venta y lo mas importante alimentar mis dos hijitas que tengo.

loans.use: Purchase used clothing

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
My name is Maerly M. and I produce and sell donuts and quesadillas. I have had my business for about four years. My clients are very good because I can distribute my product across different little markets around town. My goal is to increase inventory in order to have more production and sale of donuts and. I plan on feeding my newly born son and various medicines that I need for my son with the extra earnings I make

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maerly M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de rosquillasy quesadillas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque mi producto lo reparto en diferentes mercaditos de la ciudad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y venta de rosquillas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi hijo recien nacido y comprar varias medicinas que necesito para mi hijo.

loans.use: Purchase flour, cheese, salt, firewood, water, butter, oil and milk

loans.name: Pilar Serafin

texts.en:
My name is Pilar C. and I sell churros, candies, chocolates, marshmallows, pencils, sodas and kool-aid. I have had my business for one year. My clients are good because I am located near a bus terminal. Mi goal is to increase the variety of the products I sell, therefore Increasing sales and be able to cover my family's and my home's expenses with the extra earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Pilar C. me dedico a la venta de churros, confites, chicles, bombones, culey, refrescos, lapices, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, mis clientes son buenos ya que estoy ubicado cerca de una terminal de buses, mi meta es tener mayor variedad de productos, para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi familia y mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase churros, candies, chocolates, marshmallows, pencils, sodas and kool-aid.

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.en:
My name is Rubenia M. and I produce and sells tortillas. I have had my business for about three years. My clients are very good because I sell my product at different stores around my town and they also make orders for their meetings and parties. Mi goal is to increment mi inventory to increase production and be able to provide sustenance for my family with the earnings I make.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Rubenia M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos porque vendo mi producto en diferentes pulperias de mi localidad y me hacen encargos para reuniones y fiestas. mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchase corn flour, cal, salt, fire wood, water, matches

loans.name: Sohor Lorena

texts.en:
My name is Sohor C. and I sell used clothes. I have had my business for a year. This business is very good because clothes sell fast due to their low sale prices. I need more inventory in order to have more sales because this month is good for sales. With the earnings I make I plan to feed my daughter and pay for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Sohor C. me dedico a la venta de ropa usada, tengo mi negocio hace 1 año, este negocio es muy bueno proque la ropa se vende rapido ya que tiene precios bajos de venta, en estos momentos necesito mas inventario para tener mas ventas porque este mes es muy bueno para las ventas, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi hija y pagarle sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase used clothes

loans.name: Wendy Lizeth

texts.en:
My name is Wendy P., I have owned my business for about two years. I produce and sell donuts. My clients are good to me because they make orders for my products. My goal is to increment my inventory because I am not being able to keep up with production. I need to produce more and with my earnings I want to feed my family and buy various pills that I need for my health.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Wendy P. me dedico a la produccion y venta de rosquillas tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mis clientes son buenos porque me piden por encargos mi producto, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario porque no estoy cumpliendo con la produccion, necesito producir mas, y con las ganancia que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y comprar varias pastillas que necesito para mi salud.

loans.use: purchase flour, salt, butter, cheese, oil, margarine

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
For the past 7 years, Reyna has focused on selling plastic products. She began selling after her husband retired because his pension didn’t cover all the bills. She started her own business so that she could take care of the family’s finances. She has 8 children, seven of which are married and only the youngest daughter lives with them. At the beginning, she only had a small amount of inventory, but with time she accumulated enough inventory that now she has a designated area in her home where she keeps all of her plastic products.

In order to increase sales and to better serve her clients, she would like to increase her inventory by offering a different variety of plastic products. In order to do so, Reyna is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD. She will repay the loan within 6-12 months. You can help improve the living conditions of her family. Please don’t hesitate! Reyna thanks you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace siete años Reyna se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico, inició cuando jubilaron a su esposo ya que la pensión que recibe es muy baja, y para poder cubrir todos los gastos comenzó su propio negocio, ella tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 7 están casados y sólo la más pequeña vive con ellos. Al inicio tenia muy poca mercancía, pero poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora ha acondicionado una parte de su vivienda para continuar con sus ventas.

Para incrementar la variedad de productos Reyna solicita un préstamo de $650 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y podrá incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, Reyna agradece mucho tu apoyo,

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Senora Ana Laura is a hard-working and honest woman. She got into sales about 21 years ago to help her husband pay the bills and to pay for the schooling of their 3 children. Thanks to her friendly and easy going nature and for the love of what she does, has helped her to get more and more clients. She began by selling draperies and jewelry. At her friends’ requests, she also began selling decorative products for the home which has been very successful.

Due to the good quality of her products and the product demonstrations she does at friends’ homes, has helped her get a lot of orders. She needs a loan in the amount of $375 USD. Be an important part of Ana Laura’s life by helping her business grow. She and her family sincerely thank you!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ana Laura es una mujer honesta y muy trabajadora, desde hace 21 años se dedica a las ventas, inició para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la educación de sus tres hijos, afortunadamente el carácter que posee, la facilidad para relacionarse con los demás y su gusto por las ventas la ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes, comenzó vendiendo lencería y joyería, poco después ante la invitación de una de sus amigas incorporó la venta de productos decorativos para el hogar, donde ha tenido muy buenos resultados.

Gracias a la calidad de los productos que comercializa y a las demostraciones que hace en casas de amigas, han logrado obtener muchos pedidos, para poder surtirlos necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de Ana Laura y ayúdala a que continúe creciendo, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is a very hard-working woman who doesn’t mind struggling to reach her goals. She is 31 years old. She is married and a mother of 2 beautiful girls who are 3 and 10 years old. Her husband is in the public transportation business. His salary doesn’t take care of all the family’s necessities. Due to this, Lorena started selling cosmetics about 3 years ago. Fortunately, she has found some clients and her orders have increased.

In order to offer more of a variety of products to her clients and to provide a better service, Laura needs a loan in the amount of $375 USD which she will use to buy more merchandise. With your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business and to the well-being of her family. They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha siempre por lograr sus metas, ella es casada, tiene 31 años de edad y es madre de dos preciosas hijas de 3 y 10 años de edad. Su esposo es concesionario de transporte público, pero había ocasiones en que su salario no cubría las necesidades de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Lorena inició con la venta de cosméticos hace tres años, afortunadamente ha logrado tener más clientes y sus pedidos cada vez son mayores.

Para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, Lorena necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe is divorced, and she has one son who is about to start college. She loves to sell and she is really good with words, which has helped her to move up ahead. To be able to provide for her son after she separated from her husband, she decided to start her own business by selling perfumes.

Maria wishes for her business to continue to grow so that she can help her son pay for his college education. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $475 USD to purchase more merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her clients and eventually increase sales. Be part of the success of this business and help this family have a better quality of life. They greatly appreciate your generosity and trust!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe es divorciada y tiene un hijo que está a punto de iniciar sus estudios universitarios, a ella le agradan las ventas y tiene facilidad de palabra, lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante. Para poder darle lo necesario a su hijo, desde hace ocho años que se separó de su esposo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes, se le presentó la oportunidad de viajar a McAllen, Texas donde adquirió algunos productos que le habían solicitado y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio.

Para poder pagar la educación de su hijo, Maria desea que su negocio continúe creciendo, por lo que solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, de esta manera ofrecerá una mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementará sus ventas, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes formar parte de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu generosidad y confianza.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Marco Antonio has had his house for more than 5 years. “Little by little, I have been improving the house where my mother and I live. We only have to finish the façade of the house and the fence, and then we will be more safe. There have been several robberies in the neighborhood. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to finish the façade and the fence.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Marco Antonio tiene su casa desde hace más de 5 año. Poco a poco le echo mejorar a la casa en ella vivimos mi mama y yo, solo nos ase faltar terminar la fachada y la barda y así estar mas seguros, ya que sean presentado barios robos en la colonia. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la terminación de la fachada y barda.

loans.use: To finish the facade of his house and and the fence around it

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Phorn S. is 40 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children who are students. She lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She works on a farm growing a variety of crops, which contribute an average of about $2/day in revenue. At the same time, her husband (pictured here because Phorn S. was unavailable) helps his household by not only operating a taxi, but also selling charcoal throughout the province. He typically makes around $8/day of income.

In order to keep operating this kind of business, Phorn S. is asking for a $1000 loan to fix their current car and use the remaining money from the loan to purchase extra charcoal from the far provinces and sell it throughout their province of Kampong Cham. In the future, Phorn S. hopes to have enough money to save for a business cycle and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To fix their car and to purchase charcoal to sell  throughout the province.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Phorn Sreng has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy S. is 46 years old, married, and a father of 7 children. He lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where he works as both a motor-taxi driver and a construction foreman. For his business activity, he typically makes about $4/day, while his wife works at the local garment factory and contributes a meager sum to the household. Meanwhile, 3 of his children are garment workers and the rest are students.

Suy S. is requesting a loan amount of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for his business. He hopes he can save enough money to increase his collection of construction tools to make additional income from his profession for years to come.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun C., 28 years old, married and a mother of 2 children who attend school, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To service the family's expenses, she works at a local garment factory and typically makes about $3/day in revenue, while her husband works as a construction foreman as well as raising animals and growing crops in his field.

In order to maximize her livestock, Soeun C. is asking for $600 to purchase cows to raise in her field. She hopes after five to six months breeding, her family's savings will be increased so that she can afford to add more cows for her livestock and use the leftover money to build a concrete house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase  cows  to raise.

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
A 41-year-old mother of 2 children, SaV. lives with her husband and a nephew in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a housewife, looking after the children and cooking meals for her entire family. Meanwhile, her husband plays the most important role to supplement the family's expenses by operating a barber shop and making typically about $4/day. One of her daughters works at a local garment factory, which is very far from her house, and the other is a student.

Saveit is asking for $500 loan to purchase barber tools for her husband and to buy a motor-bike for her daughter so that she no longer spends money on her public transportation. In the future, Saveit is thinking about being able to own another barber shop near a market, where her family will make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase barber tools to buy a motorcycle to transport her daughter from and to work.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin R., 24 years old and mother of 2 children who are students, lives with her husband (pictured here because R. was unavailable) in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works at the local garment factory, and typically makes about $3/day in revenue, while her husband works as a carpenter and contributes around $3/day to his household.

Rin R. is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to purchase carpentry tools for her husband to run his business and the rest to repair their house, which usually leaks during a rainy season. In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to run a shop near a market selling a variety of furniture.

loans.use: To purchase carpenter tools for her husband business.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Azam K. began his business with only $200. Today his business assets are worth $2000. He is married, with two growing children. His stock is delivered to him by his suppliers. His brother also helps him in the business.

Azam has been with MicroInvest for three years and during this time he has excelled in his business. Azam K. needs $1200 to open a new retail location.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримов Аъзам начинал свой бизнес с суммы 200$, на сегодняшний день его активы составляют 2000$. Он женат, в его семье подрастают двое детей. Товары ему привозят его поставщики. В его бизнесе ему помогает брат. В Микроинвесте он уже 3 года и за эти годы он преуспел в своем бизнесе. Каримову Аъзаму нужно 1200$ для открытия новой торговой точки.

loans.use:
To open his new shop

для открытия своего магазина

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is divorced and has an 8-year-old son, Nikita. She is the only breadwinner for her family. Aya runs a business selling footwear in the central city market. She has been in this business for eight years. Currently, Aya has about $800 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $200-300. 

Aya is a focused entrepreneur. She knows her clientele and knows how to meet the needs of the elderly ladies who shop in her kiosk. She has made a good reputation in the market. 

Her current inventory is better for winter and spring, so Aya is requesting a loan of $800 to re-stock her inventory with shoes for the warm and sunny summer season. To take her clients all the way through summer, she will buy comfy sandals, trainers, mocs, and slip-ons in bulk. These types of footwear will be a great, freeing alternative to regular shoes and she will provide a good comfortable fit for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with two children – her daughter is 13 and her son is only a year and a half old. She and her husband have run a vinyl window installation services business for six years. She gets about 50 orders a month. Every order can require up to 10 window installations. Currently, Irina and her husband make about $2,000 – 2,500 in net profit a month. 

Irina’s business is constantly growing. One of the advantages she has in the competitive windows market is her direct connection to vinyl window manufacturing companies. Her little office is very popular in the small town of Izyum. Irina can hardly handle the high demand she’s facing now.  

Irina realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business. Loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business. She would like to help more people make their homes comfortable and cozy , so she is requesting a loan for $500 to hire two more work crews who would help install vinyl windows and blinds. She believes this will not only help her business grow, but will also provide jobs for many unemployed people in her little town. Irina is hoping to use generated profit to buy a more spacious house for her family and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru:
Salomat M. is married and has 5 children. She has been in business for 9 years and has been working with MicroInvest for 2 years. Over the last years, Salomat substantially increased her sales volume. She began her business as an embroiderer, and then moved into sales. Salomat M. asks for $1175 to increase assortment of the goods sold to include not only sunflower seeds, but also peanuts, corn, etc.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муминова Саломат замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бизнесом занимается уже 9 лет, из них 2 года работает с Микроинвест. За последние годы, она намного увеличила свой товарооборот. Начинала свой бизнес с того, что вышивала (набивка), после перешла на торговлю. Муминовой Саломат нужно 1156$ для увеличения ассортимента (не только семечки, но и арахис, кукурузу и т.п.).

loans.use: Increase assortment of the goods sold

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya is the mother of a six year old daughter and lives in Trooskaveets in Western Ukraine. Mariya is a true entrepreneur – committed, hard working, and self-sacrificing. For nine years, Mariya has successfully been operating a business that sells children’s and women’s clothing. Additionally, Mariya has a second business, providing transportation services with a van she owns. She has a perfect credit history and plans to expand her business with additional vending facilities. Mariya is seeking a loan for $500 to purchase more inventory for her clothing business. She works hard to offer the seasonal products that are in demand in order to stay competitive in the market. With the additional inventory, Mariya hopes to continue to expand her business and improve living conditions for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga and her husband, Vladimir, have operated a furniture manufacturing and sales business for eight years.  The business provides the sole source of income for their themselves and their two-year-old son. In the eight years of being in business, Olga has received and successfully repaid seven loans from Nadiya Ukraine. Prior to working in the furniture business, Olga worked in multi-level marketing. In addition to her marketing skills, Olga brings the qualities of efficiency and focused work to creating affordable and high quality merchandise. She is friendly and gracious, always seeking opportunities to meet the needs of her clients. Olga is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional manufacturing materials. With increased profits, Olga plans to rent a larger facility and expand her business.

loans.use: purchase materials - chipboard (15 square meters) and laminated plastic (2 square meters)

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy O., 47 years old mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. To service in her family's expenses, Tuy O. operates a business in the suburb of the city selling a variety of fruits, and typically makes about $16/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, works on a farm growing crops and breeding animals, while 2 of her children work at a local hotel and the rest are students.

Tuy O. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase more fruits in order to keep investing in her sustainable business as well as to meet her clients' demand. For the coming year, she hopes to have enough money to keep expanding her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.ru:
Mukhtor P. is married and has 4 children. He has been in business for 7 years, 2 of which he has been working with Microinvest. He began his business with only 5-6 kilograms (10-12 lbs) of dry fruits. Today, he sells no more than 15-20 kilograms (30-40 lbs) of dry fruits. His large family includes his father and mother, his wife and 4 children. His children must continue to go to school—the reason he asks for help. Mukhtor P. asks for $1000 to increase his trading volume.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Пулотов Мухтор женат, имеет 4 детей. Бизнесом занимается 7 лет, из них 2 года работает с Микроинвест. Начинал свой бизнес всего 5-6кг сухофруктов. Сейчас он продает не более 15-20 кг сухофруктов. Семья у него большая, отец, мать, жена и дети. В его семье зарабатывает только он. Дети учатся в школе. Поэтому ему нужна поддержка со стороны нашей организации. Пулотов Мухтор просит 1000$ для увеличения своего товарооборота.

loans.use: Increase trading volume

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei started his small business selling building supplies three years ago when his family was undergoing some financial difficulties. Since that time, his business has expanded rapidly and he now has two little market kiosks and a small store near the center of Ivano-Frankovsk. He carries a nice selection of building and remodeling supplies that cater to the booming home improvement/remodeling business in Ukraine. Sergei’s business is the main source of income for he and his wife, Irina, and their four year old daughter.

Sergei is a good role model and a positive influence on those around him. He has been a great client with “Nadiya Ukraine” and has proven himself to be reliable and honest. He has requested a loan to help him purchase a bulk supply of Styro-foam fillet molding that is used for interior decorating. Being able to purchase his inventory in large quantities saves money for Sergei, allowing him to keep more of his hard-earned income and invest in future expansion.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married. She owns a business selling clothing, sunglasses and other items in one of the local markets in Kharkov, Ukraine. Svetlana has been in this business for 3 years, and it is the only source of income for her family. She owns three vending facilities and earns about $20-50 of daily net profit. 

Svetlana is fortunate to have a convenient vending kiosk in the local market. She has many customers who keep coming back to her kiosk , because she has very reasonable prices. Three loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped her stimulate consistent growth in her trade. Generated profits enabled Svetlana to buy an apartment. In the past her family had to rent one and they didn’t have their own place to live.  

Svetlana requests a loan of $900 for to stock her kiosks with more t-shirts, jean clothing and trendy sunglasses which are very popular this sunny summer season. She will use some of the money to open a new vending facility. Her hard work, natural friendliness, good customer service and self-discipline will help Svetlana use the funding she receives wisely and repay her loan in time, just as she has done in the past.

loans.use: Increase available products

loans.name: Negmat

texts.ru:
Mr. Negmat R. began his business by selling pasta at a counter in Pakhtakor. He has been in business for 6 years. Over the 6 years, Mr. R. gained a great number of clients. Today, in addition to selling pasta, he began to offer beverages, canned food, etc. His business is doing great. Mr. R. is married and has 3 children. He is asking for a loan of $1200 to open a new retail spot in the center of his town.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Раджаабов Негмат начинал свой бизнес с продажи макаронов, в одной из прилавок находящейся в Пахтакоре. В бизнесе 6 лет. За эти 6 лет у него появилось очень много своих клиентов. Раджабов Негмат продает не только макароны, но и перешел на продажу напитков, консервированных изделий и т.д. Его бизнес процветает. Раджабов Негмат женат, имеет 3 детей. Он просит 1200$ на открытие новой точки в центре города.

loans.use: To open a new retail spot

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
For Vitalyi, marriage with his college sweetheart, Elena, was more than just joining two lives. They also joined businesses. Both had their own clothing businesses prior to getting married. Merging the two operations has shown them the benefits of working on a larger scale. Their business at the Central Market in Uzhgorod is one of the largest in the market. They offer a variety of men’s and women’s clothing. Vitalyi is able to stock items that are not readily available in the market, and he maintains a better selection than his closest competitors. Vitalyi has worked for himself for six years.

Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have been a key help for Vitalyi as he has developed his business. He has been a model loan client, investing funds wisely and never being delinquent with a payment. Vitalyi has requested a loan for $1000 to help with purchasing new inventory. It is exciting to see businesses like Vitalyi’s grow and provide much needed income for their hard-working owners.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru:
M., Mutabar is married and has 4 children. She started her business sewing kurpachi (traditional Tajik mattresses) at home. Currently, she sews in an atelier called “Navruz” that is located in the center of the city. Because she has been in this business for 15 years, Mutabar has many clients. Since 2000, she has been an active client of MLF “Microinvest”. She is asking for $1,100 to expand her business and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Мансурова Мутабар замужем, имеет 4 детей. Начала свой бизнес шитьем национальной курпачи, принимала заказы на дом. На данный момент шьет в ателье «Навруз», расположенный в центре города. У нее много потенциальных клиентов. Как уже 15 лет занимается этим бизнесом. С 2000г. она является активной клиенткой МЗФ «Микроинвест». Она запрашивает 1011$ для расширения своего бизнеса, а также для получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.use:
For business expansion

расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir makes a living using his taxi to transport people around Ivano-Frankovsk and surrounding areas in the western Ukraine. Personal vehicles are too expensive for most people to afford in the Ukraine. Transportation services such as buses and taxis like Vladimir’s provide a valuable means of getting around for many, many people. Vladimir owns his own car, but works with a dispatching company called Radio 051 to coordinate calls. He has a radio in his car that enables him to quickly respond to requests for a taxi. Vladimir currently makes around $35 per day, enough for him to support himself and his wife, Olga. 

Vladimir has requested a loan of $500 to help him with some maintenance on his taxi. He has been in business for three years and has put a lot of kilometers on his car. Eventually he’d like to purchase a much newer car, but until that time, this loan will help him keep his vehicle in good working order.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a married mom with two children. She sells quality footwear in the local market, and is the chief breadwinner in her family. Yelena has been in this business for eight years. Her daily net profit is about $10 - $40. 

Yelena is customer-friendly, cheerful, optimistic, and is very persistent in her work. She works in her kiosk every day, even when the weather conditions are not very favorable. Yelena sets a good example for her friends who are also working as market vendors. Eleven loans received from “Nadiya Ukraine”, cheap rental fees for her kiosk, and the convenient location of her vending facility have added greatly to her entrepreneurial success. 

This winter season was tough on Yelena’s trade – her sales were really low. She will use this loan of $1,200 to increase her seasonal inventory, boost her sales and generate additional profits over the summer. Yelena is planning to re-stock some of the shoe items in her kiosk and add new, trendy and stylish footwear to her inventory. She has been dreaming about remodeling her apartment for a long time, and is hoping to use some of the extra income produced by this loan to make her dream come true.

loans.use: Increase summer inventory

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
M. Mavluda is married and has 2 children. She has been in business for 6 years. She began her business by borrowing small amounts of money from her acquaintances to buy material. From this material she sewed different types of dresses and sold them at the market. Mavluda has been a member of MLF “Microinvest” for 4 years. During these years her business has been successful because she not only sews dresses but also sells different kinds of material. M. Mavluda is asking for $875 to purchase new materials.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусабаева Мавлюда замужем, имеет 2 детей. В бизнесе она 6 лет. Начинала свой бизнес с того, что брала у знакомых незначительную сумму в кредит, для покупки материалов. Из этих материалов шила несколько видов платьев и продавала их на рынке. В МЗФ «Микроинвесте» она 4 года. За эти годы она преуспела в своем бизнесе, т. е. кроме шитья и продажи платьев, она также продает несколько видов тканей. Мусабаева Мавлюда запрашивает 867$ для закупки новых тканей.

loans.use:
To expand the business and gain maximum profit

расширения бизнеса и получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.name: Phou

texts.en:
Mrs. Phou R., 50 years old and mother of 7 children, lives in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers growing a variety of crops and raising pigs. With this business activity, Phou R. can usually make around $10 in revenue, while 4 of her children work as construction workers and the rest are students.

Phou R. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to buy a piece of land and to buy pigs to operate her business. Phou R. is thinking about being able to expand her business by adding pigs and crops to invest in her farm.

loans.use: To purchase pigs  and a piece of land to grow crops

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.ru:
Galamova, Tuhta has been in business for 12 years and an active member of “Microinvest” for 5 years. She is married with 5 children. She started her business by baking bread and selling it to her neighbors. After joining “Microinvest”, she began to sell bread in the central market “Panchshanbe”. She is asking for $1,000 to expand her business. Her son is shown in the photograph because she was at home baking bread at the time

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Джамолова Тухта в бизнесе 12 лет из них 5 лет является активной клиенткой Микроинвест. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Начинала свой бизнес с того, что выпекала лепешке в тандыре и продавала их своим соседям. После вступления Микроинвест, она начала продавать лепешки в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Она запрашивает 1000$ для расширения своего бизнеса. P.S. на фотографии ее сын, так как в это время она дома пекла лепешки.

loans.use:
To expand business

расширения бизнеса.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Keng is a mother of 2 children and lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by purchasing fish from a fisherman and reselling it at retail. With this business activity, Sok Keng, who is 29 years old, typically makes in average about $7/day in revenue, which is a big help for her family's expenses. Moreover, she is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase more fish to keep investing in her business and with this amount of loan, she hopes to expand her business as well as make additional income.

In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to run a big grocery store with a variety of products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase fish to invest in her business.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
K. Shoira is a  widow with 3 children.  She is 34 years old, and from Dj. Rasulov region.  Before, she used to trade in the street, and now she is in the central market of this region.  After secondary school, she became a housewife.  When her husband died, she deceided to make a business because she has 3 children to support.

Shoira has been in this  business for 8 years.  She sells children clothes by retail.  She wants to increase her assortment of goods.  Recently, she broke her right hand.  In spite of the fact that her hand is in a cast, she continues to trades in the market.  Now she needs a loan of $350 to buy summer childrens clothes to sell.

loans.use: Turnover of goods

loans.name: Botir

texts.en: K. Botir is married and has 3 children.  He has 12 of years experience in the field of trade, and he currently trades with his wife.  He sells foodstuff and wants to increase his business and profits.  Before, he traded in a small location, and his business has been very prosperous.  This business is the only source of profit in their family.  K. Botir would like to receive a loan for $725 to purchase many assortments candy and chocolates to sell.  He started his business with only a small amount of money, and because of his business he is able to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: Increase assortment of food.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda has been in business for over 7 years.  Her husband is her business partner, and he is responsible for trips to the wholesale market.  They have 4 beautiful girls.  Mavjuda has a university degree.  She is an economist, but it is so difficult to find a good job.  That’s why she decided to help her husband in the family business.  Mainly, they sell household goods.  They have a wide assortment, which is bought from the wholesale market of Istaravshan, district of Tajikistan.  Sometimes, suppliers bring her the goods from China.  The turnover of her business is fast.  Their little shop located in a center, which is a properous place to have a fast turnover.  She became a client of Micro Invest in 2004.  Her first loan was $150, and by the development of her business, her loan has increased to $1000.  Now, Mavjuda requests  $1200 for increasing her volume of household goods to sell.

loans.use: Increase the turnover of goods

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en: H.  Zainura owns and works in her shop, which located in the center of the Avganbasaar market.  She is married and has 4 children.  In 1992, she supplied shops with her goods from Uzbekistan, Iran.  Her husband is a doctor, and he helped to organize a place for trade so that she could start her own business in 2002.  She started her business with a loan provided by Micro Invest.  She is an active client of this organization.  Today she is an independent and experienced businesswoman.  Her little shop became one of the best known shops in the area, and is very deserving of her clients' trust.  The diversity of her goods attracts new clients who leave satisfied with the goods they have purchased from her.  She is planning to use the next loan for the purchase of goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en:
H. Rakhmatillo, 43 years old, graduated from the Pedagogical University and is a Games Master. Rakhmatillo is married and has 6 children. He opened a training point in the Mehrgon market of the Yavan district and sells men's and women's footwear. He started his business 10 years ago immediately after the end of Civil War.

Rakhmatillo would like to use the loan to increase his assortment of summer footwear. Since the male population of the district mostly is out of country (working in Russia), there is a big demand for a female footwear. The biggest part of the goods will be offered to women and children, so it will help these consumers avail themselves of footwear at the local market instead of visiting the capital city and will save them time and money. Later on Rakhmatillo is planning to change his assortment based on the season and the demand of the population.

loans.use: Increase of goods assortment (purchase of footwear)

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr:
Madame G. Ahoefa was born in Azime in 1956. She is now a widow with seven children, left under her care after her husband, who was a motorcycle taxist, died in an accident. Her main source of income is the preparation and sale of "bouillie"-corn mush. She is well known by everyone in her neighborhood of Aklakou. Ms. ZOGBONTO G. has already benefitted from a credit of $250.00, that she used to re-launch her economic activity after the death of her husband. This activity allows her to feed her children and to pay for their schooling, however, the number of children creates large expenses. And so, she hopes to improve her business and is asking for a loan of $600.00 to purchase and to stock corn and wood in order to meet her customer's demands. The additional earnings she will make from selling "bouillie" will be used to care for the nutritional, sanitary and schooling needs of her children and will improve their social standing.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame G. Ahoefa est née à Azimé en 1956. Aujourd’hui veuve, elle a sept orphelins laissés à sa charge par son mari conducteur de taxi moto décédé accidentellement. Elle a pour source de revenu la préparation et la vente de bouillie. Connue de tous dans son quartier à Aklakou, Mme G. surnommé « ZOGBONTO » a bénéficié d’un crédit $250 pour relancer son activité à la mort de son mari. Cette activité lui permet de nourrir ses enfants et de payer leur scolarité. Mais le nombre élevé des enfants rend les charges très lourdes. C’est pour cela qu’elle cherche à améliorer son activité en sollicitant ce crédit de $600 pour acheter et stocker du mais et du bois pour faire face à la demande élevée de sa clientèle. Les revenus qu’elle tirera de la vente de la bouillie lui serviront à s’occuper des besoins alimentaire, sanitaire, scolaire de ses enfants et augmenter son niveau de vie sociale.

loans.use: To purchase and to stock corn and wood , used for the preparation of corn-mush.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru:
Aziz M. has been in business for 14 years. Started with selling mens shoes. From 2002 is a client of Microinvest. After 5 years of cooperation with Microinvest he had been able to expand his assortment and started selling womens shoes as well. Aziz is married, has 3 children. Requests $1,000 for further expansion of his assortment of shoes.

Translated from Rusiian by Alex Oganezov, Kiva volunteer

Махмудов Азиз занимается предпринимательской деятельностью 14 лет. Начал свой бизнес с продажи мужской обуви. В 2002г. стал клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест». За 5 лет работы в Микроинвест, он увеличил вдвое свой ассортимент, т.е. начал продавать и женскую обувь. Махмудов Азиз женат, имеет 3 детей. Азиз запрашивает 1000$ для увеличения ассортимента товара.

loans.use:
Increase variety of goods

увеличения ассортимента товара

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Born in Aklakou in 1967, Madame A. Dado is married and the mother of two children. Her main economic activity is the production of doughnuts. The earnings she makes allows her to support her family. Her husband, a farmer, does not make enough money to support the family on his own. Today, Madame A. needs a loan in order to increase her production to meet the high demand for her products. She is asking for a loan of $600.00 to purchase flour, oil and firewood, so that she can improve her doughnut production. This initiative will help her to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née à Aklakou en 1967, Madame A. Dado est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son activité principale est la production de beignets. C’est de ces revenus qu’elle arrive à prendre en charge sa famille. Son mari, agriculteur de profession ne dispose pas assez de moyens pour lui venir en aide. Aujourd’hui, Mme A. a besoin d’un financement pour augmenter sa capacité de production face aux nombreuses sollicitations. Elle demande un crédit de $600 pour acheter de la farine du blé, de l’huile, du bois de chauffe pour accroître la production de ses beignets. Cette initiative pourra l’amener à une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase flour, oil and firewood, used for the production of doughnuts.

loans.name: Têko

texts.fr:
Born in Aklakou in 1968, Mr. F. Teko is married and the father of five children. His wife has a small-business where she sells foodstuffs to local school establishments. This activity means that his wife is not able to help with the housework. A professional driver, Mr. F. takes his passengers from Aklakou, his town, to Lome, the capital city, in his taxi whose motor has fallen into disrepair. Educated all the way to Secondary School, Mr. Teko has 15 years experience in his profession. In order for him to re-launch his business, he needs a good quality car. This is why he is asking for a loan of $1,200.00, to purchase a new motor and to replace certain parts. With these repairs, he and his family can re-find the joy of life and to meet their nutritional, schooling and sanitary needs.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né à Aklakou en 1968, Monsieur F. Têko est marié et père de cinq enfants. Sa femme est une petite commerçante qui vend des denrées alimentaires dans des établissements scolaires de son milieu. Cette activité ne permet pas à cette dernière d’aider Mr. FOOLY Têko dans les charges du ménage. Chauffeur de profession, il fait aujourd’hui le transport des passagers entre Aklakou son village et Lomé la capitale du pays avec son taxi dont le moteur est totalement usé. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Mr. Têko a une quinzaine d’année d’expérience dans son métier. Aujourd’hui, pour relancer son activité, il lui faut une voiture de bonne qualité. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 pour acheter un nouveau moteur et pour changer certaines pièces. Ainsi, lui et sa famille pourront retrouver goût à la vie et faire face aux besoins alimentaires, scolaires et en soins de santé de la famille..

loans.use: To purchase a new motor and to replace some parts.

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Inragimov Tohir, 46 years old, graduated from secondary school. He is married and has 5 children. He worked for a few years out of the country (in Russia), and 2 1/2 years ago he came back to his family and started his own small business. He has a wholesale trading point in Tijorat market of the Yavan district and sells footwear.

He is going to use the loan amount to increase his assortment of summer footwear. Since he is doing wholesale trading, the prices at his trading point are significantly lower than competitors are offering.
