It helps the poor population of the district, which does not have stable and good salaries to avail themselves of cheap footwear for summer time.

loans.use: Increase footwear assortment

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru:
Muazzam M., married with 3 children. 10 years in business. Is an active client of Microinvest since 2002. Started her business with selling sunflower seeds. Later visited the neighboring country to purchase merchandise (shoes), and started her business of selling women shoes. Currently business is blooming. Muazzam requests $1,025 to purchase a new assortment of products. This is her son on the picture since she has departed to deliver a seasonal merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Alex Oganezov, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Муаззам замужем, имеет 3 детей. В предпринимательской деятельности 10 лет. С 2002г является активной клиенткой МЗФ «Микроинвест». Начинала свой бизнес с продажи семечки, после ее соседка предложила ей поехать с ней в соседнюю страну за товаром (обувь). Так, она начала торговать женской обувью. Ее бизнес процветает. Махмудова Муаззам запрашивает 1011$ для покупки нового ассортимента обуви. P.S. На фотографии ее сын, так как она поехала за приобретением сезонного товара.

loans.use:
Purchase new products

увеличения ассортимента товара

loans.name: Monadjon

texts.en:
Monadjon has been engaged in his trade for 3 years.  She is married and has 3 sons.  She helps her elderly father and her sister’s family.  Her sister is divorced and has 2 children.  They all live together and are friendly.  They help Monadjon with her business.  Her father and children prepare seeds for processing.  Her sister works on the seed production equipment.  This processing gives the seeds a specific taste, which attract customers.  In 2005, Monadjon became a client of Micro Invest, and her first loan was $100.  She always repays her loans on time.  By the developing her business her loan needs have increased to $1000.

Today, Monadjon has a lot of clients; not only from Khujand, but also from other districts, such as Isfara, Kanibodom, and Nay. They purchase her seeds in packages of 10kg to 50kg.  In the future, she wishes to increase her volume production of seeds, and that’s why she wants to buy more equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing of equipment

loans.name: Amir

texts.ru:
R. Amir, married with 2 children, wife is taking care of the house, kids are at school. Have been in this business for 7 years. Started with selling small batches of shoes. Has significantly increased the turnaround during the years of working with Microinvest. He is obtaining and delivering his products by himself. Amir is requesting $1,200 to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Alex Oganezov, Kiva Volunteer.

Раупов Амир женат, имеет 2 детей. Его жена домохозяйка, дети учатся в школе. Бизнесом занимается 7 лет. Начинал свой бизнес с мелкорозничной торговли обуви. За годы работы с Микроинвест Раупов Амир на много увеличил свой товарооборот. За товаром ездит сам. Раупов Амир запрашивает 1200$ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use:
Business expansion

расширения бизнеса

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Born the 21 of March, 1980 in Ghana, Madame A. Mama returned to Tsevie after a brief period of study to learn English and to learn how to sew. She is married and the mother of two children, and she cares for one other. She helps with the household budget with the earnings she makes from her business, which she works in with love and determination. Honest and dynamic, she managed her first two loans well, and has become a trustworthy loaner, thanks to her perfect re-payment record.

To better equipe her business, and to better serve her customers, she is asking for a loan of $850.00 which she will use to purchase a sewing machine and other equipment. This will allow her to increase her earnings and to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 21 mars 1980 au Ghana, Madame A. Mama est revenue à Tsévié après une brève étude en Anglais et a appris la couture. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle a à sa charge un autre enfant. Elle participe aux dépenses du foyer par les revenus de son métier qu’elle exerce avec amour et détermination. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’elle avait obtenus et est devenue une femme de confiance grâce au parfait remboursement de ses crédits. Pour mieux s’équiper afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat d’autres machines à coudre ainsi que d’autres équipements. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire en vue de contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and other equipment.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born in 1983 in Tsevie, Mr. K. B. Kossi is a qualified mechanic and also produces items to sell. Single and without any children, he is nevertheless responsable for the care of his parents and two yonger school aged brothers. Very dynamic and technical in his preofession, he has sucessfully repayed his previous loans without any problems.

In oder to open other stores where he can sell his products and to purchase new work tools, he is asking for a loan of $1,200.00, which he will use to rent a boutique and to purchase wrenches. With this loan, he will be able to increase his earnings and to better contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né en 1983 à Tsévié, Monsieur K. B. Kossi est un mécanicien qualifié qui fabrique aussi des pièces pour vendre. Célibataire sans enfant, il a néanmoins à sa charge ses parents et deux petits frères scolarisé. Très dynamique et technique dans son métier, il a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans incident. Ainsi pour pouvoir ouvrir d’autres magasins de vente de pièces fabriquées et acheter d’autres instruments de travail, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui servira à louer une boutique et acheter des clés de travail. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses chiffres d’affaires et contribuer efficacement à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To rent a boutique and to purchase working materials.

loans.name: Soké

texts.fr:
Born in 1986 in Tsevie, Ms. K. Soke quit her studies after middle school because she could not afford it any longer and began to learn how to sew. Single, and without any children, she still has the large responsability of caring for her parents and one of her younger sisters. The small earnings she makes in her poorly equipped workplace, are not enough to cover the household needs. However, through her dynamism and impeccable work, she has successfully managed to repay her previous two loans without any problems.

To respond to her clients' demands, Ms K. Soke needs to better equipe her workplace. This is why she is asking for a loan of $850.00, which she will use to purchase sewing machines and fabrics; to make the clothing articles she will then sell. This activity will increase her earnings and improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1986 à Tsévié, Mlle K. Soké a arrêté ses études après le collège par manque de support financier et a appris la couture. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a quand même une lourde responsabilité qui est la charge de ses parents et une de ses sœurs. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges du foyer. Mais par son dynamisme et son travail impeccable, elle a su gérer les deux crédits antérieurs sans incident. Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et la maintenir, Mlle K. Soké a besoin de mieux s’équiper. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and fabrics, to make clothing.

loans.name: Alohudga

texts.en:
S. Alohudja, 53 years old, graduated from Pedagogical University. He is working as a teacher of mathematics in Secondary School. Married, he has 6 children. Along with his main job, he has a trading place in the Yavan district market , where he sells mostly perfumery, toys, and other goods. He has been doing this business for about 10 years and it allows him to feed his big family.

S. is planning to use the loan amount to increase his assortment of goods. The demand for the essential goods is always high since small things like electric torches, cheap toys for the children, batteries, and inexpensive perfumery are vitally important and people want to buy them in local markets.

loans.use: Purchase of toys, perfumery

loans.name: Amédotsi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amédotsi A. was born in 1977 in Tsévié. Due to a lack of means, she ended her studies at the classe de troisième (normally completed at age 15) to start a business selling basic need goods. The mother of three (03) chlidren, she has a husband who is an employee of the water control department, and she shares the family expenses with him. Very dynamic and entrepreneurial, she has mastered her business and manages her affairs with incredible rigour. She repaid her previous loans without any difficulties.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of $750 which will allow her to buy wholesale goods (canned food, soap, oil, and others) in order to stock her store with various products needed locally. She will thus be able to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Amédotsi est née en 1977 à Tsévié. Par le manque de support, elle a arrêté ses études en classe de troisième pour se lancer dans le commerce des produits de première nécessité. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a un mari qui est un employé de la régie des eaux avec qui elle partage les besoins familiaux. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle maîtrise bien son commerce et gère avec une étonnante rigueur ses affaires. Elle a bien remboursé les crédits obtenus sans aucune difficulté.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui lui permettra d’acheter les marchandises en gros (boîtes de conserve, savons, huile et autres) afin d’approvisionner sa boutique de divers produits recherchés dans le milieu. Elle pourra donc améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy in bulk and sell basic need goods (canned food, soap, oil, and others)

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi K. was born on 22 February 1974 in Kpatéfi. After her primary studies, her parents' financial difficulties forced her to abandon the schoolbench. The lack of financial means also did not allow her to learn a craft, and so she began a small business selling general foodstuffs in her area. Married to a driver, Mrs. Afi K. is the mother of three (03) children. Honest and dynamic, she has been able to manage her business well and make it profitable.

A good manager, as shown by the repayment of her previous loans, she is asking for a new loan of $750 which will serve to buy and re-sell primary need goods (rice, oil, and others) to increase her income in order to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Afi est née le 22 février 1974 à Kpatéfi. Après ses études primaires, l’incapacité financière de ses parents l’a obligée à abandonner les bancs de l’école. Le manque de moyens financiers ne lui permettant pas non plus d’apprendre un métier, elle s’est lancée dans le petit commerce d’alimentation générale dans son quartier. Mariée à un chauffeur, Madame K. Afi est mère de trois (03) enfants. Honnête et dynamique, elle a su convaincre par sa capacité de bien gérer les affaires et de les rentabiliser.

Bonne gestionnaire par le bon remboursement de ses crédits antérieurs, elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat et à la revente des marchandises de première nécessité (riz, huile et autres) pour augmenter ses revenus en vue de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell basic need goods (rice, oil, and others)

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born on 19 December 1980 in Havé. Having become a mechanic after three years of apprenticeship, he married a dressmaker, with whom he has two children. Dynamic and a master of his job, he is a good entrepreneur and has managed his previous loans and repaid them without incident.

To be able to carry out his work efficiently and make it profitable, he is asking for a loan of $750 which will serve to buy wrenches and other work materials. This will allow him to increase his income in order to better support his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yao est né le 19 décembre 1980 à Havé. Devenu mécanicien après trois ans d’apprentissage, il s’est marié à une couturière avec qui il a fait deux enfants. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans aucun incident.

Pour pouvoir accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser celui-ci, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat des clés et autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wrenches and other work materials

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Born on 15 March 1980 in Bolou Alokoègbé, Miss Yawa A. abandoned her studies in 11th grade and began a hairstyling apprenticeship. Despite financial difficulties, she completed her apprenticeship and was able to open her own hair salon. Unmarried without children, Yawa A. cares for her student sister and her farmer parents. She is dynamic and manages her salon well.

She is currently asking for a loan of $600 to buy hair dryers and other hairstyling equipment to strengthen her business. In this way, she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 15 mars 1980 à Bolou Alokoègbé, Mademoiselle A. Yawa a abandonné ses études au cours primaire et est rentrée en apprentissage de coiffure. Malgré les difficultés financières, elle a terminé son apprentissage et a pu ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure. Célibataire sans enfant, A. Yawa a à sa charge sa sœur élève et ses parents cultivateurs. Elle est dynamique et gère bien son atelier.

Elle sollicite encore un crédit de $600 pour acheter des séchoirs et des articles de coiffure afin de renforcer ses activités. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and other hairstyling equipment

loans.name: Henri

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tsévié, Mr. H. K. NYAWOLE is married and has two (02) children. Having been unable to continue his studies after the BEPC, he became an excellent tailor, skilled in the mastery of his craft. Due to his efficiency and dynamism, he managed his two previous loans and repaid them without incident.

To better equip his workshop and to maintain and possibly even increase his clientele, he is asking for a loan of $800 to buy fabric and to manufacture ready-to-wear clothing for the market. Thus, he will be able to increase his income to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1977 à Tsévié, Monsieur NYAWOLE K. H. est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Ne pouvant plus continuer les études après son BEPC, il devient un excellent tailleur et apprécié dans la maîtrise de métier. Par son efficacité et son dynamisme, il a su gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’il a parfaitement remboursés.

Pour mieux équiper son atelier, maintenir sa clientèle et même l’augmenter, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat des tissus et confectionner les habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ainsi, il pourra augmenter ses revenus pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fabric and to manufacture ready-to-wear clothing for the market

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Mrs. Edoh A. was born in 1960 in Tsévié. She is illiterate and has six (06) children. Her husband is a volunteer teacher with a meagre salary in a private school, which means that all of the household expenses fall on her. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, she meets the needs of her family thanks to the income she procures through the preparation and sale of rice. She managed well the two previous loans she obtained and repaid them on time.

Currently, she is asking for a loan of $700, which will serve to buy bags of rice and cans of oil to strengthen her business of selling cooked rice on the roadside. In this way, she will be able to contribute more to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Edoh est née en 1960 à Tsévié. Elle est analphabète et mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est enseignant volontaire avec un maigre salaire dans une école privée, ce qui fait que toutes les charges du foyer sont assurées par elle. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure la préparation et la vente du riz. Elle a su bien gérer les deux premiers crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile pour renforcer son activité de vente de riz cuit au bord de la route. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and cans of oil for the preparation and sale of rice

loans.name: Ana

texts.fr:
Born in 1967 in Tsévié, Mrs E. Ana is married and mother of four (04) children. A retailer of bicycle parts in the Tsévié market, she masters her business well, despite a weak education. She shares the responsibility of her household with her husband thanks to the revenues generated by her sales. A fighter, she has successfully managed her first two loans and has repaid them. She is now asking for a loan of $1000 to build up her business. This will increase her sales and allow her to better care for her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1967 à Tsévié, Madame E. Ana est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Revendeuse de pièces détachées pour vélo dans le marché de Tsévié, elle maîtrise bien son commerce malgré son faible niveau d’étude. Elle partage les charges de son foyer avec son mari grâce aux revenus que lui procure ses ventes. Très battante, elle a su bien gérer les deux premiers crédits et les a remboursés. Elle sollicite à présent un crédit de $1000 pour renforcer son commerce ; ceci augmentera ses revenus en la permettant de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and reselling of bicycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Mouniratou to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to come in as scheduled.  Thanks!
Many thanks for your support..Be blessed and  alot of success as well  in your business

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Mr. Nestor is single man. He has been in the photography business since 1998. He takes care of himself with the income that is generated from his business, but he hasn’t enough money to organise for his future; he wants to study again at the University and to start a family. He wants to buy a camera in order to make videos of people when they have ceremonies like weddings, funerals, and birthdays, etc.

Mr. Nestor is currently looking for clients interested in his video photography services, but for the first month will pay his loan back with income generated from his original photography business.

loans.use: To buy a video camera

payments.comment:
Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Mrs A. Adzo was born on the 6th of April, 1986 in Tsévié. Hairdresser by profession, she manages to contribute to the responsibilities of her household thanks to the revenues from her trade. Married and mother of two children, she has managed two previous loans. She is currently asking for a loan of $750, that she will use to buy a dryer and other materials for the salon. This will allow her to increase her revenues and participate more in helping to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Adzo est née le 06 avril 1986 à Tsévié. Coiffeuse de profession, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges de son foyer grâce aux revenus de son métier. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle a su gérer les deux crédits obtenus. Elle sollicite à présent un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat de séchoir et d’autres matériels de coiffure afin d’augmenter ses revenus et participer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying a dryer and other hair salon materials

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Born in 1981, Mr D. Komla is a woodworker by trade. He practices his craft with courage and manages to support his two brothers, who he is responsible for. Young, dynamic and efficient in the execution of his craft, he has managed his two first loans, which he has paid back without incident. To better equip his workshop and maintain his clientel, he is asking for a loan of $750, which will allow him to buy wooden planks and cranes that will in turn allow him to increase his sales and better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1981, Monsieur D. Komla est menuisier de profession. Il exerce ce métier avec courage et arrive à assurer les besoins de ses deux frères qui sont à sa charge. Jeune dynamique et efficace dans l’exécution de son métier, il a su gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’il a remboursé sans incidence. Pour mieux équiper son atelier et maintenir sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à acheter les planches et les grues qui lui permettront d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Buy wooden planks and other materials

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mrs K. Adjo was born in 1977 in Tsévié. Giving up her studies because of a lack of support, she started a business selling bread by the roadside. Very courageous, she is very rigorous in the management of her business. That has allowed her to repay her first loan, despite having the responsibility for her two children. She is now asking for a new loan of $800 that will allow her to build-up her business and participate more in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame K. Adjo est née en 1977 à Tsévié. Abandonnant ses études, elle se lance dans le commerce, la vente du pain aux abords de la route par manque de support. Très courageuse, elle fait une gestion rigoureuse de ses activités ce qui lui a permis de rembourser son premier crédit malgré les charges de ses deux enfants. Elle sollicite de nouveau, un crédit de $800 qui servira au renforcement de son commerce afin de mieux participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: sale of bread

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs B. Eya was born in 1971 in Tsévié. She is married and mother of three children. Her principal business is the selling of basic foods (smoked fish, fried tomatoes and others). She shares the responsibilities of her household with her husband, thanks to the revenues from her business. Serious and honest, she already has repaid two loans without incident. To build-up her business, she is asking for a $1,000 loan. This will allow her to buy smoked fish and other things to increase her sales and participate in improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Eya est née en 1971 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Son activité principale est le commerce des produits de première nécessité (poissons fumés et frits tomates et autres…). Elle partage les charges de son foyer avec son mari grâce aux revenus que lui procure son commerce. Sérieuse et honnête, elle a à son actif deux crédits qui ont été soldés sans incident. Pour renforcer son commerce elle sollicite encore un crédit de $1000 qui servira à l’achat de poissons fumés et autres afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ainsi participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and reselling smoked fish and other basic foods

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Catherine was born in 1950 in Tsévié. She is married and the mother of five (05) children. She never went to school, because of a lack of resources and doesn't want her children to suffer the same fate. It is for this reason that she quickly started a business selling raw ingredients like tomatoes, onions and other things. Very serious and dynamic, she was able to manage her first loan and has repaid it. She is now asking for a new loan of $800 to build up her business so she can improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Catherine est née en 1950 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants, n’ayant pas été à l’école par manque de moyens, elle ne voulait pas faire subir le même sors à ses enfants. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’est vite lancé dans le commerce des produits de premières nécessités (tels que la tomate, l’oignon et autres). Très sérieuse et dynamique, elle a su bien gérer son premier crédit obtenu et a bien remboursé. Ainsi, elle sollicite à nouveau un crédit de $800 pour renforcer son commerce afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling raw ingredients

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mrs B. Akouvi was born in 1978 in Tsévié. Married and mother of one child, her husband is a woodworker and has been meeting the needs of the family until his business began to fail. To take up the slack, Mrs. Akouvi has already benefited from a loan to help her relaunch her little general food store. She has already paid back this loan. With an eye to strengthening her business and making it more profitable, she is asking for another loan of $650 to stock up on sugar, milk, canned goods and other products sought after by her clients. She will be able to meet the demands of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Akouvi est née en 1978 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, son mari est menuisier et s’occupe tout seul de la famille jusqu’au jour où les activités ne marche plus. Pour prendre la relève, Madame bénéficia d’un crédit pour relancer son petit commerce d’alimentation générale, crédit qui a été déjà remboursé. Afin de renforcer son activité et mieux la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour s’approvisionner en sucre, lait boîte de conserve et autres produits recherchés par sa clientèle. Elle pourra faire face aux charges du foyer.

loans.use: Stock up on sugar, milk, canned goods and other products

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Mrs A. Massan was born in 1982 in Tsévié. After her elementary school education, she went on to study hairdressing, something she loves. She is married, but doesn't have any children yet. She does, however, have responsibility for a niece. Her husband is a tailor and does his best to satisfy the needs of the family. However, life is so difficult that Mrs. Massan must also work. To better help her husband, She is asking for a loan of $950 to build up her cosmetics business. This will allow her to help out more with her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Massan est née en 1982 à Tsévié. Après les études primaires, elle s’est formée en coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce aujourd’hui avec amour. Elle est mariée mais n’a pas encore d’enfant mais elle a à sa charge une nièce. Son mari tailleur, fait de son mieux pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Mais la vie est tellement difficile que madame doit aussi mettre la main à la pâte. Afin de pouvoir mieux aider son conjoint, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour renforcer son commerce de produits cosmétiques. Ce qui lui permettra d’investir plus dans les charges familiales.

loans.use: Buying and selling of beauty products

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia and her husband work independently fixing tractors. They live in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz and but do not have a mechanic's shop as they usually go to the vehicle needing repair. This is Elodia's third loan from IMPRO. She has a record as a first-class borrower with a history of timely repayment. This loan will go to pay for tools. We feel that with her work experience and good borrowing history Elodia deserves the opportunity to secure this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Elodia trabaja independientemente con su esposo realizando mantenimiento de tractores. Ellos viven en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz y el trabajo de mantenimiento que realiza es a domicilio; ella no tiene un taller establecido ya que el trabajo que realiza es de mantenimiento. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. Sus créditos anteriores fueron pagados puntualmente. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas de trabajo. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy auto mechanic's tools.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita I. sells cosmetics and perfume out of catalogs, representing the Avon, Zermat, and Yambal brands. Her customers pay her in two to six monthly installments. She lives in the Irpavi II neighborhood in La Paz. She has no fixed place of business but sells on order. She has a stable client base and finds new customers through referrals or through personal contact. This is her fourth loan from IMPRO. She is considered a first-class borrower meaning she has a good history of repayment. The loan will go to purchase merchandise like perfume, cosmetics and talc. She repaid her three previous loans promptly and this fact, along with her work experience, recommends her for this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Margarita I. es promotora de perfumes y cosméticos; ella ofrece sus productos mediante revistas y trabaja con las líneas de perfumes de AVON, ZERMAT, y YAMBAL. Sus clientes le cancelan en cuotas de dos a seis pagos mensuales. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II; ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que las ventas que realiza son a pedido. Ella tiene un buen numero de clientes estables y siempre consigue nuevos clientes vía referencias o contactos personales. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos, talcos, etc.). Sus tres créditos anteriores fueron pagados puntualmente. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale.

payments.comment: Early pay off. client will apply for a  new loan.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has a small truck which her husband drives. They use it to buy and sell sand and stone and also have a moving business. They live in the Irpavil II neighborhood in La Paz. This is the fourth loan she has requested from IMPRO. She has been a first-class borrower, meaning that she has a good history of repayment. This loan will pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy new tires and coverings for the seats. Her work experience and borrowing record recommend her for this loan and her cash flow will be adequate to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Justina tiene una volqueta (es un pequeño camión) que su esposo maneja. Su negocio es usar la volqueta para la compra y venta de arena, piedra, y mudanzas de clientes que contratan sus servicios. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz y es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento de su volqueta y la compra de llantas y tapizado de asientos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y el análisis de su flujo de caja muestra resultados satisfactorios para el cumplimiento de su obligación financiera.

loans.use: To maintain a truck and purchase tires.

payments.comment: early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Ivana

texts.es:
Ivana buys fabric by the yard and makes scarves or shawls with braided edges. She works by herself as her children are young and her husband works as a bus driver. She lives and works in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. This is the fourth loan she has requested from IMPRO. She has first-class borrower status, meaning that she has a good history of repaying loans. She will use the loan to buy fabric, lining, thread and braiding. Her work history and good track record with IMPRO give her access to this loan and she will have enough income to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Ivana compra tela por corte para elaborar mantas con trencillas. Ella trabaja sola ya que sus hijos son pequeños y su esposo es conductor de movilidades. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (Tela, forro, trencilla e hilo). Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cloth by the yard.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa makes macrame and wool table cloths for order. She works by herself and her husband is a laborer. They live in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz, where her workshop is as well. This is the first loan she has requested from IMPRO. She will use the funds to purchase wool and yarn. Our analysis finds that with her experience and cash flow she will be able to cover the loan. IMPRO hopes she will have this opportunity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa elabora manteles en macramé y lana; todo tejido que ella elabora es a pedido; ella trabaja por cuenta propia y su esposo es albañil. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz y su taller también esta ubicado en la misma dirección. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (lana e hilo). Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que el análisis financiero efectuado y su flujo de caja indican que Rosa tiene experiencia en su negocio. IMPRO sugiere que se debe dar esta oportunidad a Rosa.

loans.use: To buy wool and yarn.

payments.comment: Early pay off. Rosa will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino is employed as a carpenter and doesn't have his own shop. He and his wife, who does not work, have three children. They live in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. This is the first loan he has requested. He will use the funds to buy a set of hand tools so that he can set up his own shop fixing furniture and increase his income. His experience in carpentry and the salary he receives give him access to this loan. He is very eager to begin working for himself.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rufino es carpintero asalariado y no cuenta con un taller propio. Su esposa no trabaja, y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con nuestra Institución. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de herramientas manuales de carpintería para poder incrementar sus ingresos y realizar arreglos de muebles en general y poder trabajar por cuenta propia Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el ramo de la carpintería. El salario que percibe le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo, y su inquietud de querer empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia es un punto clave para la aprobación de este crédito.

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools.

payments.comment: Rufino is paying the loan off earlier. He will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Mawulawoè

texts.fr:
Mr. Mawulawoè K. was born in 1960 in Wli Center in the Zio region. He is a married father of eight (8) children. He lived in Ghana for a long time before returning to his home town to devote himself to farming. His wife is a saleswoman, and sometimes helps with the farming. Dynamic and courageous, he has already borrowed credit twice in the amount of $650 for corn and manioc, which he managed well and reimbursed in time. This $1000 credit would be applied to the growing of corn, hot peppers, nuts and manioc on a bigger and more fertile piece of land. This will allow him to increase the yield of his crops and improve his family's living condition.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Mawulawoè est né en 1960 à Wli Centre dans la préfecture de Zio. Marié, il est père de huit (08) enfants. Il a longtemps vécu au Ghana avant de revenir dans son village natal pour se consacrer à l'agriculture. Sa femme revendeuse, l’aide de temps en temps dans ses activités champêtres. Dynamique et courageux, il a déjà bénéficié de deux fois de crédit de $650 pour la culture de maïs et de manioc, crédit qui a été bien géré et correctement remboursé. Le présent crédit de $1000 sera entièrement consacré à la culture du maïs, de piments, d’arachides et de manioc sur une surface plus grande et fertile. Ce qui va lui permettre d’avoir beaucoup de rendement et de surcroît améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Growing corn, peppers, nuts and manioc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa sells fragrances and cosmetics out of catalogs. She has little working capital and hopes to raise more to be able to sell on credit. She lives in the neighborhood of Callapa, in La Paz. She doesn't have a stand, but hawks her goods at markets in La Paz. This is the first loan she has requested. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics and perfume. She has sufficient cash flow to cover the loan and good experience.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa vende perfumes y cosméticos mediante revista; ella no cuenta con mucho capital y su objetivo es tener más capital para que pueda ofrecer sus productos a crédito. Vive en Callapa, en al ciudad de La Paz y no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos ambulando por los mercados. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes y cosméticos, etc.) Sus ingresos actuales le permiten acceder a este crédito, pues Rosa tiene experiencia en su negocio. El flujo de caja realizado en el análisis del crédito muestra una rentabilidad suficiente para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and fragrances for resale.

payments.comment: Rosa is paying the loan off earlier. She will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana buys leather wallets, pocketbooks and purses and hawks them at fairs in the south of La Paz. She does this work by herself, as her husband works as a laborer. She lives in the neighborhood of Callapa in La Paz. This is the first loan Juliana has requested. She will use the funds to purchase merchandise such as wallets, handbags and the like. She has been in business for four years and IMPRO's analysis of her financial situation recommends her for this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Juliana compra carteras y billeteras de cuero y cuerina y las vende ambulando en las ferias de la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz; ella trabaja sola, su esposos es albañil. Vive en la zona de Callapa de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (carteras, billeteras y maletines). Su experiencia de más de cuatro años de trabajo en este rubro le permite acceder a este crédito el cual es aprobado por IMPRO después del respectivo análisis financiero realizado.

loans.use: To buy leather goods for resale.

payments.comment: early pay off. Client will apply for a new loan.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abra A. was born on March 10, 1979 in Tsévié. She is married to a teacher who earns a small salary, insufficient to provide for the needs of the family. A mother of two (02) children, she has been running a small restaurant for some time. Even though she was not an excellent student, she manages her business well, despite some difficulties she has faced, and reimbursed her previous credit promptly. Always smiling, she has the respect of her surroundings. The $700 credit she is asking for will help her buy necessary groceries for her restaurant. She will thus be able to build her business and profit from it so that she can be better able to provide for the family's needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Abra est née le 10 mars 1979 à Tsévié. Elle est mariée à un enseignant qui gagne très peu pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Mère de deux (02) enfants, elle tient depuis un certain temps un petit restaurant. Quand bien même qu’elle n’a pas fait de brillantes études, elle arrive à bien gérer son activité malgré quelques difficultés. Elle a su rembourser promptement le précédent crédit. Toujours souriante, elle a le respect de son entourage. Ce crédit de $700 sollicité servira à acheter des aliments nécessaires pour son restaurant. Elle pourra ainsi renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her restaurant

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mrs. Eya S. was born in 1945 in Fongbé. She has been a widow for 20 years. To provide for her needs and those of the children of which she takes care, in addition to farming, she sells smoked fish. An honest and dynamic woman, despite her age, she has already borrowed and reimbursed two loans. She is an exemplary and dependable woman and deserves to be supported to grow her business and increase her income for the well being of her family. She is asking for a $700 credit, which will serve to build her smoked fish commerce and to store corn and red oil. As a result, she will be able to benefit from increased profits and gain a financial autonomy.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Eya est née en 1945 à Fongbé. Elle est veuve depuis 20 ans. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et ceux des enfants dont elle à la charge, en plus de l’agriculture, elle s’est lancée dans la vente des poissons fumés. Honnête et dynamique malgré son âge, elle a déjà bénéficié et remboursé deux fois de crédit. C’est une femme exemplaire et digne de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue pour accroître ses activités et augmenter ses revenus pour le bien être de la famille. Elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va servir à renforcer son commerce de poissons fumés et à faire du stockage de maïs et d’huile rouge. Elle pourra dégager une marge bénéficiaire importante et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying and selling smoked fish, corn and red oil

loans.name: Sodalo

texts.fr:
Born in 1946 in Vogan in the Vo area, Mrs. Sodalo A. is a married mother of three (03) children. She buys and re-sells various food products. Her husband has been unemployed for a very long time; therefore, the entire family depends on her alone. Very concerned for the future of her children, she has never given up and always tries to do better. She is asking for a credit of $600 to build her business in order to provide for the family's needs. She is capable of using her credit to build and improve her business.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1946 à Vogan dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Sodalo est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits alimentaires. Son mari a perdu son emploi depuis très longtemps. C’est ainsi que toutes les charges de la famille reviennent à elle seule. Très soucieuse de l’avenir de ses enfants, elle n’a jamais baissé les bras, elle cherche toujours à faire mieux. Ayant l’idée maintenant de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite donc un crédit de $600 pour faire progresser cette activité génératrice de revenus enfin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle est apte à gérer son crédit et à mener au mieux son projet.

loans.use: Buying bags of rice, sugar and other staple foods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.fr:
Born in 1960 in Gati Agodou (P/Zio), Mrs. Victoria A. is a married mother of five (05) children. Having lost his job, her husband devotes himself to farming; however, this does not provide for all the needs of the family. Mrs. A. has been managing a small store selling various products for the last 20 years. This allows her to help with the children's needs. She is asking for a $750 credit that will allow her to build her business and to store red oil to re-sell it in welding times. She will thus be able to contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1960 à Gati Agodou (P/Zio), Madame A. Victoria est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Son mari ayant perdu son emploi, fait de l’agriculture qui n’arrive pas à couvrir les besoins de la famille. Madame A. Victoria gère depuis 20 ans une boutique de vente de produits divers. Ce qui lui permet de faire face aux charges des enfants. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui permettre de renforcer son activité et de faire le stockage d’huile rouge pour le revendre en temps de soudure. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling different products

loans.name: Komla Amédzopé Achil

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla Amédzopé Achille S. was born in 1961 in Gbatopé in the Zio region. A married father of three (03) children, he is a carpenter by trade. This is a business that he has always continued, despite difficulties, as he is a dynamic and solid man. His wife does not have a significant source of revenue to be able to provide for the family, therefore; he is faced alone with miserable living conditions. His goal is to start a carpenting business, which would manufacture and sell furniture, beds and chairs. However, he does not have sufficient means to start it. He is therefore asking for a $1200 credit to buy wood and various tools. This would grow his income and would offer a better future for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komla Amédzopé Achille est né en 1961 à Gbatopé dans la préfecture de Zio. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il est menuisier de formation. Un métier qu’il continue toujours malgré les difficultés, il est toujours dynamique et solide. Sa femme n’ayant pas une source de revenu assez importante pouvant l’aider à supporter la famille, il est seule face à cette vie de misère. Il voulait relancer son activité en fabricant des meubles, des chaises, des lits à vendre. Mais faute de moyen. Il vient solliciter un financement de $1200 pour acheter du bois et divers outils. Ceci renforcerait ses revenus en vue d’un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying wood to manufacture and sell furniture

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr:
Born in 1975 in Tsévié, Mrs. Olga D. is married and a mother of two (02) children. Her husband is a poorly paid factory worker. This leaves Mrs. D. alone to take care of their children. In addition to her own two (02) children, she also takes care of two nieces that help her with her business. Despite difficulties, she manages her business well and has reimbursed previous credits. A well-spirited woman, she is respected by her surroundings. She is asking for a $750 credit to buy the foods needed for her restaurant. From the profits, she should be able to provide for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1975 à Tsévié, Madame D. Olga est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Son mari, ouvrier dans une société et est mal payé. Ce qui laisse toute la charge sur Madame D. Olga. En plus de leurs deux (02) enfants, elle a charge deux nièces qui l’aident dans son activité. Malgré les difficultés, elle arrive à bien gérer son affaire. Elle a su gérer et rembourser les précédents crédits. D’une bonne moralité, elle bénéficie du respect de son entourage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour acheter les aliments au besoin de son restaurant. Elle doit pouvoir la rentabiliser pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: Buying groceries for her restaurant

loans.name: Abidou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abidou IL. was born on October 10, 1981. Married and a mother of four (04) children with three (03) other persons to take care of, her main business is a shop selling diverse products. Her husband doesn't have the necessary means to provide for the family, and she is obliged to help with her small income. Her main problem is stocking sufficient produce since her financial base is insufficient. To remedy this problem and build her business, she is asking for a $1000 loan which will help her grow and keep a loyal clientele. This would help her take better care of her children and help them with their studies. She especially takes their studies to heart since she would like to see them work in good professions in the future, even though they come from a poor family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame IL. Abidou est née le 10 octobre 1981. Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec trois (03) autres personnes à charge, elle a comme activité principale le commerce des divers. Son mari n’ayant pas assez de moyens pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle est obligée de le faire avec son petit revenu. Son principal problème est la rupture régulière de stock parce qu’elle à un fond de commerce insignifiant. Pour ainsi remédier à ce problème et renforcer son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000. Cela lui permettra de fidéliser les clients et les retenir pour toujours. Ce projet réalisé lui permettra de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants surtout de leurs études qui lui tiennent vraiment à cœur car elle veut voir ses enfants être des cadres demain même s’ils sont issus d’une famille pauvre.

loans.use: Restocking her shop

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi D. was born in Tsévié on February 1, 1980. She is a seamstress by training and is a married mother of two. Her husband is a mason specializing in tiling and paving, a trade he rarely practices considering the living standards in the area. Thanks to her energy and mastery of her business, Ms. D. has many customers. But to see her way out of their overall situation, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to strengthen her business, especially in the sale of boutique items. She could then increase her income and help improve living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1er février 1980 à Tsévié, Madame D. Afi est couturière de formation. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, son mari est maçon carreleur, métier qu’il exerce rarement compte tenu du niveau de vie de la population. Grâce à son dynamisme et à sa maîtrise de l’activité, elle a beaucoup de clientes. Pour sortir de cette situation, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour renforcer son affaire surtout la vente des articles des merceries. Ceci permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et ainsi elle pourra contribuer à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie et celles de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring boutique items and products to sell

loans.name: Séna

texts.fr:
Séna N. is about 30 years old and is the second wife of her unemployed husband. She had her first child this year. But because they live in poverty, the child did not survive. She now finds herself childless. However, being very courageous and wanting to lift herself out of poverty no matter what, she has engaged in the business of selling condiments.

Today, she has a lot of ambition; that is to say, she wishes to expand the range of goods she offers for sale. Because of a lack of funds to start things off, she is requesting a loan of $1,000. Ms. N. is a very active woman who has the wish and desire to work although she lacks the means. Ever attentive to her commitments, she has always repaid her loans without any problems.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 30 ans environ, Madame N. Séna est la deuxième femme d’un mari sans emploi. Elle a eu son premier enfant cette année ; mais à cause des conditions de vie misérables, l’enfant n’a pas pu résister. Elle se retrouve aujourd’hui sans enfant. Mais très courageuse et voulant à tout pris sortir de la pauvreté, elle a entrepris un petit commerce de vente des condiments.

Aujourd’hui elle a beaucoup d’ambition c'est-à-dire ajouter d’autres produits à la vente des condiments. Mais faute de moyens pour démarrer cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000. C’est une femme très active qui a la volonté de travailler mais c’est les moyens qui lui manquent. Tenant toujours à ses engagements, elle a toujours remboursé ses crédits sans incidence.

loans.use: Acquiring condiments to sell

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan L. is married and the mother of three. She was born on September 12, 1974 in Amégnran (Vo prefecture). A seamstress by training, she covers more than half of all household expenses because her husband lacks a steady job. Thanks to her courage and dedication, she has so far benefited from a $400 loan for initiating a business selling "pagnes", which are colorful traditional-style cloths typically used as sarongs. She figured out how to manage and repay this loan promptly.

The current loan of $1,000 that she is requesting will be entirely dedicated to selling pagnes, which she can even acquire abroad. This will allow her to make her business profitable and especially to improve the conditions in which her family exists.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, Madame L. Massan est née le 12 septembre 1974 à Amégnran dans la préfecture de Vo. Couturière de formation, elle supporte plus de la moitié des charges de la famille car son mari n’a pas un emploi fixe. Grâce à son courage et à son dévouement, elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de $400 pour initier le commerce de pagnes, crédit qu’elle a su bien gérer et rembourser promptement.

Le présent crédit de $1000 qu’elle sollicite sera entièrement consacré à la vente de pagnes, qu’elle pourra même acheter à l’extérieur du pays. Ceci va lui permettre de rentabiliser ses affaires et surtout d’améliorer les conditions d’existence de la famille.

loans.use: Acquiring pagne cloth to sell

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa ADEKPLOVI is about 40 years old, has four children, and also takes care of six other people. Her husband is polygamous and does not assume any of his responsibilities. And so it falls upon Ms. ADEKPLOVI to be the father of the house. She is a real go-getter and has embraced doing business in basic staples and grains. Her problem is the lack of capital for stocking up on goods while abundant, in order to make a profit in times of shortages. Without the funds, she is unable to do this. That's why she has come to request $600, so that she may realize her plans.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame ADEKPLOVI Yawa a 40 ans environ. Elle a quatre (04) enfants et six (06) autres personnes à charge. Son mari polygame, n’assume pas ses responsabilités et il revient à Madame ADEKPLOVI d’assurer le rôle de père de famille. Très battante, elle a embrassé le commerce des produits vivriers et des céréales. Sa difficulté est le manque de capital car elle a l’intention de faire des stocks en période d’abondance afin d’en profiter en période de soudure mais faute de moyens, elle n’arrive pas à le faire. C’est pourquoi elle vient solliciter $600 pour réaliser son projet.

loans.use: Stocking up on basic staples and grains

loans.name: Patience

texts.fr:
Patience B. was born in 1978 in Tsévié. She left middle school because of a lack of financial support. She then learned how to style hair. Through her courage, she was able to finish her apprenticeship in hairdressing and to open her own salon, which she runs beautifully. A married mother of two, she helps cover household expenses thanks to the income from her work. Through her energy and self-sacrifice, she easily managed her first loan, which she repaid without a problem.

To grow her revenues, she is requesting a loan of $800 for acquiring two hairdryers and other items. She will be able to make her business profitable and to gain a degree of financial independence.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Patience est née en 1978 à Tsévié. Elle a arrêté ses études au collège par manque de support financier et apprend la coiffure. Par son courage, elle a pu terminer son apprentissage et a ouvert son propre salon qu’elle gère à merveille. Mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle contribue aux charges de son foyer grâce aux revenus de son métier. Par son dynamisme et son abnégation, elle a su bien gérer son premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans incidence.

Pour accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à l’achat de deux séchoirs et autres matériels. Ainsi elle pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: Buying two hairdryers and other items

loans.name: Alba

texts.en:
Mrs. Abla is married with 4 children. She has sold corn, yams, and beans for one year. Her activity makes her able to satisfy all the daily needs of her family. Taking this loan will continue to enforce good relationships with her neighbours because she will continue to be able to provide food for the neighbourhood. Right now she is able to give food to her neighbours on loan so that they may feed their families one day and pay her another. This loan will permit her to expand the inventory and to sell other food items.

With $100, she wants to build a stand in order to keep her goods fresh and safe from the weather. The remaining money will be used to expand the inventory.

loans.use: To expand the inventory and to build a stand

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Alba to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to come in as scheduled.  Thanks!

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou A. was born in 1957 in Tsévié. He left elementary school because of a lack of financial support. He has worked as a taxi driver after a few year in an apprenticeship. After a while, he realized that this work was not profitable enough to support his nine children. He then turned towards selling grocery items and has been able to manage an initial loan, which he repaid without a problem.

His energy and honesty has encouraged him to request again a loan of $850 to acquire goods (canned foods, soap, etc.). By doing this, he thinks he can make his business worthwhile in order to increase his income and thus help to improve even more his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kokou est né en 1957 à Tsévié et a arrêté ses études au cours primaire par manque de support financier. Devenu chauffeur de taxi après quelques années d’apprentissage, il exerça ce métier jusqu’à un certains temps où son expérience lui révèle la non rentabilité à cause de la charge de ses neufs (09) enfants. Lancé dans le commerce d’alimentation générale, il est arrivé à bien gérer le premier crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident.

Son dynamisme et son honnêteté lui ont encouragé à solliciter encore un crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat des articles (boites de conserves, savons et autres). Par ceci il pense rentabiliser ses affaires pour augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquireing canned goods, soap, and other items to sell

loans.name: Adjo

texts.en:
Mrs. Adjo is married with 4 children. She has four years of experience in the flower business. She needs a loan in order to diversify her activity. In this kind of business, one of the ways to attract clients is to offer them many types of flowers and other decorations which may entice the customer and spark their creative decorating interests.

She sells flowers to decorate living rooms and cars and also sells toys for children. Half of the loan will be used to buy flowers and the other half will be used to buy toys.

Mrs. Adjo is a member of the group “DJIDJOLE,” in which three people want to receive a credit of $200 each. The total credit solicited by the group is $600.

loans.use: To purchase flowers and other decorations.

payments.comment: Adjo has just made a payment of $30 to HELP Africa.  She says thank you very much for her loan, and that she is very appreciative of the lenders that have helped support her work.

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Komi T., 47, has two wives, eight children, and is the guardian of two other children who are orphans. He works primarily as a farmer but in a location where problems of terrain present themselves harshly. Lacking arable land, he is obliged to lease land for his crops, meaning that it is very costly for him.

To address this situation and to better serve his customer base, he is requesting a loan of $1,000. He will then be able to acquire cassava stems for planting and also to buy land for cultivation. Once his plans are realized, his living conditions will change.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 47 ans, Monsieur T. Komi a deux (02) femmes, huit (08) enfants et a à sa charge deux autres enfants orphelins. Il a comme principale activité l’agriculture mais dans un milieu où le problème de terrain se pose avec acuité. A défaut de terrain cultivable, il est obligé de louer des terrains pour son agriculture. Ce qui fait que le coût lui revient très cher.

Pour remédier à cet état de chose et mieux servir ses clientes, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Ce qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en tige de manioc et à acheter un terrain culturel. Une fois ce projet réalisé ses conditions de vie vont changer.

loans.use: Buying arable land and cassava stems for planting

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi A. was born in 1977 in Tsévié. He had left middle school and started his own little business selling beverages. But insufficient funds are inhibiting its development, and he is often faced with inventory shortages. He would like to better equip his shop with other items to bring in more revenue. This is why he is requesting a loan of $700. He will stock beverages from the pub, which is a cheaper way to go for him. Thus, he will be able to maximize his income to help his family more in improving their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Koffi a arrêté ses études au collège et à commencer par exercer son petit commerce de vente de boisson en son propre compte. Mais l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue et il est très souvent confronté à la rupture de stock. C’est ainsi que pour pouvoir mieux équiper sa boutique d’autres articles, afin d’augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un crédit de $700 qui servira à acheter les boissons depuis la brasserie ce qui lui revient moins cher. Ainsi pourra-t-elle avoir le maximum de revenus pour contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Acquiring beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her inventory.

payments.comment: This is an adjustment to a payment made by Ouro to HELP Africa.  The amount that was marked as paid was off by a bit because there was some reporting confusion about how to use the Kiva website among the HELP Africa team.  It is now cleared up, and we expect monthly payments to begin coming in as scheduled.  Thanks!

Thak you . Your support was needed to make this big change on this woman's life 
Thank yoou

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi A. was born on February 7, 1969 in Tsévié (Togo). She is married and mother of three grown children. Lacking financial support from her family, Afi had to stop school after she got her primary certificate and immediately went into business running a small general store which she manages extremely well. Nevertheless, a lack of capital keeps her store from being as successful as she would like.

Afi received a first loan and repaid it in a timely fashion. This gave her experience which now permits her to ask for a second loan of $800. This will allow her to buy merchandise from wholesalers for resale. She feels she will be able to enlarge her inventory, increase her profits, and improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, a Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Afi est née le 7 février 1969 à Tsévié. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants qui sont tous élèves. Par manque de support elle a cessé ses études après le CEPD et s’est lancée dans le petit commerce de produits divers qu’elle gère à merveille. Toutefois, l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue pas assez bien. Ainsi grâce à un premier crédit obtenu et régulièrement remboursé sans incidence, elle a acquis l’expérience qui lui permet de solliciter encore un autre crédit de $800 qui servira à s’approvisionner chez les grossistes des produits de premières nécessité. Ce projet lui permettra d’accroître ses affaires pour augmenter ses revenus et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying merchandise wholesale for her general store

loans.name: Assou

texts.fr:
Born on October 13, 1959 in Lomé (Togo), Assou K. is married and father of four children. Seller of automobile spare parts, Assou is not always able to satisfy his customers' needs on time because he can't maintain sufficient stocks. He doesn't make a lot of profit from his business, as he often has to turn away customers. This means that he has a hard time supporting his family and paying his children's school fees.

To increase his stock of spare parts, Assou is asking for a loan of $1000 which he will use as capital in order to procure more stock and be able to satisfy the needs of more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, a Kiva volunteer

Né le 13 octobre 1959 à Lomé, Monsieur K. Assou est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Commerçant de pièces détachées auto, il n’arrive pas à satisfaire ses clients à temps à cause d’un niveau de stock très bas. Ainsi, il ne réalise pas un bon chiffre d’affaires car il à souvent des méventes. Ce qui fait qu’il a du mal à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, surtout la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour renforcer son stock, Monsieur K. sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce et s’approvisionner de nouvelles pièces afin de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: stocking additional spare parts

loans.name: Erika Janeth

texts.es:
Erika and her husband have had their convenience store for one year. "I run the business out of my home, and we depend on it. We would like to enlarge the store and add more supplies. I'm requesting a loan of $1,000 to do this, which well help us increase our profits and provide for our family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra.Erika y su esposo tiene su negocio desde hace 1año." El negocio lo tengo en mi casa son de las viviendas económicas y estamos muy reducidos por el negocio, nos gustaría ampliar el negocio y surtirlo de mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para Ampliar y surtir el negocio y tener mas ventas ya que es el sustento de la familia.

loans.use: Enlarge and stock convenience store

loans.name: Tsèvi

texts.fr:
Born in 1978, Tsevi B. had to leave school after his primary certificate because he could not afford school fees. He then undertook an apprenticeship with a barber. Tsevi is married and father of one child. He works very hard and courageously to support his family with the income from his barbershop. An honest man, Tsevi has been able to repay two previous loans in a timely fashion.

In order to improve his shop and increase his revenue from it, he is now asking for a loan of $750. He intends to use the loan to buy electric clippers and other supplies for his barbershop. He feels this will enable him to increase his revenue and improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, a Kiva volunteer

Né en 1978, Monsieur B. Tsèvi a arrêté ses études après son CEPD par manque de moyens financiers et devient coiffeur après un an d’apprentissage. Marié, il est père d’un (01) enfant. Par son travail bien fait et son courage, il arrive à assurer les charges de son foyer par les revenus de son métier. Honnête, il a su bien gérer les deux premiers crédits qu’il a remboursés sans incident. Afin de mieux rentabiliser pour augmenter son revenu, il sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui servira à acheter des tondeuses électriques et autres matériels de coiffure. Ceci pourra le permettre de contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase of electric clippers and other barbershop supplies

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Born on June 1, 1982 in Tsevie (Togo), Yao A. had to learn to be a mechanic right after finishing primary school. He has become an excellent mechanic, much appreciated by his customers for his welding and auto repair. Yao is married and father of two children. He uses his earnings as a mechanic to support his family. He is a good businessman and has been able to repay his previous loans in a timely fashion.

In order to increase his clientele and thus his income, Yao is now asking for a loan of $850 with which he will purchase butane gas and other necessities for his work. He feels that this will allow him to retain his clients and increase his profit so that his family will have a better life.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, a Kiva volunteer

Né le 1er juin 1982 à Tsévié, Monsieur A. Yao a dû abandonner ses études après les cours primaires pour apprendre la mécanique. Devenu un excellent mécanicien apprécié par sa clientèle par la soudure et la réparation des voitures. Marié, il est père de deux (02) enfants. Il arrive à assurer les charges de la maison grâce aux revenus que lui procurent ses activités. Bon gestionnaire de ses activités, il a bien remboursé ses antécédents crédits. Pour pouvoir renforcer ses affaires et multiplier ses ressources de revenus, il sollicite un autre crédit de $850 qui servira à l’achat de gaz butane et d’autres clés de travail. Par là, il pourra fidéliser sa clientèle et augmenter ses revenus en vue d’une meilleure condition de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of butane gas and other material needed for his work

loans.name: Gafarou

texts.fr:
Born on 1 March 1956 in Sakété in the Republic of Benin, Mr. Gafarou A. is married and has 10 children. A vulcaniser by profession, he works with difficulty because he has few customers. Thus, he is barely able to meet the needs of his family. His work location is not very well outfitted, so he is not very well known among the people. His work tools are not sophisticated enough to better serve his customers.

To improve these work conditions, he is asking for a loan worth $400 in order to oufit himself with tools and equipment to better serve his customers and to attract further clientele. The realization of this project will contribute to the blossoming of his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1er mars 1956 à Sakété dans la république du Bénin, Monsieur A. Gafarou est marié et père de 10 enfants. Vulcanisateur de métier, il arrive difficilement à exercer son métier car les clients sont rares. Ainsi, il arrive péniblement à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. L’endroit où il exerce son métier n’est pas bien aménagé, alors il n’est pas bien reconnu par les gens. Ses outils de travail ne sont pas bien sophistiqués pour mieux servir les clients.

Pour améliorer cette condition de travaille, il demande un crédit d’une valeur de $400 afin de s’approvisionner de matériels et matériaux pour mieux servir ses clients et d’attirer encore la clientèle. Ce projet réalisé contribuera à l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy new work equipment

loans.name: Groupement

texts.fr:
G. is a group of thirteen (13) members, nine (09) of whom are women. This group is on their fifth loan. The main problem faced by these women is the lack of mills in the villages, which it leads to children having to skip school and go to the nearby villages to crush the corn before being able to eat it; if not, they cannot eat before returning to school.

To remedy this situation, these women are asking for a loan of $1200 to buy a corn mill and a manioc grater for the village.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

G. est un groupement de treize (13) membres dont neuf (09) femmes. Ce groupement est à son cinquième crédit. Le problème majeur de ces femmes est le manque de moulins dans le village et les enfants sont obligés de sécher les cours et aller dans les villages environnants pour écraser le maïs avant de pouvoir manger ; sinon ils ne peuvent pas manger avant de retourner à l’école.

Pour remédier à cet état de chose les femmes sollicitent un crédit de $1200 pour acheter un moulin à maïs et une râpeuse de manioc pour le village.

loans.use: To buy a corn mill

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Born in 1985 in Tsévié, Miss Mawussi A. ended her studies and learned to be a hairstylist. Despite financial difficulties, she finished her apprenticeship and opened her own hair salon. Unmarried with no children, she has her mother and two small sisters in her care. Through her courage and mastery of work, she has quickly gained the confidence of her customers. She has received two loans which have been repaid without incident.

Once again, she is asking for a loan of $750, which will serve to buy a hair dryer and other hairstyling equipment. This will allow her to increase her income to better contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Née en 1985 à Tsévié, Mlle A. Mawussi a arrêté ses études apprendre la coiffure. Malgré les difficultés financières, elle a terminé son apprentissage et a ouvert son propre salon de coiffure. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a à sa charge sa mère et deux petites sœurs. Par son courage et sa maîtrise du travail elle a vite gagné la confiance de sa clientèle. Elle a à son actif deux crédits qui sont remboursés sans incident.

De nouveau, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à acheter un séchoir et d’autres matériels de coiffure. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus pour mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and other hairstyling equipment

loans.name: Deyna

texts.es:
Denya runs her own workshop, where she sews cradle sets and quilts, often bought by visiting merchants for resale. She also sells from a stall in the fair held on July 16 in the town of El Alto. The sale of these items is her sole source of income, with which she supports her two-year-old son. She runs the workshop out of hew own home. She would use the loan to buy fabric and thread.

She has taken out two loans from IMPRO in the past. Her payment record makes her a good candidate for a third. She repaid her past two loans completely and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Deyna, tiene su taller de costura confecciona Sets de Cunas y Edredones para comercializarlos al por mayor a las comerciantes viajeras y tiene su puesto en la Feria 16 de julio de la Ciudad de El Alto; esta su fuente de ingreso con la cual mantiene a su hijo de 2 años. Vive en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto. Su taller esta ubicado en el mismo domicilio. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (tela y fibra). Es el tercer crédito con Impro; los buenos antecedentes le facultan a acceder a otro préstamo. Los dos préstamos anteriores fueron pagados en su totalidad y en las fechas estipuladas en los contratos.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
At 55 years of age, Mrs. Akossiwa L. is a very poor woman who lives in a miserable location with five (05) children in her care. Their area, very far away from the city, is without drinking water, electricity, toilets, and even arable land to grow crops. But aware of her situation, this lady runs a small business selling various products (tomatoes, peppers, fried fish, etc) to meet the needs of her family.

Having very limited financial means, she often has stock shortages which sometimes cause her to lose customers. To imrpove this situation, she is asking for a loan of $400 which she will manage with her abilities. The realization of this project will help her ensure the blossoming of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 55 ans Madame L. Akossiwa est une femme très pauvre qui vit dans un milieu très misérable avec cinq (05) enfants à charge. Leur localité très reculée de la ville est sans eau potable, sans électricité, sans latrine et même pas de terrain cultivable pour au moins faire des cultures. Mais consciente de sa situation, cette dame fait son petit commerce de vente de divers produits (Tomate, piments, poisson frit etc.) pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

Ayant une capacité financière très limitée, elle a souvent des ruptures de stock qui la fait parfois perdre de clientèle. Pour améliorer cette situation, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qu’elle saura gérer par sa capacité de gestion. La réalisation de ce projet l’aidera à assurer l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell various products

loans.name: Remigio

texts.es:
