Remigio sells milk from his cows to a commercial dairy called Pil Andina. He also works as a chauffeur to supplement his income and support his family. He lives in Achacachi -Tipampa, about two hours from La Paz. He would use his loan to buy another dairy cow to increase his yield of cow's milk. This is his first loan from IMPRO, which rates him as a very good loan risk.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Remigio es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que Remigio comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); el también trabaja como chofer y asi completa los ingreso con los que mantiene a su familia. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos hora de la ciudad de La Paz). El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor produces cow's milk, the same kind that is processed at the Pil Andina in La Paz (the industrial milk plant). He also works as a tractor driver, readying the soil to plant onions and potatoes. This work is his principal source of income, and with his earnings he supports his three children and wife.

Victor lives Achacachi, a small community 2 hours outside of the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to purchase a cow of medium breed to increase his milk production. It is the first loan that Victor has applied for from IMPRO, and the evaluacion done by his loan officers has qualified him to enter IMPRO's program.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer

Víctor es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); el también trabaja como tractorista (prepara la tierra para sembrar cebolla y papa) y es su principal fuente de ingreso para la manutención de sus tres hijos y esposa que dependen de él.

Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos hora de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa weaves alpaca wool into sweaters and gloves, which she sells in market fairs in El Alto. Her husband is a salaried chauffeur. Their two children attend the state university. She lives in the Los Andes section of El Alto. She would use the loan to buy raw materials (alpaca wool). This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her repayment history is good: She paid off her installments on the dates specified in her contract, and she is a good candidate for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa es tejedora en lana Alpaca y fabrica chompas y guantes de lana que comercializa en ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo es chofer asalariado, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando en la universidad estatal. Vive en la zona los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (lana de alpaca). Es el segundo crédito con Impro. El primer credito ha sido pagado en las fechas acordadas en el contrato y este buen antecedente le faculta acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: To buy wool

payments.comment: Rosa wants to pay off the loan today. She will apply for a new loan very soon.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa is a weaver of llama and alpaca wool, she works with her daughter and her mother. They make gloves for wholesale and sell them at popular fairs in the city of El Alto. Her husband works in the province as public security (police) and they have three children that are dependent on them. She lives in the zone Progreso in the city of El Alto. The credit would go towards buying raw materials (llama and alpaca wool). This is the third loan that Felipa has had with Impro. Her two past loans were both paid in full on time and her good record shows her capacity to take on another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Felipa es tejedora en lana de llama y alpaca; ella trabaja con su hija y su madre. Fabrica guantes al por mayor y los comercializa en ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Su esposo trabaja en las provincias como seguridad publica (policía) y tienen tres hijos que dependen de ellos. Vive en la zona Progreso de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (lana de llama y alpaca). Es el tercer crédito con Impro. Los dos anteriores creditos fueron pagados puntualmente y este buen antecedente le faculta acceder a otro préstamo.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Born in 1955 in Lomé, Mrs. Dopé L. is married and has six children. She runs a business selling brooms and baskets. Despite her illiteracy, she has a keen sense of management and has mastered perfectly the nuts-and-bolts of her business. Due to the production of condiments on marshy land, the demand for baskets has increased, as well as the demand for brooms. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy brooms and baskets in the villages in order to re-sell them at the market. Using the income generated by this business, Mrs. Dopé L. will be able to meet her household expenses and thus imrpove her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1955 à Lomé, Madame L. Dopé est mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle exerce comme activité le commerce de balais et de paniers. Malgré son état d’analphabète, elle a un sens élevé de gestion et maîtrise parfaitement tous les rouages de son activité. Face à la production des condiments sur les espaces maraîchers, la demande en paniers s’est accrue, de même que celle de balais. Elle sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $600 pour acheter dans les villages des balais et paniers afin de les revendre sur les marchés en besoins. Des revenus de cette activité, Mme L. Dopé pourra supporter convenablement les charges de son ménage et améliorer ainsi les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell brooms and baskets

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh Y. is a widow, age 35, with three children to care for. Alone in dealing with household expenses, she is confronted with serious problems because of the limited income from her modest business involving gari (granulated cassava root) and beignets (a kind of doughnut). The cost of schooling for her children is the main concern that she has not managed to cover.

To conquer this situation and to see her children succeed one day, she is requesting a loan of $500 in order to strengthen and diversify her business. The profit gained will then help ensure that her family reaches its full potential. So let's help her realize her dream.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Y. Edoh est une veuve de 35 ans avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Seule face aux besoins du ménage, elle est confrontée à de sérieux problèmes car le revenu de son petit commerce de gari et de beignet est très limité. La scolarisation des enfants est sa principale préoccupation qu’elle n’arrive pas à assumer.

Pour vaincre cette situation et voir ses enfants réussir un jour, elle sollicite un crédit de $500 afin de renforcer et de diversifier son commerce. Ainsi donc le bénéfice obtenu l’aidera à assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Aidons la donc à réaliser son rêve.

loans.use: Buying flour, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Céléstine K., born in 1974 in Aklakou, is married and the mother of a family with four children. Lack the means, she left school very early on, and she began selling cold water to support herself. With the modest savings from this business, she later invested in the sales of generic medicines. Given her 10 years of experience in this domain, she knows how it all works. Now, challenged by a growth in customer demand and lacking the means to increase her business, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to open a little pharmacy, where she may be able to sell medicines better. The resulting profits will allow her to meet her family's needs with regard to food, clothing, schooling, and leisure. The family can then achieve its full potential. This initiative deserves support and attention.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Aklakou en 1974, Madame est mariée et mère d’une famille de quatre enfants. Elle abandonne les études très tôt faute de moyens et commença à vendre de l’eau fraîche pour se prendre en charge. Elle investit plus tard sa petite économie tirée de ce commerce dans la vente de médicaments génériques. Ayant acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans déjà dans le domaine, Mme K. cerne tous les rouages de cette activité. Aujourd’hui face à la croissance de la demande et n’ayant pas les moyens pour augmenter son commerce, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour ouvrir une petite pharmacie où elle pourra mieux vendre les médicaments. Les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de cette activité lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires, scolaires et ceux de loisirs afin de réussir à épanouir sa famille. Cette initiative mérite d’être soutenue et accompagnée.

loans.use: Opening a litttle pharmacy where she may better sell mediciines.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Abla T., age 45, is a widow who takes care of six children, including two from her daughter, who died from a short illness. Forlorn, she faces poverty alone. Her modest business in palm oil does not manage to meet family needs. To strengthen her business, she had the idea of going to areas where the oil is produced for her supplies. But lacking the means to do so, she is here to request a loan of $600, which will help her to realize her dream. Ms. T. is a very energetic and honest woman who is a good manager. This would be her third loan, each of which she has repaid without any problems.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame T. Abla est une veuve de 54 ans avec six (06) enfants à charge dont deux (02) de sa fille décédée suite à une courte maladie. Très malheureuse, elle est seule face à la misère. Son petit commerce d’huile de palme n’arrive pas à satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Pour renforcer son activité, elle a eu l’idée de d’aller s’approvisionner dans les zones de production. Manquant de moyen, elle vient sollicité un crédit de $600 qui l’aidera à réaliser son rêve. Très dynamique, honnête et avec sa bonne gestion, elle est à son troisième crédit qu’elle a toujours remboursé sans incidence.

loans.use: Buying palm nuts for bolstering her business

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Ms. Akouavi D. is a great merchant in Aklakou. Born in 1957 in Grand Popo (in Bénin), she is married and the mother of six. She possesses over 30 years of experience in the corn trade, a business she learned from her mother. And it is very worthwhile for her, a woman who is well-known in her area. A strict manager, she earns the minimum necessary to provide for her family's needs.

Today, challenged by a growing demand for food, she must furnish more corn to the marketplace. So she is requesting a loan of $1,200 to supply herself with corn from areas where it is grown. The loan will allow her to acquire, transport, process, and stock up on corn to sell it in times of shortage. She can then satisfy her family's needs better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1957 à Grand Popo au Bénin, Madame Akouavi D. est une grande commerçante d’Aklakou. Mariée et mère de six enfants, elle possède une trentaine d’années d’expérience. Héritage de sa mère, le stockage et la vente de maïs est une activité très rentable pour Mme Akouavi, une femme bien connue dans sa localité. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle en tire le minimum nécessaire pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

Aujourd’hui, face à une demande grandissante en besoin alimentaire, Madame Akouavi doit fournir davantage de maïs sur le marché. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $1200 pour aller dans les localités de production de maïs, l’acheter, le transporter, le traiter, le stocker et le revendre en période de soudure. Ainsi, elle pourra mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, transporting, stocking, and selling corn

loans.name: Dalolo

texts.fr:
Dalolo A. was born in 1972 in Aklakou. She is married and the mother of two. A dedicated woman, she early on began cooking and selling cassava beignets (a kind of doughnut made from cassava flour) called "agbeliklanko" using the meager funds that she had. Renown in Aklakou for her energy, and having saved a little money, she switched to other work in 1997 as the year-end holidays approached. Since then, she has been selling basic food items: rice, bread, oil, sugar, milk, candy.... Today, she is requesting a loan of $800 to better secure her business and to fill her display with new items in order to address the ever-growing demand. To finance her plans is to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Aklakou en 1972, Madame A. Dalolo est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Femme dévouée, elle commença très tôt à préparer et à vendre du beignet de manioc appelé « AGBELIKLANKO » avec les maigres moyens qu’elle avait. Reconnue à Aklakou pour son dynamisme, Mme Dalolo ayant économisé un peu d’argent changea son activité à l’approche des fêtes de fin d’année en 1997. Depuis cette année, Mme Dalolo a commencé par vendre les produits alimentaires de première nécessité : du riz, du pain, de l’huile, du sucre, du lait, des bonbons…Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour mieux asseoir son commerce, doter son étalage de nouveaux produits afin de contenir la demande qui ne cesse de grandir. Lui financer ce projet, c’est l’amener à améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: Fill up her display of new basic food items

loans.name: Groupement

texts.fr:
The women in the area of Klévé, in S., are facing serious problems with regard to potable water. Over several seasons, the wells have been drying up. In the rainy season, the water is dirty in the wells that are 50 to 80 meters deep. The infant mortality rate has risen as a result of these conditions.

To put a stop to it, this women's association has decided to construct a major well for the village. Lacking the means, they are requesting a loan of $1,200 to get the construction going. The water, designated to be sold, will allow the women to repay the loan on time. The success of this project will save the life of an entire village and its surrounding area.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Les femmes de la localité de Klévé à S. sont confrontées à de sérieux problèmes d’eau potable. Pendant les saisons sèches les puits se tarissent et en saisons pluvieuses l’eau des puits qui ont profondeur de cinquante à quatre-vingt mètres est sale. Cette situation fait accroître leur taux de mortalité infantile.

Pour mettre fin à cette situation, ce groupement de femmes à décider de construire un forage pour le village. Faute de moyens financiers, elles sollicitent un crédit de $1,200 pour démarrer la construction du dit forage. Cette eau qui sera destiné à la vente permettra aux femmes de rembourser à temps. La réalisation de ce projet, sauvera la vie de toute une localité.

loans.use: Drilling a big well for water

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Mr. Lucio M. lives in his own home in the zone of Pasankeri, Iadera, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Mrs. Paulina Aruquipa and his 9 year-old daughter. Mr. Lucio M. works as a dental technician and works more specifically in prosthetic dental work for several dental centers in La Paz. With his earnings he is able to provide for his family. Now, the house that he owns needs to have a retaining wall built in order to strengthen the land beneath it and to avoid the possibility of its collapse. The requested credit is for the construction of this retaining wall that will be made of reinforced concrete and structural brick. This is the fourth loan that has been awarded to Mr. M. by Impro, and his record proves him to be a good client that is able to access new credit. The preceding loans were all paid back in full.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Lucio M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, la señora Paulina Aruquipa y su hija de 9 años, El señor Lucio M. trabaja como técnico dental independiente realizando trabajos de prótesis dental para distintos consultorios dentales de nuestra ciudad con lo que mantiene a su familia; la vivienda de su propiedad esta siendo construida por etapas pero prioritariamente requiere de un muro de contención con el objetivo de afirmar el terreno y evitar derrumbes. El crédito que solicita es para la construcción de un muro mixto de hormigón armado y ladrillo estructural. Esta es el cuarto crédito otorgado por Impro al señor M. y los antecedente históricos lo califican como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Los prestamos anteriores han sido completamente pagados.

loans.use: housing-build a wall

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi A. was born in 1979 in Anfoin. She is married and the mother of two. She dropped out of primary school and, very early on, began a business selling fruit juice. Having saved a little money, she started an itinerant business selling generic pharmaceuticals in her village. Today, with a dozen years in this domain, she knows all the in's and out's of her work. Her dream now is to get established in one location that bears the name of her business. And then she would supply this mini-pharmacy with all the the basic medicines. This is why she needs a loan of $1,000. The success of her dream will lead to improved living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née à Anfoin en 1979, Madame A. Ablavi est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle arrêta ses études au cours primaire et commença très tôt un commerce de vente de jus de fruits. Ayant fait un peu d’économie, elle se lança dans la vente des produits génériques qu’elle fait promener dans les villages. Aujourd’hui avec une dizaine d’années dans le domaine, elle cerne les rouages de son activité. Son rêve ce jour est de s’installer dans un local qui portera le nom de son activité, ensuite doter sa mini pharmacie de tous les médicaments de première nécessité, d’où le besoin d’un fonds de crédit de $1000. La réalisation de son rêve pourra l’amener à une amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Supply her mini-pharmacy with all the basic medicines

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Mr. Freddy C. lives in his own home in the zone of Pasankeri, Iadera, west of the city of La Paz, with his wife Mrs. Simona Cuppi and their two daughters aged 9 years and 8 months respectively. Freddy works as a driver of public transportation and his wife sews clothing for children that is later sold at sales stands in the informal commercial zone of the city of La Paz. The municipal government of La Paz is now making changes to improve the road on which Mr. C. lives. In order to do so, the said authority is demanding the construction of a structural wall that will bring Mr. C.'s home to the level as the street. The requested credit is for the construction of a structural wall (stone, cement, and reinforced concrete.) This is the sixth loan to be awarded Mr. C. by Impro and his past experiences prove him to be an excellent client and show that he is able to access new credit. The five preceding loans were all paid back in full within the duly established terms.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Freddy C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, la señora Simona Cuppi y sus dos hijas de 9 años y ocho meses respectivamente Freddy trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa realiza costura de ropa para niños que luego vende en los puestos de venta de la zona comercial informal de la ciudad de La Paz. El gobierno municipal de La Paz esta realizando el mejoramiento vial de la calle en donde el señor C. tiene su vivienda, para lo que dicha autoridad le esta exigiendo la construcción de un muro estructural que nivele su propiedad a la calle. El crédito que solicita es para la construcción de un muro de hormigón armado (piedra, cemento y enferradura). Este es el sexto crédito otorgado por Impro al señor C. y los antecedente históricos lo califican como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Los cinco prestamos anteriores fueron pagados cada uno en su totalidad y en los plazos debidamente establecidos.

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a 43-year-old married mother of three. Her husband is an elementary school teacher. Maria works out of her home selling goods to her neighbors. With the loan, she hopes to install a convenience store in her home and purchase products like salt, oil, coffee, sugar, pasta, drinks, tortillas, cookies, candy, etc. to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA ELENA TIENE 43 AÑOS , CASADA , 3 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES MAESTRO EN UNA ESCUELA PRIMARIA ELLA TRABAJA EN SU CASA VENDIENDO ALIMENTOS ENTRE LOS VECINOS DE SU SECTOR . ESPERA CON EL PRESTAMO INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y COMPRAR PRODUCTOS COMO SAL , ACEITE , CAFÉ, AZUCAR, PASTAS, REFRESCOS,TORTILLAS, GALLETAS , DULCES Y DE ESTA FORMA AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS. MARIA ELENA PERTENECE AL GRUPO BUENA VISTA 3 JUNTO CON VIOLETA PATRICIA MORALES REYES QUIEN TAMBIEN DESEA INSTALAR UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA .ES POR ESO QUE CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRARAN MERCADERIAS PARA ABASTECER SUS TIENDAS.

loans.use: Start a convenience store

loans.name: Nudewoso

texts.fr:
Nudewoso G. is a young woman, age 25, who lives in rampant poverty. Trained in the braiding of hair, she struggles a lot but manages ultimately to meet the needs of her family with her meager income. To augment her income, she also sells various items, including fruit. But her very limited financial capacity is the reason for constant inventory shortages. She is requesting a loan of $600 to strengthen her business and to help her family to achieve its potential.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame G. Nudewoso est une jeune femme de 25 ans qui vit dans une misère très galopante. Tresseuse de formation, elle arrive difficilement à satisfaire sa famille avec son maigre revenu. Pour augmenter ses revenus, elle a associé à la tresse la vente de divers dont les fruits. Mais sa capacité financière très limitée cause toujours une rupture de stock. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 qui lui permettra de renforcer ses activités et contribuera à l’épanouissement de la famille.

loans.use: Acquiring fruit to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Mr. Emilio M. owns his own home on the mountain slopes to the west of La Paz. He shares his home with his wife, Julia. Mr. M. is retired from his City Hall job, and the couple lives on his retirement pay.

They bought their home through a private bill of sale. Because the previous owner is dead, he must now pay a substantial tax for the conveyance of the property to clear the house deed. Legal red tape relating to real estate transactions is very common in the communities on the outskirts of La Paz.

He is asking for a loan to meet the various costs of correcting this legal defect in the deed to his home. This is the sixth loan IMPRO has granted to Mr. M.. His payment history and social standing make him a good candidate for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Emilio M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la Ciudad de la Paz con su esposa, la señora Julia M., El señor M. es jubilado de la alcaldía de La Paz, cuenta con ingresos de jubilación con los que los esposos M. se mantienen.

La propiedad de la familia M. fue adquirida mediante una minuta de compra y venta privada y el propietario original de la vivienda falleció por lo que el tramite de regularización en Derechos Reales le esta exigiendo un monto impositivo para la adjudicación y propiedad legal de la vivienda. Este problema de legalización es muy frecuente en las laderas y zonas marginales de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito que solicita es para la refacción y tramite de legalización de la vivienda. Este es el sexto crédito otorgado por Impro al señor M. y los antecedentes históricos así como el estudio socioeconómico lo califican como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Clearing deed to home

loans.name: Sognaméto

texts.fr:
MrsAGBODAN Sognameno was born in 1968 at Aklalou, is married and has five chidren. After primary school, she was trained as a hairdresser and beautician. She opened a beauty salon that she manages strictly and efficiently. A gifted and experienced woman, she provides a quality service to her community and the clients are so pleased with her work that she has been nicknamed "beauty mama". Her husband, a dressmaker, is only able to bring a little help to the household. As she wishes to make her salon more modern and attractive, Mrs AGEBOGAN requests a $1000 loan to buy hair dryers and other tools to improve her customer satisfaction. In this way, she will be able to improve her family's living condition.

Translated fromFrench by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Aklakou en 1968, Madame A. Sognaméto est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Après ses études primaires, elle se lança dans la formation en esthétique et coiffure. Elle ouvre un salon de coiffure qu’elle gère avec rigueur et efficacité. Femme expérimentée et douée, elle offre un service de qualité aux habitants de sa localité et le niveau de satisfaction de sa clientèle lui a valu le surnom de « Maman Beauté ». Son mari couturier de profession contribue très peu aux charges du ménage. Voulant rendre son salon plus moderne et plus attrayant, Madame A. sollicite crédit de $1000 pour s’acheter des séchoirs, et autres matériels de travail afin d’augmenter la satisfaction de sa clientèle. Par là, elle pourra arriver à une amélioration parfaite du niveau de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: Buying hair dyers and other work implements

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 42 years old and has been separated from her husband for three years. Her husband abandoned her and hasn't been heard from since, leaving her to provide for their three children. She sells popular regional dishes (dough filled with beef or chicken) door to door in her neighborhood at night. Dolores is part of a collective with Leonor Gomes, who makes tamales and also sells them door to door. They are requesting the loan together so they can purchase cooking utensils and ingredients that will allow them to make their products in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

DOLORES TIENE 42 AÑOS SEPARADA DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS CUANDO SU MARIDO LA ABANDONO Y NUNCA VOLVIO A SABER DE EL, TIENE 3 HIJOS, ELLA VENDE ANTOJITOS QUE SON PRODUCTOS TIPICOS DE LA ZONA QUE CONSISTEN EN MASAS RELLENAS DE CARNE O POLLO Y TAMBIEN MASAS DORADAS EN ACEITE A LAS QUE SE LES COLOCA ENCIMA FRIJOL EN LAS NOCHES LAS SALE A VENDER PUERTA A PUERTA EN EL SECTORE DONDE ELLA VIVE . PERTENECE AL GRUPO BUENAVISTA 3 , JUNTO CON DOÑA LEONOR G. G. QUIEN HACE TAMALES (HOJAS DE MAIZ RELLENAS CON CARNE , VERDURAS O POLLO ) Y LAS VENDE EN LA SEMANA PUERTA A PUERTA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD. CON EL PRESTAMO QUIEREN AMBAS COMPRAR MAS UTENSILIOS DE COCINA PARA PREPARAR MAS CANTIDAD DE SUS PRODUCTOS Y PODER ADEMAS ABASTECERSE DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA CONFECCION DE LOS ANTOJITOS Y TAMALES

loans.use: Purchase cooking untensils and ingredients

loans.name: Ayité

texts.fr:
Born in 1962, Ayité A. is married and the father of six. He also takes care of five other people. A cassava grater that he bought for himself is the basis for his principle source of income, the preparation of gari (granulated cassava root). The gari trade is the main business of the women in his area. And so he has good demand for his product. But lacking a machine, he can't fill all his orders.

With the ambition to meet the demands of his customers, and to avoid losing them, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to acquire two graters. Realizing his plans will contribute to the development of the business these women have in the village and will also help his family to thrive.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1962, Monsieur A. Ayité marié et père de six (06) enfants et cinq (05) autres personnes à charge. Il s’est acheté une râpeuse de manioc qui est sa principale source de revenu. La préparation de gari qui est la principale activité des femmes de sa localité fait qu’il est sollicité un peut partout par les femmes. Mais par manque de machine, il n’arrive pas à les satisfaire toutes.

Ayant l’ambition de satisfaire sa clientèle et ne pas les perdre, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour s’acheter deux (02) râpeuses. La réalisation de ce projet contribuera au développement des activités des femmes du village et à l’épanouissement de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying two cassava graters

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Widowed for more than four years, Mrs. Afi A. is solely responsible for her six children. Her business is palm oil production, but her earnings scarcely suffice for food and school fees for her children. In attempting to improve her financial situation, Afi has asked for and obtained several small loans to further her business activities. She has had no difficulty in reimbursing these loans.

Afi buys palm nuts and wood for fuel to produce her palm oil. She produces such a good quality of oil that demand for her product is greater than her ability to produce it, given her limited capital. For that reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 900 so that she can satisfy her customers' needs. Her initiative deserves support so that she can improve the living conditions of her family and do well by her children.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Veuve depuis plus de quatre ans déjà, Madame A. Afi assure seule la responsabilité et la charge de ses six enfants. Elle a pour activité la production de l’huile de palme. Son revenu suffit à peine à l’alimentation et à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Pour mieux faire face à cette situation, elle a demandé et obtenu de petits crédits pour promouvoir son activité. Elle n’a eu aucune difficulté à les rembourser.

Elle achète des noix de palme et du bois de chauffe pour la production de l’huile. La qualité de l’huile qu’elle présente sur le marché fait qu’elle a une demande plus forte qu’elle n’arrive pas à satisfaire parce qu’elle ne dispose pas assez de fonds de commerce. Elle sollicite donc un crédit de $900 afin de pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Cette initiative mérite d’être soutenue pour améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille et une prise en charge effective de ses enfants.

loans.use: Buying palm nuts and wood for fuel to produce palm oil

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is 34 years old and has eight children. Her husband is a construction worker. She works making blouses, which she later sells to the women of her neighborhood. Julia is part of a collective consisting of other women in her line of work, and together they will use to loan to purchase fabric, needles, etc. in bulk so they can lower the cost of their supplies and increase their production and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

JULIA TIENE 34 AÑOS Y 8 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL AREA DE LA CONSTRUCCION COMO PEON . JULIA SE DEDICA A LA CONFECCION DE BLUSAS DE MANTA , LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE BORDA Y VENDE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU COMUNIDAD PERTENECE AL GRUPO ARCOS 5 QUE ESTA INTEGRADO ADEMAS POR ADELINA GOMEZ D. (CONFECCION Y BORDADO DE BLUSAS ) MARCELA DE LA CRUZ D. ( CONFECCION Y BORDADO DE BLUSAS ) JUNTAS ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO COMPRAR TELA DE MANTA , HILOS , TODO AL POR MAYOR LO QUE REBAJA EL COSTO DE LA INVERSION Y AUMENTA LA PRODUCCION DE SUS BLUSAS LAS QUE ESPERAN PODER VENDER EN EL MERCADO DE ARTESANIAS DE LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL A LOS TURISTAS Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make blouses

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula is a 52-year-old married mother of six. Her husband makes bricks and sells them to construction companies. Paula runs a small convenience store out of here home, selling items like sugar, rice, coffee and tortillas. She belongs to a collective along with two other women who make and sell specialty foods who are requesting the loan together to purchase supplies. Additionally, Paula wants to enlarge her store and have it serve as her neighborhood's grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

PAULA TIENE 52 AÑOS, CASADA , SEIS HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA HACIENDO LADRILLOS LOS QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE PARA LA CONSTRUCCION. PAULA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA MINI TIENDA DE ABARROTES CON LAS COSAS MAS VENDIBLES DENTRO DE SUS VECINAS TALES COMO AZUCAR , ARROZ , CAFÉ , TORTILLAS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO JUSTO JUEZ 3 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : URSULA CELIA GOMEZ M. ( VENDE EN SU CASA MASAS RELLENAS CON BISTECK, POLLO O PUERCO , LLAMADOS TACOS ) Y MATILDE VERONICA PANIAGUA ROM (HACE PASTELITOS Y LOS SALE A VENDER DE CASA EN CASA ) CON EL PRESTAMO QUIEREN URSULA Y MATILDE COMPRAR MAS MATERIA PRIMA PARA HACER SUS PRODUCTOS Y TAMBIEN UTENSILIOS DE COCINA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y ASI PODER VENDER EN SUS CASA EN PEQUEÑOS NEGOCITOS. PAULA QUIERE AGRANDAR SU MININEGOCIO Y ESTABLECERSE CON UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU COMUNIDAD

loans.use: Purchase supplies and enlarge convenience store

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina is a 42-year-old mother of four. Her husband works in the country harvesting corn. She works out of their home making specialty breads which she later sells to neighbors and door to door throughout her community. Reina is part of a collective along with Irma Gonzalez, who sells shredded chicken in the neighborhood. Together they are requesting the loan. Reina plans to use to it to purchase firewood, flour, sugar, lard and eggs so she increase her daily production of bread. Irma plans to use a portion of the loan to purchase cooking utensils and install a small shop where she can sell her product.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

REINA TIENE 42 AÑOS , CASADA 4 HIJOS, SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ REINA TRABAJA EN SU CASA HACIENDO PAN ARTESANAL QUE POSTERIORMENTE VENDE EN SU CASA ENTRE SUS VECINAS Y TAMBIEN SALE A VENDER CASA A CASA EN LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 4 JUNTO A DOÑA IRMA GOMEZ GONZALEZ QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE POLLO DESTROZADO EN SU CASA ENTRE LAS VECINAS DEL SECTOR. CON EL PRESTAMO REINA ESPERA INVERTIR EN LEÑA, HARINA , AZUCAR, MANTECA DE CERDO Y HUEVOS PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DIARIA DE PAN . EN EL CASO DE DOÑA IRMA ESPERA CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS IMPLEMENTOS DE COCINA Y QUIERE INSTALAR UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDITA EN DONDE VENDERA POLLOS DESTROZADOS Y COCINADOS .

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta is a 34-year-old married mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker. She makes specialty candies and sells them door to door in her neighborhood. Enriqueta is part of a collective along with Brenda G., who breeds pet birds and sells them out of her home. They are requesting the loan together. Enriqueta plans to use it to purchase ingredients and better cooking utensils. Brenda plans to use it to purchase more birds and birdfeed, as well as medicines to keep them healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ENRIQUETA TIENE 34 AÑOS , CASADA 5 HIJOS SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN LA CONSTRUCCION COMO ALBAÑIL Y ELLA HACE DULCES ARTESANALES Y LOS VENDE DE CASA EN CASA ENTRE LAS GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD . PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 4 JUNTO CON DOÑA BRENDA NAVARRO G. QUIEN SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE AVES LOS CUALES DESPUES VENDE EN SU CASA. CON EL PRESTAMO ENRIQUETA QUIERE INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA SUS DULCES Y EN IMPLEMENTAR MEJOR SUS UTENSILIOS DE TRABAJO . BRENDA QUIERE CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO COMPRAR MAS AVES Y ALIMENTOS PARA LOGRAR UNA MEJOR CRIANZA Y ADEMAS MEDICAMENTOS PARA EVITAR PLAGAS ENTRE SUS AVES.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make candy

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayaba Kpromassi was born in Mawussi in 1969. Married and mother of seven children, her principle source of revenue is the production of palm oil. Known by the owners of palm plantations as a good customer, Mrs. K. is the foremost producer of palm oil in Mawussi. This business which she inherited from her mother makes her an important woman. She has been making and selling palm oil for several years, and this experience has made her quite knowledgeable. The quality of her palm oil is much appreciated by her customers and the demand for it is high.

Now Mrs. K. would like to increase her business capital, so she is asking for a loan of US$ 750. That will allow her to buy supplies and produce oil in greater quantities to keep up with demand. She will then be able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Madame Ayaba K. est née à Mawussi en 1969. Aujourd’hui mariée et mère de sept enfants, la production de l’huile de palme est sa principale source de revenu. Connue des propriétaires de palmeraie comme une grande cliente, Madame Ayaba K. est la principale productrice de l’huile de palme à Mawussi. Cette activité qu’elle a hérité de sa mère fait d’elle une grande femme. Il y a plusieurs années que Madame Ayaba prépare et vend de l’huile de palme. Cette expérience lui confère un savoir-faire. La qualité de son huile est bien appréciée par les consommateurs qui expriment toujours la demande.

Aujourd’hui, elle souhaite augmenter son fonds de commerce et c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce crédit de $750 qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en noix de palme afin de produire son huile en grande quantité pour couvrir la demande. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: purchase palm nuts to produce palm oil

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
Marina is a 40-year-old married mother of eight children. Her husband works in the corn fields, while she makes tostadas and sells them in the surrounding area of the local market like a traveling salesman, since she doesn't have an established business. Marina belongs to a collective along with Maria Gonzalez, who also makes and sells tostadas. Together they are requesting the loan to purchase supplies (corn, firewood, etc.) necessary to increase production and profits. They hope to one day be able to have a business at the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARINA TIENE 40 AÑOS , CASADA , OCHO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A TRABAJAR EN EL CAMPO EN LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ. MARINA SE DEDICA A ELABORAR Y VENDER TOSTADAS LAS CUALES VENDE EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO COMO VENDEDOR AMBULANTE YA QUE NO CUENTA CON UN NEGOCIO ESTABLECIDO . PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 9 JUNTO CON MARIA GONZALEZ DIAZ QUE TAMBIEN SE DEDICA ALA ELABORACION DE TOSTADAS . CON EL PRESTAMO INVERTIRAN EN LA MATERIA PRIMA ( MAIZ Y LEÑA ) QUE NECESITAN PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION Y ESPERAN PODER ALGUN DIA INSTALAR UN PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make tostadas

loans.name: Margarita Magdalena

texts.es:
Margarita is a 33-year-old married mother of five children. Her husband is a bricklayer, while she works making tostadas, a popular regional dish. With the loan she plans to purchase corn and firewood to increase production and be able to sell by orders and in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARGARITA TIENE 33 AÑOS, CASADA , 5 HIJOS, SU ESPOSOS TRABAJA COMO AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL Y ELLA SE DEDICA A ELABORAR UN ALIMENTO TIPICO DE SU ZONA LLAMADO “ TOSTADAS “ QUE CONSISTE EN MOLER MAIZ COCIDO Y DARLE FOMA CIRCULAR QUE SE CONSUME ACOMPAÑANDO A LOS ALIMENTOS . PERTTENECE AL GRUPO MARCOS 9 . CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAIZ , LEÑA, PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION DE TOSTADAS Y PODER VENDER POR PEDIDOS Y EN LA CIUDAD MAS CERCANA.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to make tostadas

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertine is 76 years old. She has four children, all of whom are married. Albertine, along with her husband, work in the fields producing corn, beans, pumpkins and other vegetables, and later sells them at a market in the city or to neighbors. With the loan, they hope to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase their production and profits and have a better quality of life in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

ALBERTINA TIENE 76 AÑOS , TIENE CUATRO HIJOS LOS CUALES YA ESTAN CASADOS Y ELLA JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO TRABAJAN EL CAMPO EN LA PRODUCCION DE MAIZ , FRIJOL , CALABAZAS Y VERDURAS EN GENERAL, LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE VENDEN EN EL MERCADO DE LA CIUDAD O A LAS PERSONAS QUE HABITAN EN COMUNIDADES CERCANAS .. FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO ENRIQUE MOLINA 2 CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN COMPRAR FERTILIZANTES Y LIQUIDOS QUE EVITAN EL CRECIMIENTOS DE MALAS HIERBAS QUE PERJUDICAN A LAS COSECHAS DE VERDURAS . PARA AUMENTAR SU PRODUCCION Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS Y LOGRAR TENER UNA MEJOR VIDA EN LOS AÑOS QUE LES QUEDAN.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Yaténé

texts.fr:
Born in Mawussi in 1965, Yatene A. is married and father of seven children. His business is producing vegetables. At the beginning of each season, he plants seeds and hopes for rain so that he can transplant his little plants. All the work is done by hand.

Renowned for his hard work, Yatene is known to all as a good market gardener. His many years at this business have given him lots of experience. He is now asking for a loan of US$ 950 to buy watering cans, insecticides, and other necessities for healthy plants so that he can enlarge his market garden. That will allow him to supply the ever-increasing demand for his vegetables. Achieving this goal will help Yatene to satisfy all the needs of his children, especially concerning health expenses and school fees.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Né à Mawussi en 1965, Monsieur Yaténé A. est un homme marié et père de sept enfants. La production des légumes est son activité. En début de chaque saison, il fait d’abord la pépinière et espère la pluie pour le repiquage. Tout ceci est fait à la main.

Réputé pour ce travail, Monsieur Yatêné A. est connu de tout le monde comme le grand producteur maraîcher. L’ancienneté dans son travail lui confère une grande expérience. Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour s’acheter des arrosoirs, des insecticides et d’autres produits phytosanitaires afin d’élargir son espace maraîcher. Cela lui permettra d’être en mesure de satisfaire une demande sans cesse croissante aujourd’hui. La réalisation de ce projet aidera Monsieur A. Yatêné à satisfaire tous les besoins de sa famille surtout en matière de santé et scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: Buying watering cans, insecticide, and other necessities for healthy plants

loans.name: Gabina Rafaela

texts.es:
Gabina is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. Her husband works in public transportation, while she buys clothes (for men, women and children) in the city of San Cristobal and later sells them to people in her community. Gabina works with Amparo Ortega, a general dressmaker who works off of order from the neighborhood. Together they are requesting the loan. Gabina plans to use it to purchase more clothes at a lower price, and thus make more profits. Amparo plans to use it to purchase sowing supplies so she can sell more clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

GABINA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA TRES HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES CHOFER DE LA LOCOMOCION COLECTIVA. ELLA COMPRA EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL , ROPA DE HOMBRES MUJERES Y NIÑOS LAS CUALES DESPUES VENDE ENTRE LAS PERSONAS QUE INTEGRAN SU COMUNIDAD.ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO ENRIQUE MOLINA 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA AMPARO DIAZ ORTEGAQUIEN SE DEDICA A REALIZAR COSTURAS EN GENERAL SEGÚN LOS PEDIDOS QUE RECIBE ENTRE LAS MUJERES DE SU VECINDAD. GABINA ESPERA INVERTIR SU PRESTAMO COMPRANDO MAS CANTIDAD DE ROPA AL POR MAYOR PARA REBAJAR LOS COSTOS Y ASI OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS .EN EL CASO DE AMPARO ELLA QUIERE INVERTIR EN HILOS , GENEROS Y ASI PODER CONFECCIONAR ROPA PARA VENDER .

loans.use: Purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Kankoé

texts.fr:
Kankoe A., age 27, is a young kerosene merchant in the village of Aklakou, where he lives with his family of five people. The place where he sells kerosene for lamps is out in the open, under the hot sun. He is often obliged to buy on credit and repay after he sells the kerosene. That system does not permit him to make enough profit to support his family and improve his business premises. The need to build a shed to sell out of and to pay upfront for the kerosene leads him to ask for a loan of US$ 1200. Finding financing for these improvements in his business will allow him to flourish and to better provide for his family.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Age de 27 ans, M. A. Kankoé est un jeune commerçant de pétrole lampant dans le village d’Aklakou ou il vit avec toute sa famille de cinq personnes. Son point de vente de pétrole est à l’air libre sous le chaud soleil et lui-même s’approvisionne souvent à crédit et rembourse après la vente. Ce système ne lui permet pas de dégager un bénéfice significatif pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille et réaliser ses projets. La nécessité de construire un hangar et de s’approvisionner au comptant en pétrole l’amène à demander un crédit de $1200. Le financement de ce projet lui permettra de s’épanouir et de mieux supporter les lourdes charges de son ménage.

loans.use: Buying and selling kerosene for lamps

loans.name: Ametoegnizi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ametoegnizi A. is 65 years old and lives with her family in the village of Aklakou. Widowed for about six years, she is now head of the family and supports four people from her fish-selling business. Very hard-working in spite of her advaced age, she runs her business with exceptional enthusiasm. She would now like to be able to enlarge her business so as to make more profit from it but she does not have the necessary capital. Ametoegnizi is requesting a loan of $ 900 to use to buy baskets of fish that she will then resell. The increased profit will enable her to better care for her family's needs.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Mme A. Ametoegnizi est une dame âgée de 65 ans et vit dans le village d’Aklakou avec sa famille. Veuve depuis près de 6 ans, elle est devenue chef de ménage et prend en charge quatre personnes à l’aide de son activité de vente de poissons. Très dévouée malgré son âge avancé, elle gère son activité avec une rigueur exceptionnelle. Elle souhaite aujourd’hui agrandir son commerce afin de pouvoir en tirer plus de bénéfice mais ne dispose pas de moyens nécessaires à cet effet. Elle sollicite pour ce faire une somme de $900 pour acheter des paniers de poisons qu’elle va revendre. Le gain tiré lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Wholesale purchasing and resale of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing merchandise

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr:
Mama A. is in a polygamous marriage. She has three children and four other people for whom she is responsible. The whole responsibility for the family, especially the schooling of the children, rests on her. Very courageous, she scarcely rests during the day. Early each morning, she sells balls of cooked cereal, then later works in the fields, her secondary business activity.

Wishing to increase her sales of cooked food, she is requesting a loan of $500 to buy corn, fish, oil and condiments so as to be able to make more profit. That will allow her to improve her agricultural pursuits and do well by her children.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Madame A. Maman est une femme d’un mari polygame. Elle à trois (3) enfants et quatre autres personnes à charge. Toute la charge de la famille voire la scolarisation des enfants n’engage qu’elle seule. Très courageuse, elle ne se repose pratiquement pas dans la journée. Très tôt le matin, elle vend des boules de pâtes comme première activité et l’agriculture comme activité secondaire.

Voulant mieux développer le commerce de boule de pâte, elle sollicite $500 pour s’acheter du maïs, du poisson, de l’huile et des condiments en stock afin de réaliser un bénéfice un peu plus signifiant. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de renforcer d’une part son agriculture et d’autre part à assurer sa responsabilité de mère de famille.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, fish, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Dékalémé

texts.fr:
Born in Afangnan in 1961, Dekaleme B. is a dynamic man, married and father of four children. After secondary school, he became a driver. He has a driver's licence and was able to buy a van for public transport which he has used for almost 12 years. This vehicle, now quite worn out, no longer lives up to his expectations, so he is often out of work. Having no other source of income, he is asking for a loan of $1200 that he will use to buy a better motor and other spare parts for his vehicle. Achieving this goal will allow him to have a more consistent source of income and supply the needs of his family who live in extreme poverty.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Né à Afangnan en 1961, Monsieur Dékalémé B. est un homme dynamique, marié et père de quatre enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il s’est lancé dans la conduite auto. Aujourd’hui, titulaire d’un permis de conduire, il a acheté un premier véhicule de transport qu’il a utilisé près de douze ans. Cet engin, devenu totalement usé, n’arrive plus à combler l’attente de son propriétaire. Dès lors, Monsieur B. Dékalémé est désoeuvré. N’ayant plus de source de revenu, il veut aujourd'hui saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter un crédit de $1200 afin d’acheter un moteur plus sophistiqué et d’autres pièces pour réparer son véhicule. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir un revenu plus consistant et de subvenir au besoin de sa famille qui vit dans une pauvreté extrême.

loans.use: repairing a public transport vehicle

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Yao T., a young barber aged 23, is unmarried and has no children. He does, however, have two younger brothers to care for. Having recently opened his barbershop, he is not able to outfit it at this point. His parents, who are farmers and live in the country, are not able to help him.

Yao is asking for a loan of $300 so that he can outfit his barbershop and attract more customers. Achieving this goal will allow him to take better care of his younger brothers.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Jeune coiffeur de 23 ans, Monsieur T. Yao est un célibataire sans enfants. Mais il a deux petits frères à sa charge. Ayant nouvellement ouvert son atelier, il n’a pas assez de moyens pour l’équiper. Par manque de support car ses parents sont cultivateurs dans leur village.

Il vient solliciter un apport financier de $300 afin de mieux équiper son atelier et attirer la clientèle. La réalisation de ce projet serait pour lui un atout qui l’aidera à assurer ses responsabilités de grand frère vis-à-vis de ses petits frères.

loans.use: Outfitting his barbershop and buying clippers

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr:
Born in 1960 in Aveve in the prefecture of the lakes, Felicia A. lives with her family in Aklakou. Married and mother of five children, she bakes and sells cakes as a business. This is her only source of income and she is responsible for a good part of the necessities of her family. She would now like to have fixed place where she could sell her cakes. She is asking for a loan of $950 to be able to achieve this goal. The loan would allow her to stock wheat flour and oil so as to be able to increase her turnover and thus improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Née en 1960 à Avévé dans la préfecture des lacs, Mme A. Félicia réside à Aklakou avec sa famille. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, elle exerce une activité de fabrication de gâteaux qu’elle commercialise. Cette activité est sa seule source de revenu qui lui permet de prendre en charge une grande partie des besoins de son foyer. Aujourd’hui, elle veut créer un point de vente fixe où elle restera pour livrer ses produits. De ce fait, elle sollicite une somme de $950 pour pouvoir y arriver. Le crédit lui permettra de faire un stock de farine de blé et d’acheter de l’huile afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires successible d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase wheat flour and oil for making cakes

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Born in 1961 in Agou Koumawou in the Prefecture of Kluto (Togo), Mrs. Akou A. is married and mother to two children. She is also responsible for raising a cousin. Since her husband's income is not sufficient to cover the basic needs of the family, Akou is obliged to contribute by running a little grocery store.

In order to better serve her customers, whose needs are always growing, Akou is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 so that she can improve her turnover. Once she has achieved that, she firmly believes that she will be able to better her family's living conditions.

Translated from the French by Teresa Kramer, KIVA volunteer

Née en 1961 à Agou Koumawou dans la préfecture du Kloto, Madame A. Akou est mariée et est mère de deux (02) enfants et une cousine à charge. Gérante d’alimentation générale, elle est obligée de subvenir au besoin de la famille car le revenu de son mari ne lui permet pas de satisfaire pleinement la famille.

Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle devenue de plus en plus exigeante, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour renforcer son chiffre d’affaires. Une fois cet objectif atteint, elle améliorera les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: Stocking her grocery store

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Born in 1969 in Aklakou, Mrs. Kokoè A. lives with her family in the same village where she has her revenue-generating business selling rice. Married and the mother of two children, she supports three people in addition to her children and plays a big role in the management of her household. In her open-air business, she gets along selling prepared rice that she calls ELEADE, which means that the dish is sweet. Since the open-air setting only allows her to do business during half the day because of the hot sun, she has decided to construct a shelter for her small restaurant in order to attract more clientele. The rest of the money requested will allow her to stock up on rice and other ingredients. For this purpose, she is asking for $900 to fit out her workplace and to improve the quality of life in her home.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1969 à Aklakou, Mme A. Kokoè réside avec sa famille dans le même village où elle exerce son activité génératrice de revenu qui est la vente de riz. Mariée et mère de deux enfants, elle a en charge trois personnes en plus de ses enfants et joue un grand rôle dans la gestion de son ménage. A ciel ouvert, elle se débrouille avec la vente du riz préparé qu’il a nommé ELEADE qui signifie que le met est doux. La vente à ciel ouvert ne lui permettant pas de faire son activité sur au moins une demie journée à cause du chaud soleil, elle a décidé de construire un hangar qui lui permettra d’abriter son mini restaurant afin d’attirer également la clientèle. Le reste de l’argent sollicité lui permettra de s’approvisionner en riz et autres ingrédients. Elle sollicite, pour ce faire un montant de $900 afin d’aménager son cadre de travail et améliorer les conditions de vie dans son foyer.

loans.use: To build a shelter for her restaurant

loans.name: Alodémé

texts.fr:
Born in Vogan in 1963, Mrs. Alodémé A. is married and the mother of four (04) children and supports two other people. A general food merchant, she alone works to meet her family’s needs because her husband is a mason and rarely finds work.

To strengthen her business in order to better meet her family’s needs, she is asking for a loan of $1200. The income gained will help her encourage her children in their studies since presently they study in deplorable conditions. Let us help her reach her goal because a better future for her children is her primary concern.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Vogan en 1963, Madame A. Alodémé est mariée et est mère de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) autres personnes à charge. Commerçante d’alimentation générale, elle fait seule face au besoin de la famille car son mari est un maçon qui trouve rarement à faire.

Pour renforcer son activité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200. Le bénéfice réalisé l’aidera à encourager ses enfants dans leurs études car ils étudient présentement dans une condition déplorable. Aidons la à atteindre cet objectif car le meilleur devenir de ses enfants est sa principale préoccupation.

loans.use: To stock merchandise

loans.name: Koyomé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Koyomé T. was born in Afangnan in 1970. When she became a mother, she restarted her business selling fish, a business that she practiced with her mother. Today, she provides for a total of six people. Her husband, a scriptwriter, does not earn enough to sufficiently nourish the family. It is for this reason that Mrs. Koyomé T. is not standing with her arms crossed. A very dynamic woman, her business makes her a well-known woman in her neighborhood. Because of her work smoking fish, she has been given the name “Mama AZIZO.” Today, she is asking for a loan of $750 to stock her fridge with fish in order to meet the demands of her clientele. If granted this loan, she will be able to improve the quality of life of her entire family.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame T. Koyomé est née à Afangnan en1970. Devenue mère, elle a alors renoué avec la vente de poissons, activité qu’elle faisait avec sa mère. Aujourd’hui, elle compte à sa charge un total de six personnes. Son mari, scripteur ne possède pas un grand revenu pour bien nourrir la famille. C’est pour cette raison que madame T. Koyomé ne reste pas les bras croisés. Très dynamique, ses mouvements font d’elle une femme bien connue dans son quartier. Son travail de fumage de poissons lui a fait porter le surnom de « Maman AZIZO ».Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en poisons au frigot afin d’être à la hauteur de la demande de sa clientèle. L’octroi de ce crédit lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase, sell and smoke fish

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Trained as a seamstress, Mrs. Ablavi T. was born on August 9, 1966 in Lomé. Married and supporting two (02) children, she would like to begin selling dry goods in addition to her work as a seamstress, which is not promising enough for her. A very intelligent woman who is gifted in management, she has also proved herself to be faithful in repaying her loans within the established time period.

Thus, to fulfill her dreams, she is asking for a loan of $1000 which will serve as business funds in order to stock up on dry goods. Let us help her reach her goal because this woman is full of ambition.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Couturière de formation, Madame T. Ablavi est née le 09 août 1966 à Lomé. Mariée, avec deux (02) enfants à charge, elle voudrait associer la mercerie à la couture qui n’est pas assez promettant pour elle. Très intelligente et très douée en matière de gestion, elle a toujours fait preuve de bonne fidélité en remboursant ses crédits à l’échéance convenue.

Pour ainsi réaliser son rêve, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce afin de s’approvisionner en article de mercerie. Aidons la à atteindre son objectif car cette femme est pleine d’ambition.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of dry goods

loans.name: Malomon

texts.fr:
Born in 1953 in Aklakou, Malomon F. still lives in the same village with her family. With four children, she became a widow ten years ago. Since then, she has applied herself to weaving mats, using traditional methods, making on average two to three mats per week. Her very popular mats are sold, after being woven, to customers from the city. In order to increase her mat production, she wants to stock up on more adapted materials. For this reason she asks for a loan of $900. The realization of this project will allow her to have a consistent and permanent income to meet her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1953 à Aklakou, Mme F. Malomon réside aujourd’hui dans le même village avec sa famille. Avec quatre enfants, elle est devenue veuve il y a 10 ans. Depuis lors, elle s’est donnée au tressage de nattes qu’elle fait de façon traditionnelle avec en moyenne deux à trois nattes par semaine. Les nattes très appréciées sont commercialisées après tressage aux clients venus de la ville. Pour accroître sa production de natte, elle a voulu s’équiper en matériels plus adaptés. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit de $900. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir un revenu consistant et permanent pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To stock up on materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Born in Fiata, Ayélé K. is 52 and the mother of five children. Dynamic and skilled, she often spends time working at the oven or at the grinder in order to fill the empty space left by her husband since their divorce five years ago. Also, she supports the children and is able to meet their needs thanks to her business making gari, in which she succeeds very well using the small loans for which she is a regular borrower. Today, she needs a much bigger amount, $650, in order to renew her work materials and to buy cassava and a rickshaw to facilitate the transportation of the cassava. This would lighten her burden, reduce the time needed to complete her work and increase her production for her family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer

Née à Fiata, Mme K. Ayélé est âgée de 52 ans et mère de cinq enfants. Dynamique et très habile, elle est souvent au four et au moulin pour combler le vide qu’a laissé son mari depuis leur divorce il y a cinq ans. Aussi, les enfants sont-ils à sa charge et elle parvient à subvenir à leur besoins grâce à son activité de fabrication de gari qu’elle réussi très bien à partir de petits crédits auxquels elle est habituée. Aujourd’hui, elle a besoin d’un montant beaucoup plus important soit $650 pour renouveler ses matériels de travail, acheter du manioc et une pousse pousse pour faciliter le transport du manioc. Cela allègera ses peines, réduirait le temps d’exécution des tâches et augmenter sa production pour le bien-être de la famille.

loans.use: To buy cassava and a rickshaw to facilitate the transportation of the cassava

loans.name: Efoévi Bernard

texts.fr:
Mr. Efoevi Bernard D. was born in Gleï in 1957. He is the son of a close-knit family. Lacking the means to pursue his studies, he had to stop them in order to pursue hotel training. He gained experience in two (02) hotels in the area. Married and the father of four (04) children, he wanted to put his training into practice. He thus opened a small restaurant which he manages rigorously. An experienced man, his skills and knowledge are a benefit to his clientele. This restaurant is his only source of income.

Efoevi D. needs the means to buy a stove, to buy the ingredients that he needs and to enlarge his restaurant. For this purpose he is asking for a loan of $700. It would be his first loan to strengthen his business and increase his profits in order to better meet his family’s needs. This project should be supported because it is a profitable one.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur D. Efoevi Bernard est né à Gleï en 1957. Fils d’une famille unie. Faute de moyen pour poursuivre ses études, il a dû les abandonner pour suivre une formation hôtelière. Il a fait ses expériences dans deux (02) hôtels de la place. Marié et père de quatre (04) enfants, il a voulu mettre sa formation en pratique. De ce fait, il a ouvert un petit restaurant qu’il gère avec rigueur. Expérimenté, il met ses compétences et son savoir faire au profit de sa clientèle. Ce restaurant est sa seule source de revenu.

Monsieur D. Efoevi a besoin de moyens pour acheter une cuisinière et mettre à la disposition des mets dont ils ont besoin et agrandir son restaurant. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un crédit de $700. C’est son premier crédit pour renforcer ses activités, augmenter ses profits afin de mieux gérer les besoins de la famille. Ce projet doit être soutenu car il est rentable.

loans.use: To refit his restaurant

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in Kpéléhémé in 1971, Akossiwa A. now lives in Mawussi with her husband and her five (05) children. Farming remains her profession. Every season, Mrs. A. grows large fields of corn and cassava. Nicknamed “the iron women,” she manages to produce larger harvests than even some men. Today, her land is less fertile and will cause a drop from her usual harvest amount; she is thus forced to go in search of fertilizer. For this purpose, Mrs. Akossiwa A. is asking for a loan of $650 to buy fertilizer to enrich her land and thus increase production. As a result, the receipt of this loan will help Akossiwa and her family to flourish.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née à Kpéléhémé en 1971, Mme A. Akossiwa vit actuellement à Mawussi avec son mari et ses cinq (05) enfants. Le travail de la terre reste sa profession. Chaque saison, Mme A. cultive de vastes champs de maïs et de manioc. Surnommée « dame de fer », elle réussit à dominer même certains hommes en matière de production des récoltes. Aujourd’hui, les terres agricoles devenues pauvres font chuter son niveau habituel de récolte ; ce qui l’oblige à se tourner vers la recherche de l’engrais. Pour cela, Mme A. Akossiwa sollicite un crédit de $650 pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichir ses terres culturales et augmenter par conséquent sa production. Comme impact, l’octroi de ce crédit permettra à Akossiwa d’arriver à épanouir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to enrich her land

loans.name: Koudjo

texts.fr:
Mr. Koudjo D. was born on January 11, 1974 in Danyi Elavanyo in the Kloto prefecture. He is married and a woodworker living in Lomé in the Golfe prefecture. Being from a poor family, Mr. Koudjo D. has trouble fulfilling his family duties because his income level is very low. Finding himself in this difficult position, he does not have the means to build furniture to attract customers.

He is thus not very well known in his neighborhood for his work. Mr. D. is asking for financing in the amount of $1200 to satisfy his clients and meet his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur D. Koudjo est né le 11 janvier 1974 à Danyi Elavanyo dans la préfecture de Kloto. Il est marié et est menuisier demeurant à Lomé dans préfecture de Golfe. Issue d’une famille très pauvre, Monsieur D. Koudjo n’arrive pas bien à remplir ses devoirs envers sa famille car son niveau de revenu est très faible. Se trouvant dans ce conflit, il n’a pas de moyens pour confectionner des meubles pour attirer les clients.

Ainsi il n’est pas bien connu dans le quartier de part son métier. Monsieur D. demande alors un fonds de financement d’une valeur de $1200 pour bien satisfaire ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of wooden boards

loans.name: Boukari

texts.fr:
Mr. Boukari I. is a young man of 28 years, single and supports his parents. He is very dynamic and full of ambition; his main business is the sale of general food goods. In order to expand his business, he is asking for $1000 in financing.

He is very skilled in his business and manages it perfectly. Financing this project will really help him and guarantee him a steady future.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur I. Boukari est un jeune de 28 ans, célibataire et ayant ses parents à charge. Il est très dynamique et plein d’ambition ; son activité principale est le commerce d’alimentation générale. Pour lui permettre de mieux étendre ses activités, il sollicite un apport financier de $1000.

Il maîtrise bien son activité et en fait une parfaite gestion. Le financement de ce projet sera vraiment un plus pour lui assurer un avenir serein.

loans.use: To stock up on general food goods

loans.name: Aduvi

texts.fr:
50 years old, Mrs A. Aduvi is married to a polygamous husband, has five children and takes care of three others. Her business is to sell beans in schools. It's a profitable business if you can buy beans and oil wholesale, but she has not enough money to do it. She asks for a $400 funding, to be able to stock in and get a bigger benefi that woul help improve her family'sconditiont

Translated fromFrenc by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 50 ans, Madame A. Aduvi est mariée à un polygame et mère de cinq (05) enfants et à sa charge trois (03) autres. Son activité est la vente de haricot dans les établissements scolaires. C’est un commerce très rentable quand le haricot et l’huile sont achetés en gros alors que les moyens de Madame A. Aduvi ne le lui permettent pas. Elle demande un financement de $400 pour s’approvisionner afin de dégager un revenu consistant pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
To supply with beans and oil
S'approvisionner en haricot et d'huile

loans.name: Sognameto

texts.fr:
A mother of five, Mrs AGBODAN Sognameto lives in the village of Aklalou in the Lakes district. Fifty years old, she has been selling packaged corn pasta usually called "Kom" for 15 years. It's her only income and it enables her to be a partner in her home management. She uses her profits for the home's everyday expenses. To be able to do so, she has been expanding her activities by establishing a fixed location, where her customers could come. This would improve her business turnover. This is why she requests a $850 loan to be able to carry out her project.

Translated from French by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Mère de cinq enfants, Mme A. Sognameto réside dans le village d’Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. A 50 ans d’âge, elle vend des pâtes de maïs emballées communément appelées « Kom », ceci depuis maintenant 15 ans. C’est sa seule source de revenu qui lui permet de participer à la gestion de son foyer. Le revenu tiré de cette activité est directement utilisé dans la gestion quotidienne du ménage. Pour ce faire, elle a voulu agrandir cette activité en aménageant un lieu fixe où sa clientèle viendra se satisfaire. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire. Ainsi, elle sollicite un prêt de $850 pour réaliser son projet.

loans.use: Preparing and selling corn pasta (kom)

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Married and a mother of five, Mrs A. Dopé was born in 1969 in Sakpove and lives presently in the village of Aklalou in the Lakes district. Since her husband is jobless, she is the only provider in the household with her small grocery business named DESIADE. The business profits are completely used up by the family's daily expenses and she cannot expand her offerings. To address increasing demand, she wants to buy various goods and items to satisfy her client's demands. She is requesting a $1000 loan to buy rice sacks, oil drums and cans wholesale, to resell them and meet her family's needs efficiently.

Translated fromFrench by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Mme A. Dopé est née en 1959 à Sakpové et vit actuellement dans le village d’Aklakou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Le mari étant désoeuvré, elle est la seule à supporter les charges de son ménage à travers son petit commerce d’alimentation générale nommée DESIADE. Le revenu tiré de ce commerce est absorbé par la consommation quotidienne du ménage, empêchant la croissance de l’étalage. Face à une demande de plus en plus forte, elle sent la nécessité de s’approvisionner en marchandises et divers afin de répondre à aux exigences de la clientèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 pour acheter des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile et des boites de conserve en gros et de les revendre en détail afin de dégager plus de bénéfices et de pouvoir faire face efficacement aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying rice sacks, oil drums and cans wholesale and reselling them

loans.name: Komedan

texts.fr:
MrA. Komedan, a father of five, was born in 1971 at Mawussi in the Afagnan county. He became a carpenter after high school and has opened a business in the main borough of his village. His work's quality, and the creativity of his furniture models of always testify to his know-how. Therefore, he takes care of his family through the earnings of his craft. On top of his carpentrywork, he would like to open a wood-selling outlet to increase his benefit. This is why he asks for a $1200 loan to buy wood in production areas and resell it to other carpenters in adjoining villages. With this business he would be able to improve his family's living conditions especially for his children's health and schooling

Translated from French by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer

Né à Mawussi dans la sous préfecture d’Afagnan en 1971, Monsieur A. Komedan est père d’une famille de cinq enfants. Devenu menuisier après ses études secondaires, il a ouvert son atelier au quartier principal de son village. La finesse de son travail, l’esprit de créativité des modèles de ses meubles portent toujours les marques de son savoir. C’est d’ailleurs du revenu de son métier qu’il arrive à prendre en charge sa famille. En plus de ses travaux de menuiserie, Mr A. voudrait ouvrir un dépôt de vente de bois pour augmenter son revenu. A cet effet, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour s’approvisionner en bois dans les zones de production et le revendre aux autres menuisiers des localités environnantes. A partir de ce commerce, il pourra réussir à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille surtout de ses enfants en matière de santé et de scolarité.

loans.use:
Buying wood in production zones ans reselling it

S'approvisionner en bois dans les zones de production et le revendre

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Born in 1965 at Mawussi, Mrs Abiba N. is a great pagne trader. Maried, mother of six, this business is her main activity. Having become a dame of great experience in this field , Mrs Abiba N. masters all it's aspects. She buys the pagnes in the capital city's big shops and resells them all around Mawussi. Well known for being open and wecoming MrsAbiba N. allways does her best to give satisfaction to her clients, especially concerning types and models of pagnes. Today, having to face an increasing demand, she requests a loan of $800 to stock in pagnes and stay in tune with the market. By so doing, she will be ableto improve the living conditions of all her family

Translated from French by Monique Guichard, Kiva volunteer

Née à Mawussi en 1965, Madame Abiba N. est une grande commerçante de pagnes. Mariée et mère de six enfants, ce commerce est sa principale activité. Devenue une dame de grande expérience dans son activité, Madame Abiba N. cerne tous les contours de la chose. Elle achète les pagnes dans les grandes boutiques de la capitale et les revend dans les localités environnantes de Mawussi. Réputée pour son ouverture et son accueil, Madame Abiba N. fait toujours un effort pour satisfaire sa clientèle surtout en matière de modèle et types de pagnes. Aujourd’hui face à une demande toujours croissante, elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour s’approvisionner en pagnes afin d’être à la hauteur du marché. Par cette activité, elle arrivera à améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille.

loans.use:
Bying and selling pagne material
Achat et vente de tissu pagne

loans.name: Fiodémégbé

texts.fr:
Mrs Agniglio Fiodemege, mother of four,was born in 1962 at Mawussigan. She earns a living by making and selling strings. Her husband, a cultivator, helps balance the budget but Mrs ANIGLIO is the main provider for the children’s expenses.

She goes into the bush everyday to collect the leaves needed for making strings. At night she weaves the strings she will sell in a local market, to the rhythm of songs. She asks for a $750 loan, to buy the leaves and product a bigger quantity of strings to sell in the markets. Thus, she can earn more and improve her miserable living condition

translated from French by Monique Guchard, Kiva volunteer

Née à Mawussigan en 1962, Madame A. Fiodémégbé est mère de quatre enfants. La fabrication et la vente de cordes est l’activité qui lui procure de revenus. Son époux, cultivateur participe aux dépenses du ménage mais, Madame A. reste le parent le plus proche des enfants en matière de dépenses. Chaque jour, elle va dans la brousse, à la recherche des feuilles qui rentrent dans la production des cordes. Le soir, au rythme des chansons, elle se met à tisser ses cordes qu’elle vend dans les marchés locaux.

Réputée pour la bonne qualité de ses produits, Madame A. Fiodémégbé sollicite ce crédit de $750 pour acheter les feuilles afin d’en produire en grande quantité et de les écouler sur les marchés. Par ce moyen, elle réussira à dégager plus de revenus et changer sa situation de vie miséreuse.

loans.use:
achat du matériel pour la production en  grande quantité  des cordes
Buying material for the big quantity production of strings

loans.name: Fatéssi

texts.fr:
Married, and mother to a large family of eight children, Mrs. Fatéssi K. was born in Afagnan in 1960. She has a business that sells grain storage sacks. It is thanks to the income generated from this business that Mrs. K. is able to feed her children. Her husband, who remains unfit for work due to a car accident, cannot support her with the household expenses. She buys the sacks at Lomé and sells them on to farmers and grain supply merchants. The demand is high, particularly during the harvesting season. Mrs. K. is therefore requesting a $650 loan so that she can stock up on sacks before the big sowing and harvesting season. The granting of this loan will help Mrs. K. to improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’une grande famille de huit enfants, Madame K. Fatéssi est née à Afagnan en 1960. La vente des sacs de stockage de céréales est son commerce. C’est d’ailleurs grâce au revenu tiré de cette activité qu’elle arrive à nourrir les enfants à sa charge. Son mari ayant perdu sa force de travail après un accident de circulation ne l’accompagne pas dans les charges du ménage. Madame K.
