Fatéssi achète les sacs à Lomé et vient les revendre aux paysans et magasiniers de stockage de céréales. Surtout en période de récoltes, la demande devient importante. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 afin de s’approvisionner en sacs avant la grande période de semence et de récoltes. L’octroi de ce crédit aidera Madame K. à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling grain storage sacks

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Born in 1968 at Attitogon, Mr. Koffi A. is married with three children. Having lost his father at an early age, and been left as the only remaining son in the family after his two elder brothers had died, Mr. A. went into business in order to meet the heavy family expenses for which he alone is responsible. In fact, he is responsible for his dead brothers’ seven children, his grandmother, and his own aging mother. His meager income barely meets his family’s needs. Having gained 10 years’ worth of experience as a shop assistant selling cement, Mr. A. has now opened his own shop, which he intends to supply wholesale by purchasing cement directly from the factory at a reduced price. Mr. A. is desperately short of the funds required to make these purchases. He is a creditworthy customer who has honored his previous loans, and he is now requesting a $1200 loan which would allow him to keep his shop constantly stocked up, and to satisfy the high demands of the current market. The resulting income will help cover his family’s expenses, and gradually build up a contingency fund that will keep his business going.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1968 à Attitogon, Monsieur A. Koffi est marié et père de trois enfants. Orphelin de père depuis l’enfance et devenu fils unique de la famille après le décès de ses deux frères aînés, M. A. s’est lancé dans le commerce afin de pouvoir faire face aux lourdes charges de la famille qui pèsent sur lui seul. En effet, les sept enfants de ses frères défunts, sa grand-mère et sa propre mère devenue très vielle sont tous à sa charge. Son maigre revenu couvre difficilement tous les besoins de la famille. Nanti d’une expérience dix ans dans la vente de ciment dans un magasin où il a été employé, M. A. a ouvert aujourd’hui son propre magasin qu’il compte approvisionner en gros en achetant directement le ciment à l’usine et donc à moindre coût. Pour y arriver M. A. a besoin des moyens suffisants qui lui manquent d’ailleurs cruellement. Client solvable pour avoir eu à bien honorer ses engagements antérieurs, M. A. sollicite un crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra de disposer à tout moment de stock au magasin et de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes sur le marché actuellement. Les revenus dégagés de cette activité l’aideront à subvenir au besoins de sa famille et à constituer progressivement un fonds de roulement et donc à pérenniser son activité.

loans.use: Cement trading

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
Mr. Dionicio sells soft drinks near schools in his area from a cart that he bought with his savings of $150.00 from his previous job. He began by selling to people passing through bus stations near his home, and eventually began to sell near schools in his neighborhood. Lately, his route has generated steady customers and increased demand for his products.

With the loan he plans to buy more of his products and to add sweets and other goods that customers have requested from him. He has more customers every day, due to the enthusiasm with which he attends to them. He is sure that by buying more merchandise and increasing his number of customers, he will be able to give a better life to his children.

Dioncio is 48 years old, has three children who are studying, and his house is built of cane. With economic stability, he hopes to have more family stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Dionicio se dedica a la venta de refrescos cerca de las inticuciones educativas de su sectorde de forma ambulante mediante un triciclo que adquirio con un ahorro de $150 de su anterior trabajo. Dionicio inicio atendiendo a los transeuntes de las estaciones de buses cercanas a su hogar luego comenzo a visitar las escuelas de su barrio. Actualmente su ruta de ventas le ha generado clientes seguros y mayor demanda de su producto. Con este prestamo el tiene pensado comprar mas de su producto y agregar golosina y articulos de bazar que han sido solicitado por sus clientes que cada dia son mas debido al carisma que tiene para atenderlos. Dionicio esta seguro que con la compra de mas mercaderia y el aumento de su clientela en su negocio podra otrogarles una mejor vida a sus hijos. El tiene 48 años, tres hijos que estan estudiando, su casa es de caña, con una estabiidad economica el espera tener una mejor estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To add more products to his inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José sells groceries and vegetables in a store he has built in his house. He began the business when he received a severance pay of $200.00 from his previous job as a security guard. He started out selling to his neighbors and other people from the area. He offers the products at economical prices and also fresh vegetables, which is why his sales have been growing day by day. He has increased the products available in his store, and because of the good service he gives to his customers, they have also grown in number.

With this loan he has the goal of buying more food products and also adding clothing items, which are requested by his clients. He is sure that with additional merchandise and the growth of his business, his family will be able to have a better quality of life.

José is 37 years old, has two children who are studying, and his house is built of cane. With his improved business, he hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Jose se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y legumbres en un local que ha acondicionado en su domicilio, el inicio este negocio cuando recibio una liquidacion de $200 de su antiguo trabajo como guardia des seguridad. Jose empezo atendiendo a los vecinos de su sector y ofreciendo los productos a precios economicos y las legumbres frescas por lo que sus ventas han aumentado dia a dia. En la actualidad ha incrementado más productos a su tienda y por su calidad en la atencion sus clientes tambien se han incrementado. Con este credito el tien la meta de comprar más producto alimenticos y adiconarle articulos de bazar que son solicitados por sus clientes. Jose tiene la certeza de que con la adquisicion de mas mercaderia y el crecimiento de su negocio su familia podra tener una mejor calidad de vida. El tiene 37 años, dos hijos que estan estudiando, su casa es de caña, y con su negocio mejorado espera darles una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy more food products and to buy clothing items that are requested by his clients

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza sells groceries and vegetables in a shop that she has built in her house. She began this business when she lost her job and with a loan of $150.00 her brother gave to her. She began by selling to her neighbors and friends, offering products at economical prices and also fresh vegetables. She has noticed that her sales have increased over time. She has had to buy more merchandise due to the demand and because of the fact that she trusts her customers to pick out for themselves the products they want to buy.

With the loan she wants to achieve one of her goals, which is to sell more school supplies. She lives near a school and has noticed that there are few stationary stores in her area, which is why she is sure that she will be able to sell many of these items. She is sure that by increasing the amount of merchandise and by improving her business, she and he family will be able to improve their living conditions.

Lorenza is 35 years old, has a son who is studying, and her house is built of cane. She is sure that by improving her business she will be able to build one of cement, and thereby improve her family’s stability.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Lorenza vende abarrotes y legumbres en un local que ha acondicionado en su casa. Ella comenzo esta actividad cuando quedo desempleada y con un prestamo de $150 que hizo a un hermano logro comenzar su tiendita. Lorenza empezo por atender a su vecindad y amigos ofreciendo los productos a precios economicos y las hortalizas frescas debido a esto ella ha notado que sus ventas han aumentado conel pasar del tiempo. Actualmente ha visto la necesidad de comprar más mercaderia por la demanda que estas tienen y por la confianza que ella brinda a sus clientes de que ellos mismos escojan el producto que desean llevar. Con el prestamo ella espera cumplir con uno de sus objetivos que es de incrementar utiles escolares pues ella vive cerca de una escuela y ha notado que hay pocos papelerias en sus sector y por lo tanto esta segura que esos articulos tendran mucha salida en su negocio. Lorenza tiene la certeza de que con el incremento de mercaderia y el mejoramiento de su negocio ella y su familia podran mejorar sus condiciones de subsistencia. Ella tiene 35 años, un hijo que estudia, su casa es de caña, pero con el realce que le de a su negocio esta seguro que podra comenzar a construirla de cemento y asi mejorar su estabilidad familiar.

loans.use: To  buy school supplies

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana sells clothing items from a small store she has in her house. She began the business with $200.00 that she had saved from her previous job. She began by selling to neighbors, offering a good variety of products at low prices. She continues her sales with the same enthusiasm as always, and needs to buy more merchandise due to requests from her clients.

With this new loan she hopes to achieve one of her goals, which is to sell fast food. She has the opportunity to buy a fast food cart, and in the area where she lives no one has a similar business. She is certain there will be much demand.

Ana is sure that by opening the fast food business, and by remodeling her existing business, she and her family will have better living conditions. She is 31 years old, has one son who is studying, and her house is made of cement. With the new focus that she’ll give to her business, she is sure she will be able to provide her son with a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana vende articulos de bazar en un local que tiene acondicionado dentro de su domicilio.Inicio este negocio con $200 que habia ahorrado de su antiguo trabajo. Ana empezo atendiendo a los vecinos ofreciendo los productos a precios bajos y siempre ofrecia variedad. Actualmente sigue atendiendo con el mismo entusiasmo que antes y ha comprobado la necesidad de adquirir más mercaderia por los pedidos de sus clientes. Con este nuevo credito ella espera alcanzar uno de sus objetivos que es de poner a la venta comida rapida ya que tuvo la oportunidad de comprar una carreta de servico rapido y por su sector no se ofrece este tipo de servicio su clientela siempre busca. Ana esta segura que esta actividad tendran mucha acojida junto a su negocio. Ana tiene la confianza de que con la apertura de esta nueva linea y el reacondicionamiento de su negocio ella y su familia tendran mejores condiciones de vida. Ella tiene 31 años, un hijo que estudia, su casa es de cemento, y con el nuevo enfoque que le de a su local esta seguro que podra darle una mejor educacion a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy a cart for selling fast food

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty owns a carpentry and furniture making business. While she was living with her husband at his mother’s house, she learned the business from her brother-in-law. When her brother-in-law left to start his own business on the other side of the city, Letty bought all the equipment from him in order to run the business herself. She hired two workers and brought her husband into the business to help her as well. She knows the trade well, although most of her job entails purchasing the materials and finding buyers for the finished product.

Letty and her husband have one child. He works at a shipyard in Guayaquil and helps out in the household and business. Her dream is to have her own home one day and run her shop out of there.

Letty’s business has been doing well over the last few months. She had a boost when she took out her previous loan with Kiva and Mifex, which allowed her to purchase a tool that she used to improve the quality and efficiency of her business. She wants a second loan in order to continue improving her machinery and also to fix up her workshop.

loans.use: Buy new tools and improve her workshop

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a mother of three children. In order to contribute to her family income she sells men’s clothing in her neighborhood. She started in this line of work about 5 years ago with the help of her mother, who provided the start up capital. Rosa feels that her work is very important because her husband does not have much job security. He is often hired as a skilled worker in factories but his jobs are never stable and he is always at risk of being unemployed.

Rosa did very well with her first loan which she received over the Christmas season. With the extra profit she made from that season she was able to pay back her loan while also making considerable reinvestments into her business. She continues to sell clothing on foot. She has made some small improvements to her home in order to progress towards her goal of making a shop, but she admits she has a ways to go. She hopes she can continue to save and make changes slowly so she can achieve her goal. She is seeking a second loan so she can continue to increase her product line while buying in bulk.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Miss Madleen Hamo is a single mother with three female children working hard to earn money for her family. She apped for a loan from Al-Aman to develop her hair salon. Her daughters work with her in the same shop. She wants to purchase new equipment for her salon and she wants to earn more money to enhance her family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment for her salon

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Mr Nawzad 45 years old with a small shop in the Kirkuk market to sell home supplies. He has five children, all of them in school. He works hard to allow then to continue their studes and a get good diploma. His activity and hard work encouraged him to apply for the loan from AL-Aman. The amount that he wants is $1200 and the purpose is to purchase more goods to sale to his customers.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Loi

texts.en: Mrs. Loi is 33 years old. Her husband, who is a day laborer, is 36 years old. Because of no land, they focus on selling groceries. Additionally they began raising eels at home. They have a son and daughter. The son is a student at primary school, the daughter doesn’t go to school yet. The family income is $10 per person/month. Mrs. Loi hopes to receive a loan of $75 to supply her grocery store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To supply the grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food kiosk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a vegetable stall for his wife

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Mrs. Trinh was born in 1973. She and her husband sell lottery tickets daily. They have no land, so selling lottery tickets is their main source income to support 2 children who are students at high school. Mrs. Trinh hopes to get a loan $75 so that she can sell lottery tickets to save money for her family. Trinh’s family income is $12 per person/month. She is going to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: Buying and selling lottery tickets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a vegetable stall for his wife

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
B. Tahir Jamil oglu settled in Imishli town and has 6 family members. He has 4 children studying at secondary school. He started his business 10 years ago. But he cannot improve his business because he has a small working capital. It is only the business of his family.

Increased demands for his family pushed him to apply to Agroinvest CU for credit. He requested 1200 USD. The half of this sum is for working capital to purchase goods and the second half for renovation of his shop. He hopes to meet family demands by increasing the scale of his business.

loans.use: Firstly, to purchase goods, and the second half for renovation of the shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a Grocery Store

loans.name: Afer

texts.en:
G. Afer Mirzaga oglu is the head of an IDP family consisting of four members. He is a teacher in Buldug village in the Sabirabad region, where he is settled. But increased prices and increased family demand pushed him to create his own business. He collected money and bought a cow.

He applied to Agroinvest for credit. He requested 1100 USD to purchase two additional productive cows with new born calves and 200 USD out of this sum will be spent on animal feed and medicine.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: wholesale buying and retailing of condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying and selling condiments

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
M. Shahin Jahangir oglu is a 24 year old wheel repair shop owner. He is just newly married and has one baby. He has this business for already two years. He has only very simple and old equipment to serve his clients. It is not sufficient based on his clients' demands. Clients would like to be served on time and in a short period of time. So, due to increased demand for professional services, Shahin decided to purchase some equipment for his business.

He applied to Agroinvest for credit of 1200 USD to invest in wheel repair equipment.

loans.use: Wheel repair equipment

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: T. Gabil Shamil oglu is a local businessman. He lives in Murselli village in the Imishli region and he is 24 years old. He has a small shop of vegetables and some other food products.  He started his business when he was single, but now he has a family and he has a second child. The increased family demand and high inflation rate in the country pushed him to extend his trading business. He would like to satisfy client demand comprehensively to attract more clients. Shamil applied for 1000 USD credit to Agroinvest to realize his ideas.

loans.use: To enlarge his store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Asif

texts.en:
G. Asif Mirzaga oglu is a 38 year old farmer and head of an IDP (internally displaced persons) family settled in Buldug village in the Sabirabad region. His family consists of 2 children, his parents, wife and himself. He has a small business in animal husbandry. This business is his second income source for his family. Asif is the only earner in the family. His first income is as a teacher. Through his animal husbandry business all family members participate in the income making process. But the business is very small. 
He applied for credit to Agroinvest for 1200 USD to purchase additional animals, because he has a large enough facility to keep them.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for his pick up vehicle and expand his business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
H. Elvira Seyran kizi is head of a small IDP family that includes her son and herself. She is 35 years old. Animal husbandry is the only business and income source in the family. They have 12 sheep. However, it is very difficult to feed her family with the income from the small number of animals. So, they decided to purchase additional sheep to increase the family income and satisfy the basic family needs. 
She applied for credit to Agroinvest, where she requested 1100 USD for that purpose.

loans.use: Going to purchase additional sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of necessary materials and creation of a workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his Passion Fruit Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business and move to a new premises

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
S. Gurban Ziyeddin oglu is a local businessman from Imishli town. He is 40 years old and has a big family: a wife, 3 children and his mother. This business is his only income source for his family, besides his mother's small pension.

He plans to diversify the products in his shop to fulfill his clients' demands. To realize this idea, he requested USD 1200 from Agroinvest to purchase a refrigerator for food products and as working capital. In the case that he may lose his clients' business for a period of time, hot weather conditions in the region will therefore not spoil his food products.

loans.use: To purchase refrigerator for food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale good for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods  for retail sale

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
O. Rena Mammad kizi is 50 years old and she is the head of her family. She has two children who are students. She lives in Sabirabad town and opened her shop in her house. Her shop is the only income source for her family. But her increased demand for money requires increasing income. But it is very difficult to do with a small working capital.

So, she decided to increase her working capital by applying for credit to Agroinvest. She applied for USD 1000.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Latafet

texts.en:
S. Latafet Eynulla kizi is a local farmer from Galagayin village in the Sabirabad region. She is 41 years old and she has three children. 
Latafet runs a very small business keeping calves for meat purposes and one cow for milking for family needs.  But she would like to extend her business by purchasing calves for meat production. So she applied for credit of 1200 USD to realize the idea and she choose Agroinvest through which to get this credit. She will spend this fund mostly to purchase 5 calves and mixed fodder for them.

loans.use: To purchase of calves for meat production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying pagnes and children's clothing

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
I. Shakir Khanoglan oglu has a small shop in Sabirabad town. The scale of his business is low in comparison with increased family expenses. He has 3 children who are students. 
He needs refrigerators. His food products have specifications that they should be stored in refrigerators. But he has only one small refrigerator and it gets hot in the summer. So Shakir decided to purchase two refrigerators for storage of food products in cool places. He needs 1200 USD to purchase the refrigerators. He applied for credit to Agroinvest.

loans.use: To purchase two refrigerators for storage of food products in cool places

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying wholesale goods for retail sale

loans.name: Raset

texts.en:
I. Raset Ayaz Oglu is an IDP farmer and he lost his family in the war. Now he lives alone. He does not have a job. He decided to run an animal husbandry business. He bought one cow. Now he wants to apply for credit to increase the number of cows to four.

He applied for credit with Agroinvest and requests 1200 USD. He has enough feed reserves for new cows too.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Agamir

texts.en: H. Agamir Mirish Oglu is one of the newly established farmers in the region. He lives in the Imishli region. He has a very small farm and to run such a small farm is not efficient. He keeps calves. To become more efficient, Agamir is going to extend his farm by purchasing additional calves. His farm has a sufficient amount of land to provide the animals with food. He requested from Agroinvest USD 950 in credit to buy 3 calves.

loans.use: To purchase 3 calves

loans.name: Gulshen

texts.en: A. Gulshen Hasan kizi is a businesswoman from Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. She is a Mekhsetian Turk refugee and she has a small farm.  She has a family consisting of an invalid husband and two children. It is very difficult to feed the family. Currently she has two cows and one calf on her farm, but the milk produced is not enough to feed the family. She has a clientele and there is demand for quality milk. She decided to meet this demand by receiving credit and she applied for 800 USD credit to purchase 1 more milking cow.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 more milking cow

loans.name: Bilender

texts.en: N. Bilender Azazil oglu is a local farmer living in Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. He has a big family consisting of 4 children and his wife. He has an animal husbandry business. He has very big problems in improving the business because of the number of animals and feeding them. He applied for 1200 USD as credit, of which 900 USD will be spent  for an additional  cow  and 300 USD to purchase feed.

loans.use: Purchase a cow and feed

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: F. Asif Adishirin oglu is a newly started young businessman from Imishli. He is 18 years old and he recently graduated from school. He is single and he is the only breadwinner in his family. He rented a room and started a vehicle spare part trading business. But due to the absence of his own capital, he cannot provide the clients with a comprehensive range of spare parts. He requested 900 USD as working capital.

loans.use: Purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: G. Fuad Mirzaga oglu is a 41-year-old farmer and he is the head of an Internally Displace Persons family settled in Buldug village of the Sabirabad region. His family consists of 5 children and his wife. Fuad is the only income maker in the family. He has a small business in animal husbandry. This business is the only income source for his big family. He would like to increase his business scale by purchasing calves and lamb.  He applied for credit of 1100 USD to purchase additional animals because he has a large enough facility to keep them.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 milk cow

loans.name: Zefer

texts.en: B. Zefer Evez oglu is a 50-year-old farmer and he is the head of an Internally Displace Persons family settled in Buldug village of the Sabirabad region. His family consist of 4 children, 2 parents and his wife. His family expenses are high due to the sickness of the elder people. He has a small business in animal husbandry. He would like to increase the number of animals to increase his income. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase animals and animal feed.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Meleyke

texts.en: G. Meleyke Alikram kizi is a young businesswomen and she runs a sheep breeding business. Her husband is a teacher, but she is not educated. So she wants to help raise money for her family. She keeps lambs for meat production, but the number of lamb is low, so she would like to increase this number. She applied for a loan of 800 USD for purchasing lambs.

loans.use: Going to purchase lambs

loans.name: Yevgeniya

texts.en: N. Yevgeniya Rza kizi is a young businesswoman from Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. She recently got married and because she is not educated, she would like to help her raise money for her young family. She applied for credit to purchase one more cow and some feed for them. She requested 900 USD to put her ideas into practice.

loans.use: Going to purchase one more cow and some feed for them

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: M. Ismayil Akper oglu is a businessman from Sabirabad town. He is 46 years old and he has a big family of 7 members. He runs a wholesale shop in Sabirabad town. He has difficulties with working capital and that is the reason he has applied for credit to Agroinvest. He requested 1200 USD for that purpose.

loans.use: Going to improve conditions of his market

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: G. Anver Osman oglu is a teacher in Varkhankend village of the Saatli region. This income is not sufficient for his big family, consisting of 7 members. He has one cow and now he wants to extend his animal husbandry business. He has requested 1000 USD for purchasing a cow and fodder for animals.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and fodder

loans.name: Adif

texts.en: G. Adif Rzaaga oglu is an Internally Displaced Person businessman settled in Buldug village of the Sabirabad region. He has a big family. He needs extra funds for development of his animal husbandry business. He applied for 1000 USD for those purposes.

loans.use: Development of his animal husbandry business

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: G. Mehman Alikram oglu is an animal husbandry farmer from Galagayin village of the Sabirabad region. He has big family of 6 members. He has a small business, and now he would like to extend his business so he applied to Agroinvest for 900 USD credit.

loans.use: Extend his business

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: M. Novruz Jamil oglu is one of the newly arrived Internally Displaced Person farmers in Alisoltanli village of the Saatli region. He has a very small farm and to run such small farm is not effective. He keeps cows. So Novruz is going to extend his farm by purchasing additional cows. His farm has sufficient amount of land to provide animal with feed. He requested from Agroinvest 900 USD as credit to buy 1 cow.

loans.use: Purchase 1 cow

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is married with three children. He lives in the Kimbangulile area in Dar es Salaam.  He sells  vegetables  and fruits near his residence. He buys  fresh produce of fruits and vegetables from nearby villages for resale at a small profit. The business has been his main source of livelihood for the past ten years. The business has not grown because he has to make a balance between business and family needs. The proposed loan will assist Adam to expand his business through adding new products. The amount needed to expand his business is USD 550. If his business is expanded, he will be able to meet the challenge of paying school fees for his child who is expected to start secondary education.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Amina Hassan

texts.en:
Amina is married and has two children. She lives in the Zakheem area in Dar es Salaam. Amina owns a small canteen near the KTM Textile industry in Dar es Salaam. She sells cold drinks, breakfast and lunch to mostly industrial workers. Amina has received entrepreneurship and business training from Small Industries Development Organization (SIDO) in Dar es Salaam. This training has helped her a lot. She knows how to keep records of her business and utilize opportunities that come around.

In usual working hours, her business is normally flocked with customers in need of services. Inadequate facilities hamper her efforts. She needs to expand her business by adding dining chairs and tables, food serving dishes and a stock of cold drinks. To facilitate this expansion she is in need of USD 750 as working capital. Amina's dream is to have one day a professional catering business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and food storage dishes

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with three children. He owns a retail shop near his residence. The shop sells different consumable items especially food items, rice in particular. Rice is one of the staple foods in Tanzania. Felix plans to increase the stock of rice. There is an expectation of a rice price rise. Having enough stock now will help him make more money later. The extra stock demands more funding. The strategy will help him increase his income, the aim being to sustain the family and pay for school fees for his children. To implement his plans Felix needs USD 750 as working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mohamed Omari

texts.en: Mohamed opened a hardware shop two years ago near the main road to the southern regions of Tanzania. The shop sells hardware materials and equipment. Among other items in his shop, cement and iron sheets have higher turnover. He want to add a stock of these items before they are depleted in the store. Construction in his area (Mbagala) is on the increase. Mohamed does not like to loose his customers due to stock-outs. The income generated from the business is used to raise the family and any extra is reinvested back into the business. Mohamed is married and has three children. He is in need of USD 1200.

loans.use: To add stock of cement and iron sheets

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro has been able to support his family in an honorable way by preparing and selling tamarind candies and pulps in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas. He is married and he has a son. In order to improve the quality of his products, he wants to buy a labeling machine to put labels in the containers of his products. He needs a loan of $925 to increase his production and sales. Alejandro has put a lot effort in developing his business, he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur and with your help this could be possible. By buying the labeling machine he will be able to cover the growing demand of his products. Alejandro and his family are sincerely grateful of your generosity and support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace cinco años Alejandro se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pulpas y dulces de tamarindo en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, con este oficio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia honestamente, él es casado y tiene un hijo. En busca de mejorar la calidad de sus productos ahora desea poder adquirir una ensambladora de etiquetas para adherir los envases y poder incrementar su producción y ventas, para lo que necesita de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares. Alejandro se ha esforzado mucho para desarrollar su negocio, y desea continuar creciendo como microempresario y con tu ayuda será posible, al adquirir la ensambladora podrá cubrir la creciente demanda de sus productos, él y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu generosidad y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy equipment for his job

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
Maria is an enterprising woman with a big desire of improving the quality of life of her family. She is a single mother of two children and she just adopted a two-year-old little girl. Currently she rents a store where she sales handbags, backpacks, tennis shoes and shoes. Now she has the opportunity to buy a small store with easy payments. She needs a loan of $925 for the down-payment that she will repay over a period of 6 months. The love to her children and to the little one she just adopted is the biggest reason for Maria to make an effort to provide what they need. Today is a good day to help someone in need. Don’t hesitate, your support will be a big help to this family. Thanks!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, ella es madre soltera dos hijos y ha adoptado a una pequeña de 4 años de edad. Actualmente renta un local donde vende bolsas para dama, mochilas, tenis y zapatos, ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de comprar un pequeño local en cómodos pagos, y para el enganche requiere de un crédito por $ 925 dólares que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 6 meses. El amor hacia sus hijos y hacia esa pequeña que ha logrado ganarse su cariño es el más grande motivo para que Maria salga día a día a esforzarse para obtener lo que ellos necesitan. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, no lo dudes más, tu ayuda será de mucha utilidad para esta familia, gracias.

loans.use: Buy a store

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is married and she has three children. She is originally from San luis Potosí, but she has been living in Reynosa for the past 7 years; the same time that Maria has been working at a stationer’s shop. Due to health reason the current owner cannot longer run the business, and he has offered to sell her the business. She knows that that with her experience and a lot of effort she will be able to make it. In order to cover the transaction expenses Graciela is asking for a loan of $925, that she will repay over a period of 6 months. Don’t hesitate, you can help improve the quality of life of this family, Graciela only wants the best future for her family. They are very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela es casada y tiene tres hijos, ella es originaria de San Luis Potosí, tiene 7 años viviendo en Reynosa, Tamaulipas, ese mismo tiempo que tiene de trabajar en una papelería y ahora, por problemas de salud el dueño actual no puede seguir al frente del negocio y le ha propuesto a Graciela el traspaso de la papelería. Ella sabe que con la experiencia que tiene en el negocio y el esfuerzo que esta dispuesta a realizar podrá salir adelante. Para poder cubrir el costo del traspaso Graciela solicita un crédito de $925 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 6 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, Graciela sólo desea un futuro mejor para ella y su familia, no lo pienses más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Buy business

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo lives in cohabitation and he has two small children. He learned is occupation of automotive industry refrigeration technician in Linares, Nuevo, Leon where he is originally. Due to his parents illness he had to stop studying and start working in order to support his family. Fortunately, he is been successful and now a maquiladora (assembly plant) requires of his services. Alfredo needs a loan of $925 to buy a used pick-up truck to be able to transport his equipment and materials to the maquiladora. The truck will essential to the growth of his business, he sees this as an opportunity to change the life of his family and it will be possible thanks to your help.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Alfredo vive en unión libre y tiene dos pequeños hijos, aprendió el oficio D. refrigeración automotriz e industrial en Linares, Nuevo León, D. donD. es originario, por cuestiones D. necesidad económica abandonó sus estudios, pues las enfermedades D. sus padres lo orillaron tener que realizar un trabajo para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, afortunadamente ha sobresalido en su trabajo y ahora una empresa maquiladora requiere D. sus servicios. Para poder trasladar su material y equipo a la maquiladora y realizar su trabajo Alfredo solicita un préstamo D. $925 dólares, que empleará en la compra D. una camioneta usada, ésta le será D. gran ayuda en el crecimiento D. su negocio, él ve la posibilidad D. cambiar la vida D. su familia y será posible gracias a tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy a pick-up truck

loans.name: Guillermo Enrique

texts.es:
Guillermo is been living in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas for the past 21 years, he is originally from Tampico. He moved there looking for better opportunities. He lives in cohabitation and he has four children. In order to offer them a better quality of life Guillermo decided to start his own business of selling footwear and backpacks. He has a unit on the market and he has done well with the sales. Regrettably, his mother fell ill and the medicines that she needs are very costly, Guillermo wants his business to grow, therefore he is asking for a loan of $275 that he will use to buy merchandise to increase the sales and profits. He only wishes the best for his family and he puts a lot effort to do it, you can contribute to the growth of this business, he are sincerely grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 21 años Guillermo radica en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, él es originario de Tampico, pero cambio su residencia en busca de mejores oportunidades. Él vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos, para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida Guillermo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y mochilas, tiene un local en el mercado y le ha ido muy bien con las ventas. Lamentablemente su madre enfermó y los medicamentos que requiere son muy costosos, Guillermo desea hacer crecer su negocio para lo que solicita un préstamo de $275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas y utilidades. Él solo quiere lo mejor para su familia y se esfuerza mucho para conseguirlo, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia has three children, she thinks that being a woman and not having the support of her husband does not imply a defeat, but rather an opportunity to grow and to show that women are capable of self development and are capable to proper despite the adversities. In order to support her children she started a business of selling groceries, where she has done been quite well with the sales. Unfortunately, the floods in the city of Reynosa, Tamaulipas caused damages in her store. She needs a loan of $375 to do the repairs needed and to keep on working and growing. You can be an important part in the development of this business and in the life of this family. Don’t hesitate and support them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia tiene tres hijos, ella considera que ser mujer y no tener el apoyo de su esposo no implica un fracaso, sino más bien una oportunidad para crecer y demostrar que las mujeres son capaces de desarrollarse y salir adelante pese a las adversidades. Para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos emprendió su negocio de venta de abarrotes, donde le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas. Desafortunadamente las inundaciones en la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas provocaron deterioros en su local y necesita de un préstamo de $375 dólares para hacer las reparaciones correspondientes y continuar trabajando y creciendo con su tienda. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en la vida de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Repairs

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda is a 39-years-old married woman, mother of two children, one is 2 years old and the other one is 8 years old. Before the need to obtain an extra income, she started a business of selling footwear three years ago, since her husband was earning a very low salary and he wasn’t able to cover all the needs of his family. Arminda is a very optimistic person and she likes to prosper and overcome the adversities that appear in her life, therefore she doesn’t doubt of her capacity to increase her sales. Now she commercializes her products to different flea markets, among her friends and her family. Now, Arminda needs a loan of $250 that she will use to buy merchandise that will allow her to have a bigger variety and to keep growing with her business, she will repay over a period of 4 months. You can help with the well-being of this family, don’t hesitate and help them.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Arminda tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos pequeños de 2 y 8 años de edad. Desde hace tres años ella inició con la venta de calzado ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra, ya que su esposo recibía ingresos muy bajos y no cubría todas las necesidades de su familia. Arminda es una persona muy optimista y le gusta superarse y salir de las adversidades que se presentan en su vida por lo que no duda de su capacidad para incrementar sus ventas, actualmente comercializa sus productos en diferentes mercados ambulantes y entre sus familiares y amigos. En estos momentos, necesita un préstamo de $250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, decídete a ayudar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es:
“I have had my business for 1 year, but there are many things I need. I would like to buy more merchandise and a vitrine to display it. I hope not to have to close my business, since it what my family and I live from. I am asking for $1,200.00 to buy merchandise and a vitrine.” .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo mi negocio desde hace 1 año pero me hacen falta muchas cosas, me gustaría poder comprar más mercancía y una vitrina para acomodarla, no quisiera tener que cerrar el negocio ya que es de donde vivimos mi familia y yo”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar mercancía y una vitrina.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a vitrine

loans.name: Cao

texts.en: Mrs. Cao is 61 years old. She lives with a grandchild, 3 years old. She has no land aside from a hut. She sells groceries at home in order to save money to support herself and her grandchild. The family income is $9 per person/month. Mrs. Cao hopes to get a loan of $75 to run her grocery store. She will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To run the grocery store.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Both Mrs. Lanh and her husband were born in 1962. They have 3 children whose ages are 18, 14 and 12. The first child is a mutr person. The second child stopped going to school. Only the youngest is a student at high school. They have no land for cultivation. Lanh’s husband is a day laborer and she is a door-to-door salesperson. She sells a few soft drinks on rivers using a small boat. Their income is about $8 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to run their selling in order to save money for their life. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To run a small soft drink shop.

loans.name: Con

texts.en: Mr. Con was born in 1947. He lives with his youngest son, 20 years old. They have no land except their home and about 10 square meters for storing ice water. They distribute ice water to a few tea shops in the village. They hope to get a loan of $75 to run their distribution. Their income is $13 per person/month. They will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To distribute ice water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her fish business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. N. is 33 years old and married with four children. Two of them are in school while the rest have completed high school and are now waiting to join college. Her husband is a hawker in another town while she deals tomatoes in the open-air market.. They do not earn enough to expand the business.

Mary has an opportunity to buy tomatoes from the farmers in rural areas. They sell cheaper from these areas and the margin is good. She has not enough money to take advantage of this opportunity. She is therefore requesting a loan of US $300. US$250 will be used to buy the stock and US$ 50 to cater for transport and other expenses. They are doing this as a group due to high transport costs. They have a viable plan that can change their lives.

loans.use: Expand her tomato business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her tomato and onion business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Protected

texts.en:
Mr. Najdat is 35 years old has a small bakery in Kirkuk. He lives with his big family in one house. This is his first application for a loan. He wants to develop his shop and purchase new bakery machines to improve his life and increase his business income. Mr. Najdat wants $1200 and he is looking for the more in the future.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new bakery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her Banana Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construct a stall and expand her food business

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is married with three children. One is in primary school the others are still at home. He started his chicken business in 1996 in which he gets his stock from his local Myanga market then sells at Kandui trading center. Through his business, Protus has been able to develop his farm by adding cattle and goats, and to open up a small hotel in the Mayanja business centre to diversify his business this year.

Most of the challenges he faces in his chicken business is when he purchases sick chickens without knowing it, and the transportation costs, which are very high in the area due to his movement to selling areas. He makes about $15 in profit from each chicken that he sells. With the combined businesses, he is able to support his family's basic needs and other necessities. With the loan of $125 from PEMCI, he plans to expand his chicken business, which is now booming. With this kind of business he hopes to increase on his earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for his children's education

loans.use: Chicken seller, Hotelier

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has fully repaid his first loan with Kiva, which he took with PEMCI in February, 2007. He has requested another loan of US$1200 to enable him to expand his business further. Francis is 47 years old and has 5 daughters between the age of 9 – 20, and four of them are in either primary or secondary school. He lives with his daughters and his wife, whom he fondly refers to as a business and life partner. One day, Francis hopes that he will be able to pay for all of them to go to college.

His first loan with Kiva enabled him to rapidly expand his business beyond just clothing to include shoes as well. Utilizing some business savy, Francis provides the newest and best goods by going directly to the importers in the capital city of Nairobi, so he buys them at the best price. In turn, he brings the clothes and shoes back to this rural community, which could not get these goods otherwise. He wholesales these items to retail shops in Malaba and other towns. He also operates an open-air shop in Kitale where people from around the area come to buy in bulk for resale.

This strategy has been integral to his success as a competitive supplier. Additionally, with the success of his distribution business, he has been able to buy a plot of land, and he dreams of earning enough to build a house there.

loans.use: Wholesale Clothing Business

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is married with 2 children, who are still in primary school. He has been operating his shop for four years, selling manufactured retail goods which he buys from Khatia and Sheriffs Wholesales in Bungoma. He operates the shop from Masielo Trading Center. Through his business he has been able to afford to send his children to school, take care of his family needs and support the community wellbeing.

Although he has many challenges, Protus's concern is lack of capital which is limiting his expansion of services, which he alone provides in the area. With the help of the loan of $75 from PEMCI, he plans to increase his stock and introduce new demanded commodities in the shop, which in the long run will increase his client base and earnings. He plans to build his own bigger shop in the near future at the local trading center.

loans.use: Shopkeeper, farmer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a food kiosk for his wife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase 2 blowdryers and one hair dryer and improve her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a vegetable and fruits stall beside her shop

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.ru:
Uguloi I. has been a client of MicroInvest for 4 years. She started her business by selling only 0.5 tones of peanuts/groundnuts. Today she sells 3 tones of peanuts. She is married with 4 children. Her eldest son helps out with the business. Since August will be the start of the peanut season she needs $1025 to expand and increase her profits.

PS - The photo is of her son. Uguloi recently lost her mother and because of that has not been at work. So her son is replacing her.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Иброгимова Угулой клиентка Микроинвест 4 года. Начинала свой бизнес продажи всего 0,5 тонн арахиса, а сегодня продает до 3тонн арахиса. Она замужем, имеет 4 детей. Старший сын помогает в бизнесе. Так, как в августе наступает сезон арахиса, ей нужен 1011$ для расширения и увеличения своей прибыли. P.S. На фотографии ее сын, недавно у нее умерла мать, в связи с этим она не вышла на работу. Ее замещает сын.

loans.use: Business expansion for upcoming peanut season in August

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new computer and printer

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru:
Yakub M. has been in business for 12 years and for 6 of these he has been a client of MicroInvest. He started his business by selling several kinds of perfume in a small stall. At the moment his assets are worth $1100. His product selection has doubled. Yakub M. is married with 2 children. He is asking for $1200 to further expand his product selection and to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Мавлонов Якуб в бизнесе 12 лет, из них 6 лет является клиентом Микроинвест. Начинал свой бизнес с продажей нескольких видов парфюмерий в маленьком прилавке. На данный момент его активы составляют 1100$. Его ассортимент товаров увеличился в двое. Мавлонов Якуб женат, имеет 2-х детей. Он просит 1200$ для увеличения ассортимента товара и расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Expand his business and product selection

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add more Pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add more Dairy Goats

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Nazokat S. is married with 3 children. She has been in business for 10 years. She started her business selling children’s, men’s and women’s shoes. Her son and her daughter in law help out in the business. Nazokat travels herself to a neighboring country to buy inventory. She has been an active client of MicroInvest for 5 years. During this time she not only increased her profits but has also expanded her product selection. Nazokat S. is asking for $600 to increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Салимова Назокат замужем, имеет 3 детей. Бизнесом занимается 10 лет. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи детской, женской и мужской обуви. В ее бизнесе ей помогает сын и невестка. В соседнюю страну за товаром ездит сама. В течение пяти лет Салимова Назокат является, активной клиенткой Микроинвест и за эти годы она не только получила прибыль, но и увеличила свой ассортимент. Салимова Назокат запрашивает 600$ для увеличения товарооборота.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more bags of dried maize for milling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Start a Chicken Rearing Business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Marhabo R. is married with 5 children, who all attend school. She has been in business for 8 years. She started her business by selling fruit she grew in her own garden at the ‘Pachshanbe’ market. She is a recent client of MicroInvest. She was able to greatly increase her sales after receiving her loan. At the moment it is the fruit season and Marhabo R. is asking for $500 to expand her sales so as to maximize her profits.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Разокова Мархабо замужем, имеет 5 детей. Бизнесом занимается 8 лет. Ее дети учатся в школе. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов. Собирала фрукты со своего сада и продавала их на рынке «Пачшанбе». В Микроинвесте она недавно. После получения кредита, она намного увеличила свой товарооборот. Так, как сейчас сезон фруктов, Разокова Мархабо запрашивает 400$ для увеличения товарооборота и получения максимальной прибыли.

loans.use: To increase sales during the current fruit season

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet A. is a dedicated community health worker (CHW).  She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, with her husband and four school-going children. She was trained by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care. Through her own initiative and hard work, she opened a community pharmacy at Achuth market in Bware, the only one serving the surrounding community. Linet has managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy. As there is no chemist in her area, people come from quite a distance to buy drugs from her pharmacy. She moved her business to this more prominent and spacious location (pictured) four years ago in order to meet the growing demand. To boost her profits, Linet requires an additional US $600 to increase her stock of drugs, which are in high demand.

loans.use: Add stock of drugs

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru:
Izzat K. is married with 3 children, who all attend school. She has been in business for 5 years. She started her business selling fruit. She is a fairly new client of MicroInvest. After receiving her loan she was able to greatly expand her sales. At the moment it is the fruit season and so Izzat K. is asking for $500 to expand her sales and business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Каримова Иззат замужем, имеет 3 детей. Бизнесом занимается 5 лет. Ее дети учатся в школе. Начинала свой бизнес с продажи фруктов. В Микроинвесте она недавно. После получения кредита, она намного увеличила свой товарооборот. Так, как сейчас сезон фруктов, Каримова Иззат запрашивает 400$ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Expanding her business during the current fruit season

loans.name: Moses Imo

texts.en: Moses has been in business for the last three years in Kolanya trading center He gets His Materials from Uganda and Bungoma in Kenya. He makes new design of Kitenge, Uniforms and Kaunda suits for the community. This is his second business loan with Pemci having complete first loan Successfully without any default. His first loan enabled him to purchase more materials for his business and sowing treads, this has boosted his capital base and profit margin. He was able to improving on his customer base by getting connection to different school to make uniforms for primary school children. From the earning of the business he has been able to support his family welfare. He has one Child who is yet to join school and his wife sell food stuff at the local market in Chamasiri and Malakisi.Through his business Moses is mainly faced with a lot of challenges in dealing with competition from other tailors in the area. With second loan from Pemci he plans to add new materials and thread so as to support all his customers’ demands. With the high demand of clothes in the community he plans in future to expand on his trading by training and employing worker to help him in his business to support all the customers.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Nereah

texts.en: Nereah A. is a 58-year old widow.  She lives in Migori, Kenya, with her seven children and four grandchildren. She is a leader of Buchwa women's group, a community initiative that provides home-based care services to people living with HIV/AIDS. She also runs a food kiosk at Achuth market in Bware, specializing in selling the local favorites, chapattis (fried flat bread) and mandazzis (fried sweet dough) served with tea.  She supplements her food kiosk business by buying and selling dry maize and also has local dairy cattle breeds which produce milk for sale. Her daily income has increased by 100%, and she has managed to save a bit of her profits.  She requires US $600 to enable her to move her business to a larger space and a more lucrative location.

loans.use: Expand her food kiosk business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. is a 30-year old entrepreneur and mother of three school-aged children.  She and her husband live in Bware Migori, Kenya.  Betty is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs three businesses all in one location. She initiated her current businesses ( posho mill, retail shop, and a community pharmacy) in the year 2006. All her businesses are the only ones in the area. She used the funds from her first loan to invest in the shop where she sells the daily necessities, like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap. At her pharmacy she sells a wide range of fast moving drugs such as those for painkillers, antimalarials, family planning drugs, and drugs for worms and various syrups for children. Betty has employed three people to assist her in running her businesses.   She requires US $ 600 to purchase a new posho mill that can cope up with the demand.

loans.use: Purchase modern posho mill

loans.name: Muhaiye

texts.ru:
Muhaiye M. is married with two children. She has been in business for 7 years. For the last 2 years she has been a client of MicroInvest. She started her business with $400. Currently her assets are worth $1100. Muhaiye started out by selling about 3-4 different kinds of perfumes and cosmetics/beauty products. Today her product selection has doubled. Muhaiye M. is asking for $1000 to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer.

Муминова Мухайе замужем, имеет 2 детей. Бизнесом занимается 7 лет. Уже 2 года, как она является клиенткой Микроинвест. Начинала свой бизнес 400$, на данный момент ее актив составляет 1100$. Продавала 3-4 видов парфюмерий, а на данный момент ее ассортимент увеличился в двое. Муминова Мухайе запрашивает 1000$ для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en: Kenneth is a prominent business man in Malakisi  where he has been running his business for the last ten years. He started his business by selling clothes. Then he changed to kerosene distribution. Finally he started to sell animals at the local Malakisi, Malaba and Angurai Markets. He sells animal such as goats, cattle and chickens  which he gets  from  the Kocholia, Mayanja, and Malakisi Markets. He has completed his second loan successfully with Pemci. It has greatly improved  his capital base, and he been able to diversify his business in selling different animal varieties. Kenneth bought himself a bicycle to improve his transportation. Through his business he has been able to build his house to support his family needs and be able to supply his customers through out with chicken and quality meat. Although he faces many challenges in his business, Kenneth has been able to keep his head high by diversifying his business and giving quality products to his customers. Kenneth is the father of four children. One child is in nursery school and the others are still at home. With the third loan from Pemci he plans to increase  his stock business and strengthen his  recently opened butchery business which will greatly improve his business expansion and improve  his income. He dreams in the future of owning more butcheries in different locations in the Teso and Bungoma Districts.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Justus Simiyu

texts.en: Justus has been married for seven years. He has three children, (two girls and one boy) who are all in Primary school. He operates his business hand in hand with his wife from Myanga, Chwele, Mayanja  markets which he attends on Tuesday, Wednesday, Monday and Friday, respectively. For six years Justus has been in the business  of selling cereals like Maize, Beans, Millet  and Ground nuts, which he normally gets from Malaba and other market places Like Myanga. Through his business he has been able to support his family and provide for the welfare and education of his children who are in private school. He faces many challenges like high transport cost which has gone up to $8. He gets up to $12 per day in profit. With the loan from Pemci he hopes to increase on his stock and  be able to buy himself a bicycle to improve on transportation. He dreams of expanding his business in order to supply a variety of product like cereals and retail goods in the whole Bungoma district.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Khazangul

texts.en: Khazangul is a mother of 7 children. She was born in 1950  in Salyan region, Yenikand village.This kind woman is a widow. It is difficult to bring up children alone. 15 years ago she decided to start  breeding cattle in order to  support her family. Now she needs a loan of $475 to buy  2 machines to help her in her work.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of equipment to help in her work

loans.name: Djavid

texts.en:
Djavid  was born in 1980 in Salyan region, Gardili village. He is single. He has been in this business for 3 years. He wants to improve his cattle breeding and get good income from it.  At the beginning of his business he bought 2 calves to raise for slaughter. Then he decided to raise cows as well.
Now he is applying for a loan of $950 to buy a pregnant cow to increase the number of his cows.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar has 7 years of experience in this business. He was born in 1973 in Salyan region,  Yenikand village. This hardworking person is married, and has a child.  He works very hard for the success of his family. He raises cattle.
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy more equipment to help him with his work.

loans.use: To buy 2 pieces of equipment for his work

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en:
Ismayil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Djabrayil region, Soltanli village. This 51-year-old man with his family settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children. With his own car, Ismayil has transported fruits, vegetables, and agricultural produce from the different villages to Khirdalan setlement for sale.

Ismayil has been selling near his home for 5 years. Now he is applying for a loan of $800 to buy agricultural produce, fruits, vegetables and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce, fruits, vegetables to improve his business

loans.name: Yadigar

texts.en:
Yadigar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. This 42-year-old man has 2 children. His daughter is 3 years old and his son is 4 years old. His wife died and so he is bringing up his young children all alone.

For 6 years, Yadigar has sold building materials, transporting them with his own truck . Now he needs a loan of $1200 to allow him to make capital repairs on his truck.

loans.use: make capital repairs on his own truck

loans.name: Mavsuna

texts.en:
Mavsuna has sold women's clothes in Panjshanbe for over 4 years. She sells in a shop located in the center of the market. She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Mavsuna has a university degree as an engineer. Unfortunately, due to economic conditions of the country, she could not find a job with her major. So she took up the sale of women's garments.

Mavsuna became a client of Micro Invest in 2006. That gave her an opportunity to start her own business while simultaneously being a salesperson in the shop. Her idea was welcomed and supported by the shop owner who is in fact her employer. Her products are traditional Tajik dresses that are sewn in local sewing workshops. Her husband has helped Mavsuna to negotiate a contract with several sewing-workshops and knitting-workshops who prepare Tajik dresses for the market.

Mavsuna wants to expand her garment assortment with modern clothing that is in high demand by Tajik women nowadays. To expand her business in this sphere, Mavsuna will need extra capital, so she is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: Import of garments from Turkey

loans.name: Shoirahon

texts.en:
Shoirahon is a young salesperson with 2 children. She likes everything concerning children. Currently she has chosen a business that supplies kids with beautiful clothes. In the first place, of course, she does this to earn her living, but also to educate her children who are going to school.

Shoirahon has developed a stable and profitable enterprise in the 4 years she has been in business. In 2004, she applied for the first time to Micro Invest for a loan of 150 USD. She reimbursed the loan on time under the supervision of Micro Invest.

Now her problem is the condition of her shop, where she needs to install a new roof. With her profit, she cannot afford maintenance expenses. The new roof is vital because it will keep her goods safe from rain and snow in wintertime and from sun damage in summer. To have a new roof installed, Shoirahon needs 1200 USD.

loans.use: a new roof for her shop

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi  wants to improve his family's living conditions.  He needs to work very hard every day to cover family expenses. Vidadi is 39 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Zangilan region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children.
Vidadi is applying for a loan of $1000 to make capital repairs on his car so that he can offer better service to his clients and so earn a good income.

loans.use: to make capital repairs on his car

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
Maruf has a small green-grocery in the open-air at Panchshanbe market. Maruf is married and has 3 children .They go to school. His wife is a housewife. Maruf started by helping his elder brother in 1987 when he was in high school. He learned from his brother the skills of a merchant.

Now Maruf has his own business. He sells different kind of vegetables like potatoes, carrots, onions, and all kinds of greens. Now he also wants to open a new green-grocery for his son to make bigger turnover. For this he needs an additional 1000 USD. With his present turnover it is becoming very hard to support the whole family. Expenses for food and school are growing so that makes Maruf want to involve his eldest son in the business. He hopes very much to receive funding so that he can expand his business together with his son.

loans.use: expanding his business with his son

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
Muhayo started her business over 6 years ago. She is renting space in an open-air market of Khujand. She is married and has children. She lives with her parents-in-law. They are pensioners so she is responsible for them.

The turnover of Muhayo's business is fast. She started receiving loans 5 years ago. Step by step, she has increased the loan amount from 100 USD to 1000 USD. Her father helps in her business. He sells fruits like apples, plums, cherries and strawberries. She sells vegetables like tomatoes, cucumbers. Farmers from close districts supply Muhayo with vegetables and fruits on a wholesale basis at cheaper price.

Muhayo wants an additional 1000 USD to expand the business together with her father.

loans.use: Increasing the turnover of products

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba is married and has 2 children. She is an accountant and has a university degree. She could not find a well-paid job and had to work at a market. Her brother helped her to rent a place for trade.

When she heard about Micro Invest, Mahbuba became a client of this organization. The first loan she received was $300 and she spent it for purchasing sportswear for teenagers. Step-by-step she expanded her assortment and today her little shop has become one of the best-known shops in the area.

Now Mahbuba would like to buy new modern clothes for men. She hopes to have a profitable summer season and would like to be prepared with an adequate amount of goods to meet the demand, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Purchasing of modern clothes

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en:
Gulsara has 13 years of experience trading at the open-air market. She is married and has 2 beautiful girls.  They are a very friendly family and help each other in business. Gulsara brings brooms from Uzbekistan in the Andijon districts. She bought the brooms from peasants. Her girls are old enough to help her to prepare the brooms for sale.  Her daughters paint the brooms and dry them under the sun. Gulsara sells the finished goods in her trade place. When she heard about Micro Invest, she became a client and started with a loan of $50. Gradually she could increase her loan to $700.
Today she has a lot of clients. Now Gulsara requests $1000 to increase the volume of her goods.

loans.use: Purchasing of brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of lumber for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Penah

texts.en: Penah H. is a glass worker in the town of Kachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. This is the 3rd loan Penah has taken from Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has proven himself to be a reliable client. Penah is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of glass which will allow him to take on more customers at one time.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of glass

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor has 3 kids and is happily married. She has a small store where she sells many different products. Her husband was the main reason she started the business, as he provided the inspiration and the start-up capital. She started with only $30 worth of products in stock, but she has been growing progressively. Her husband also sells the chemical products he makes (mostly for cleaning) at their store. They have had to put railings around their home because there have been several robbery attempts targeted at their business.

Flor is now seeking her second loan with Kiva and MIFEX. She needed the first loan in order to invest in toys for the upcoming Christmas season. Thanks to the loan, her sales and profits quickly rose, providing her with extra investment capital for the beginning of the year. She now wants a second loan in order to fix up the store she has in her home.

loans.use: Improve the condition of the store in her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes to resell to women and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large quantity of fuel

loans.name: Telman

texts.en: Telman B. is in the unusual, but needed, business of  finishing and selling headstones. His enterprise is in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Telman is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of unfinished headstones.

loans.use: To purchase unfinished headstones

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham E. owns a glass shop in the town of Khachmaz which is located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. This is Ilham’s second loan from Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has shown himself to be a low risk for default. Ilham is looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of glass which will allow him to serve more customers at any one time.

loans.use: To purchase glass for his shop

loans.name: Rehim

texts.en: Rehim N. (his employee is pictured) is a realtor in the town of Khachmaz which is located in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Rehim is looking for funding so that he can modernize his office by purchasing a computer and more furniture.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and furniture to modernize his office

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir K. (his employee is pictured) owns a small tire repair shop in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Nadir is looking for funding so that he can purchase more and newer tools for his shop. With more and better tools he and his employees will be able to work more efficiently. This is Nadir's fourth loan with Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has proven himself to be a low risk client.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his shop

loans.name: Habil

texts.en: Habil H. owns and operates a market in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Habil is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory. This is Habil’s fourth loan from Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has proven himself to be at low risk of defaulting on his loan.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib X. owns and operates a tea house in the town of Khachmaz, which is located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Talib is looking for funding so that he can purchase more chairs for his tea house. He knows that people aren’t going to frequent his establishment if they can’t sit down to enjoy their tea.

loans.use: To purchase chairs for his tea house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cattle Trading and Butchery Business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This business owner has a small shop to sell fabric in the Kirkuk market. He inherited this shop from his father. He is the only one working in his family. He applied to AL-Aman to get $1200 to buy new goods from another city and sell them in Kirkuk. This entrepreneur is very active. He works 12 hours during the day. He wants to increase his sale average and earn more money.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 35 years old. He was jobless two years ago. Now he has a small mini-market beside his house in Kirkuk. He applied for the loan from AL-Aman to get $1000 to make some changes in his shop and bring up new goods for his shop. He also wants to paint the shop and develop it.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.
