Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Development

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his big family in Kirkuk. He applied for a loan from AL-Aman to get $1000 for his mobile shop. He wants to bring new and modern mobile types to the shop and sell them. He wants to increase his sales, develop his shop, earn more money and enhance his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Bring new and modern mobile types

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand Scrap Metal Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fish Monger

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda is married and has two children, who are also married. Her husband, Juan, works at an auto repair shop, but his salary is very low. To improve the living conditions of her family, Hermelinda started a business three years ago cooking and selling tamales. She started selling them to family and friends, and, thanks to the support of her children, was able to attract many more customers. She later started selling cakes as well, and wishes to see her business to continue to develop successfully.

To purchase all the ingredients necessary to make her products, Hermelinda is requesting a $475 loan, which she plans to repay within six months. She has worked hard to improve the quality of life for her and her family. She wants to continue improving it and needs your support. She is grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hermelinda es casada y tiene dos hijos que ya están casados, su esposo Juan trabaja como intendente en una empresa de autoservicio pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida hace tres años Hermelinda inició su negocio con la elaboración y venta de tamales, comenzó vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigos, y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ha logrado obtener muchos clientes, últimamente ha incorporado la venta de pasteles, y desea que su negocio pueda desarrollarse exitosamente..

Para la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos, Hermelinda solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, mismos que se compromete a devolver en un lapso de 6 meses. Hermelinda ha trabajado mucho para mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia, ella quiere superarse y necesita de tu apoyo, tu ayuda será de gran bendición.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana is married and has four daughters, two of whom are married and two who are still in school. Her husband works in a tortilla factory, but his income is not sufficient to cover all family expenses. Mariana and her family live with her in-laws, who have run a convenience store for a long time. They had decided to close the store because of their advanced age, but to earn extra income Mariana decided to take control of it, and in this way she has been able to help her husband with expenses without neglecting her daughters.

The family unit has been an important piece in developing this business. Thanks to the help of her daughters, Mariana has been able to keep moving the store forward. Now, to keep the business growing, Mariana is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to purchase supplies to keep her store well stocked and offer her customers a quality service. You can help contribute to the well being of this family. Mariana and her family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mariana es casada y tiene cuatro hijas, dos de ellas están casadas y dos aún estudian, su esposo trabaja en una tortillería pero el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para solventar todos los gastos familiares, Mariana y su familia viven en casa de sus suegros, ellos tenían una tienda de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, y estaban decididos a cerrar porque su edad avanzada les impedía continuar con el negocio, pero para obtener un ingreso extra Mariana decidió hacerse cargo de la tienda, de esta manera podía ayudar a su esposo con los gastos sin descuidar a sus hijas.

La unión familiar a sido una pieza clave en del desarrollo de este negocio, gracias a la ayuda de sus hijas han logrado salir adelante. Ahora para continuar creciendo Mariana necesita un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtida su tienda y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de esta familia, no lo pienses más y decídete a ayudarlas, ellas te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for convenience store

loans.name: Mónica Julissa

texts.es:
Monica is a young woman full of desire to move up in the world. She is single and works as a secretary in the Palacio Federal. To help out her family economically, she started selling cosmetics to co-workers a year and a half ago. She likes the work and found a way to increase income and improve the quality of life for herself and her parents.

Thanks to the high quality of Monica's products, her demand has increased, and to be able to meet it she needs a loan of $250 to purchase more supplies. She plans to repay the loan within three months. You can be a part of Monica's success. She is sincerely grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mónica es una joven con grandes deseos de superación, ella es soltera, trabaja como secretaria en Palacio Federal, y para ayudar económicamente a su familia inició con la venta de cosméticos entre sus compañeros de trabajo desde hace año y medio, a ella le gustan las ventas y ha encontrado en este oficio la manera de incrementar su ingreso, y de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus padres.

Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que comercializa su demanda se ha incrementado y para poder cubrirla necesita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares para la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un plazo de 3 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Mónica, ella agradece sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es:
Lydia is a widow and has three children who are married. Seventeen years ago, she worked as an operator for an automotive business when her mother died and there was no one who could help her take care of her kids. She quit her job, but she did not have the support of her husband in providing for the children and their education. So she decided to start her own business selling footwear and cosmetics, and in this way she was able to keep her kids moving ahead. The high-quality service she gives her clients and her experience have helped her have many customers.

Lydia wants to thrust some new life into her business, and she's requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase supplies necessary for her to have a bigger stock and cover the demands of her customers. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Her business is her only source of income. Lydia wants to improve her quality of life, and with your help it is possible. She's very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lydia es viuda y tiene tres hijos que ya están casados. Hace 17 años, trabajaba como operaria para una empresa automotriz, pero al morir su madre y no tener a nadie que le ayudara a cuidar a sus hijos, abandonó su empleo, no tenía el apoyo de su esposo para el sostén y la educación de sus hijos por lo que inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y cosméticos, de esta manera pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos. El buen servicio que da a sus clientes y su experiencia en el negocio la ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes.

Lydia quiere darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener un mayor surtido y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida y gracias a ti será posible, Lydia agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria is a widow of six years and to move herself and her five children forward she started her own business selling cheese and chorizo. Shortly after, one of her daughters fell ill with cancer and underwent costly treatment before, sadly, dying. Gloria has had to overcome great familial loses, but she still has four children, two of whom live with her along with two grandchildren. She wants to provide them nothing but the best, which is why she works so hard.

Gloria started buying her products through middlemen, but now she buys straight from their suppliers and gets a better discount. But she has to buy in larger quantities and currently she needs a loan of $925, which she plans to repay within six months, to cover the costs of stocking her business. Gloria and her family really need your support to help improve their quality of life. They are forever grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria es viuda desde hace 6 años y para sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos empezó su propio negocio con la venta de quesos y chorizo, poco después una de sus hijas enfermó de cáncer y estuvo en tratamientos muy costos, pero lamentablemente falleció. Gloria ha tenido que superar grandes pérdidas familiares, pero aún tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos y sus dos nietos viven con ella y desea ofrecerles lo mejor, por lo que se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo.

Gloria empezó comprando sus productos con intermediarios, ahora lo hace directamente con sus proveedores, por lo que recibe un mayor beneficio, pero tiene que consumir cantidades mayores y para surtir su negocio ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 925 dólares, mismos que devolverá en 6 meses. Esta familia necesita mucho de tu apoyo, ayúdalos a mejorar su calidad de vida, ellos te lo agradecerán por siempre.

loans.use: Purchase cheese and chorizo

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has four children, and her youngest daughter (24) still lives with her. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker, so at times he receives no income. As a result, Maria began selling ceramics 20 years ago. With her earnings she was able to purchase haberdashery supplies and sell them out of her home. During the warm season, she also sold huaraches, a popular regional dish of flatbread covered with beans and cheese. Finally she got a post at the market, and since then her sales have increased considerably.

To be able to meet the demand of her costumers and continue growing her business, Maria is requesting a $475 loan, which she will use to purchase supplies for her business. She plans to repay the loan within six months. With your help, the quality of life of Maria and her family can improve. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, en su hogar sólo vive su hija más pequeña, de 24 años de edad. Su esposo es albañil, trabaja por temporadas razón por la que en ocasiones no recibe ningún ingreso, ante esta necesidad desde hace 20 años Maria se dedica a las ventas, inició con cerámica, de las ganancias que obtuvo ahorró para comprar productos de mercería y poder vender en su propio domicilio, en tiempo de calor incorpora la venta de huaraches y últimamente ha conseguido un puesto en el mercado donde sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Gracias a tu ayuda podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, no lo dudes más, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her business with products that she subsequently can sell to increase her revenue.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 23 and has not decided whether she will have children yet. Together with her husband, she sells artesan crafts in the market "Santo Domingo," located in the town of San Cristobal de Las Casas ( 30 minutes from her house). She makes bracelets and belts in various colors of silk thread. They also purchase cloth and make blouses, pants and skirts, so that they can then be embroidered with different colored flowers. After they have a good quantity of articles, they sell them to wholesalers. Rosa is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." With the loan, she hopes to purchase more fabric to make clothing, as well as embroidery thread, through which she hopes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ROSA TIENE 23 AÑOS, HASTA EL MOMENTO NO HAN DECIDIDO TENER HIJOS, JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO VENDEN ARTESANIAS EN EL MERCADO DE “SANTO DOMINGO” UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS (30 MINUTOS DE SU CASA). ELLA HACE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES DE HILO DE SEDA DE DISTINTOS COLORES, TAMBIEN COMPRAN MANTA Y CONFECCIONAN BLUSAS, PANTALONES, FALDAS PARA QUE POSTERIORMENTE SEAN BORDADOS CON FLORES DE DIVERSOS COLORES, Y DESPUES DE TENER CIERTA CANTIDAD LOS VENDEN CON LOS MAYORISTAS. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2.CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE COMPRAR MAS TELA PARA CONFECCIONAR LA ROPA Y TAMBIEN HILO PARA LOS BORDADOS Y ASI AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS .

loans.use: Sale of Artisan Clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The money will be invested in the maintenance and improvement of the workplace.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela is 30, she doesn't have any children and her husband works planting corn or during seasonal harvests. He also helps his wife when she needs to transport her merchandise. Micaela knits bracelets and belts with silk thread and after she has accumulated a sizable quantity, she takes them to sell in "Nachij," a community that lies around an hour from her home. This town is a heavily trafficked by tourists who go on to visit San Cristobal. Micaela is a memeber of the solidarity group "Betania 2," the other member is named Juana C. Barato, who participates in the same craft activity as Micaela. Together, the two hope that the loan will help them to purchase more silk thread in order for them to fabricate more goods and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

MICAELA TIENE 30 AÑOS, NO TIENE HIJOS, SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DEL MAIZ O DE ALGUNA COSECHA DE TEMPORADA, Y CUANDO HAY QUE IR A ENTREGAR MERCANCIA AYUDA A SU ESPOSA MICAELA QUIEN SE DEDICA A TEJER PULSERAS Y CINTURONES CON HILO DE SEDA, Y CUANDO YA TIENE PRODUCIDA UNA CANTIDAD LOS VAN A VENDER A “NACHIJ” COMUNIDAD UBICADA A UNA HORA DE SU CASA, POR SER ESTE UN LUGAR MUY TRANSITADO POR TURISTAS QUE VISITAN LA CIUDAD DE SAN CRISTOBAL. MICAELA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2, LA OTRA INTEGRANDE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA JUANA C. BARATO QUIEN SE DEDICA TAMBIEN AL MISMO RUBRO POR LO TANTO AMBAS ESPERAN CON EL CREDITO AUMENTAR LAS COMPRAS DE HILO DE SEDA PARA INCREMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS .

loans.use: To craft bracelets and belts.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 41, she has five children and her husband sells home made ice-cream from door to door. She crafts belts and bracelets from silk thread, and then sells them in San Cristobal de Las Casas, to merchants who have their own established stands in the market "Santo Domingo" ( an artesan market in the city). Juana is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more thread to craft her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JUANA TIENE 41 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO HACE Y VENDE HELADOS ARTESANALES DE CASA EN CASA. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER CINTURONES Y PULSERAS CON HILO DE SEDA, POSTERIORMENTE LAS VA A VENDER A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS CON LOS COMERCIANTES QUE TIENE SUS LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO, ( MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD ) JUANA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO BETANIA 2. CON EL PRESTAMO PIENSA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MAS HILO PARA LA ELABORAR MAS PRODUCTOS PARA VENDER

loans.use: To craft bracelets and belts.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is 26, single and crafts bracelets and belts to support herself and her family. She sells her products in an artesan market in the city (which is about 30 minutes from her home). With her earnings she helps her mother with household expenses because she has four younger siblings who all still attend school. She is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more thread on wholesale, reducing purchasing costs and increasing her earnings, with which she can better help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

VERONICA TIENE 26 AÑOS, SOLTERA, ELLA HACE PULSERAS Y CINTURONES, Y LOS VENDE EN EL MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD (SE LOCALIZA A 30 MINUTOS DE SU CASA), CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTIENE LE AYUDA A SU MAMA CON LOS GASTOS QUE SE GENERAN EN SU HOGAR YA QUE TIENE CUATRO HERMANITOS QUE ESTAN ESTUDIANDO. ELLA FORMA PARTE DE UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO BETANIA 2.CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA INVERTIRLO EN HILOS AL POR MAYOR Y ASI REBAJAR LOS COSTOS DE COMPRA Y AUMENTAR SUS INGRESOS PARA AYUDAR MEJOR A SU FAMILIA.

loans.use: To craft belts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He will invest the loan in buying two new computers and a photocopier.

loans.name: Lorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Lorng S., 45 years old mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell pork to retail stores along the roadside of her village. They typically make about $6 perday in revenue. Two of their children attend school and get involved with her business whenever they are free, while the rest aremarried and stay with their own families.
Meanwhile, Lorng S. is humbly requesting the loan amount of $1000 to meet her clients' needs and maximize the size of her growing business by purchasing more pigs to invest in a small booth. She eventually hopes the loan will help her and her family. In the future, she is committed to have enough money to purchase a stand at a market, where she is able to makes additional profit from this business activity.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for a business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S. A. is 34 years old, married with 2 children, who are enrolled in school. She lives with her husband and ailing mother in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She runs a small grocery stand at home and makes in average of  $5 per day in revenue, while her husband barely makes enough money from working very hard on a farm growing rice crops and raising pigs. To increase the family's saving and her business inventory, S. A. is requesting a loan  in the amount of $800 to purchase more grocery products and pigs. With the help of loan, she hopes to maximize her profit from investing in her current stand and animal breeding.
In the future, she would like to own another stand at a market, where she can expand her business and makes more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products and pigs to raise on her farm.

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Sok Sam Ae and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Mrs. Khat S. is 41 years old and is a widow with 5 children. She lives in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. She works very hard to support the entire family, especially her children's education. In order to service in her family's expense, S. runs a small booth at a market selling fruits and typically makes in average about $2 per day in revenue, which is barely enough to supplement the household.  S. made a decision to request for the loan amount of $200 to help increase her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet the recent demand of her clients. She would be  very happy and grateful if the loan gives her an opportunity to grow her business as well as increasing the size of her income. In the future, S. hopes to expand her business with many kinds of fruits to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to invest in her business.

payments.comment: This client has successfully paid off her loan early to CREDIT MFI.

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif was born in 1965 in Salyan region, Gardili village. He is marriedand has 3 children.
He has 15 years of experience in cattle breeding. He plans to buy a cow and to get more milk for selling and for providing  cheese and milk for his family. 
Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy a cow and grass.

loans.use: to buy a cow and grass

loans.name: Ibadali

texts.en:
Ibadali has been in this business for 15 years. He was born in 1960 in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He is married and has 3 children. 
He needs a loan of $475 to buy sprays which are used on the trees in his orchard.

loans.use: To buy  sprays to use on the trees in his orchard

loans.name: Shirin

texts.en:
Shirin is a 50 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Djabrayil region, settled in Absheron region. He is  married and has 5 children.
At the beginning of his business he sold  agricultural produce in the market. Then he started selling  seasonal vegetables and fruits also.
One day he decided to buy a truck for transportation of goods.
Now he has transported the vegetables and fruits from the different regions and sells wholesale to market.  He also transports  goods by customer request. to different places.
Shirin needs a loan of $1200 to do capital repairs on  the chassis ( motor  and etc.) of his truck.

loans.use: To do capital repairs  on the the chassis ( motor  and etc.) of his truck

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prum S., 32 years old and is a mother of 2 children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery stand at her home and typically makes  about $4/day, while her husband makes around $2 from working at a private company as a bus driver. In order to increase her family's saving as well as satisfying her clients' needs, S. is humbly requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase more grocery items for her inventory. In the future, she is thinking about being able to expand her stand with the variety of products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to invest in her stand

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Prom Sophea has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin has 12 years of experience in this business. He is 49 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is  married and has 2 children.
He sells seasonal agricultural produce.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop.

loans.use: To expand  his shop

loans.name: Makhmud

texts.en:
Makhmud  is 44  years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 3 children. 
Makhmud has been in the business of selling agricultural produce for 4 years. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to build a shop.

loans.use: To build a shop

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng C., 36 years old and  a mother of 2 children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by selling a variety of vegetables and typically makes in average about $2.5/day. Her husband, meanwhile, is a motor-taxi driver and contributes a meager profit to his household. To operate a motor-taxi business, C. is requesting for a loan amount of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, which she hopes to will bring in additional income from this business activity. In the future, she would like to have enough money to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike to run a business.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is 51  years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, settled in Absheron region. He is married and has 3 children. 
He has been as a private taxi-driver for 15 years. He transports only the members of a family, who hires him.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to to do capital repairs on his car

loans.use: To do capital repairs on his car

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en: Mwanahamisi lives in the Mbagala area of Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two sons. Mwanahamisi has a food vending business. She has four years of experience in this business. She wants to improve her business by adding dining tables and chairs, food serving dishes, and a stock of cold drinks. Sometimes she loses some customers due to inadequate equipments. She is also in need of a cupboard for storing food serving dishes hygienically. To facilitate her plan, Mwanahamisi needs US $550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Saida

texts.en: Saida runs a soft drink business in a busy area near the Mbagala bus stand. She usually opens the shop at half past six in the morning to sell tea to people before they go to their working places. Saida also sells cold drinks like Coca-Cola, Fanta and Sprite. Cold drinks have higher turnover in her kiosk, mainly caused by the hot weather of Dar es Salaam.  Saida plans to add a stock of these items. She also want to add sitting chairs and a table in order to accommodate more people, especially during peak hours. She is in need of US $750 to implement her plans.

loans.use: To add stock of drinks and sitting chairs

loans.name: Takhir

texts.en:
Takhir is 58  years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children. He has his own truck.
Takhir transports goods to market, where the building materials are sold. 
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a car because his car is broken very often and  he needs it  to improve his business.
He has been in this business for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana was born in 1970 in the Salyan region. She is married and has 3 children.
She has been in this business for 3 years.
This business is the only source of income for her family. She breeds cows and calves. 
Now she needs a loan of $375 to buy grass.

loans.use: To buy grass

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres has 5 dairy cows. He sells his dairy products to PIL Andina (which is a milk plant). Andres lives in the Achacahi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

His wife and 2 children work with him. They help him by taking good care of the cows. This is the family’s main source of income to support themselves.

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan that will help to improve their living conditions!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Andrés, tiene 6 vacas productoras de leche, la que comercializa a la empresa PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche); Andres vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto) Para la crianza y cuidado de su ganado trabaja con sus dos hijos y esposa, por lo que la venta de leche es su fuente principal de ingreso para el mantenimiento de su familia. El préstamo lo destinara para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar la cantidad de leche a producir. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
Eliodoro and his family live in the Achacahi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto). He has 5 dairy cows, and he sells his dairy products to PIL Andina (which is a milk plant). He has 4 children of 12, 10, 4 and 2 years of age. The two oldest help take care of the cows. Selling milk is his main source of income to support his family.

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan that will help to improve the quality of their dairy cattle and their production!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Eliodoro y su familia viven en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). Tienen 5 vacas productoras de leche, que comercializan a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 4 y 2 años de edad y los dos mayores ayudan en la crianza de las vacas; la venta de leche es su fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia. Con el crédito comprara una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo y mejorar la calidad del ganado y de su producción.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fuel

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario is a rural teacher. His wife and 2 children are dairy farmers, and they sell their dairy products to Pil Andina (which is an industrialization milk plant). They live in the Achacachi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used towards the purchase of a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario, trabaja en el magisterio rural (es maestro rural), la esposa y sus dos hijos son productores de leche de vaca que comercializan a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). Viven en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito le servirá para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Desiderio

texts.es:
Desiderio and his family are producers of cow’s milk which they market to Pil Andina (which is an industrialization milk plant). He also works as a caretaker at a private home located in the city of La Paz. Desiderio has two sons of 21 and 16 years of age. The oldest is in the Military (to do military service is very important to the Aymara-Andean community since they regard this as an honorable service to the entire community). The youngest son is in his last year of college. They live in the Achacachi-Tipampa Community (which is about 2 hours from the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase a medium-grade dairy cow which will help increase milk production.

This is their first loan with IMPRO. Their background check shows that they are prime candidates for a loan!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desiderio y su familia son productores de leche de vaca que comercializan a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), también trabaja como portero de una casa particular en la Ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 2 hijos de 21 y 16 años de edad, el mayor esta prestando el Servicio Militar (servicio muy importante para la comunidad aymará - andina y de trascendencia para la comunidad dada la importancia que se le otorga a este servicio) el hijo menor esta en el ultimo año de Colegio. Vive en la Comunidad de Achacachi - Tipampa (A dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto). El crédito será para invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy instruments and costumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat and fish for soup

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Six months ago Victor took out his first loan with Kiva and Mifex. He wisely invested the money in goods that would make perfect gifts during the busy Christmas season, specifically focusing on cell phone products and accessories. He made a significant amount of profit after making his investment. With the money he made, he decided to pursue a new business venture.

Victor has set up an ice cream shop in the home of his parents. He also travels around the neighborhood and the main streets of Guayaquil selling his products. He has seen a huge change since receiving his first loan. He now has a business of his own in his parents' house, and he feels much more optimistic about the future. He now hopes to receive a second loan so he may sell other products from his ice cream shop. He is planning on having a small store where he will sell all types of different products.

Victor still lives at home with his parents and his three children. His goal is to be able to buy a home of his own for his young and growing family.

loans.use: Buy different types of ice cream and introduce other products.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria M. is 27 years old. She lives with her parents in Munaypata north of La Paz. She shares a room with her two other sisters. She works out of her home making sports jumpsuits for a craft factory located in her town. She gets paid per item once completed.

The room that she shares with her sisters is not big enough to accommodate all of her production. Gloria would like to build an addition to the house, a bigger room where she can do her job and increase production.

The loan that she is requesting will pay for the construction of a brand new room. This loan is part of the many loans that IMPRO offers solely for housing construction. This is Gloria’s second loan with IMPRO. Her credit history and socio-economic background make her a good candidate. She paid the full amount of her previous loan on time!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria M. tiene 27 años, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona Munaypata, ladera Norte de la ciudad de La Paz y comparte una habitación con sus dos hermanas. Trabaja como confeccionista en una fabrica artesanal de esta ciudad, realizando buzos deportivos a destajo (lo cual significa que le pagan por pieza terminada). La habitación que comparten no les permite a las hermanas tener la suficiente comodidad para desarrollar sus actividades, por lo que Gloria requiere de una habitación más amplia para realizar su trabajo y así poder mejorar su producción. El crédito solicitado ira a cubrir la construcción de una habitación nueva. Este crédito es parte de nuestra línea de crédito destinada a vivienda y construcción. Este es el segundo crédito de Gloria en IMPRO y su historial y los antecedentes socioeconómicos la califican para cubrir sus obligaciones crediticias. El anterior crédito fue pagado en su totalidad y en los plazos establecidos.

loans.use: To build a bigger room for tailoring

loans.name: Nilmida

texts.es:
Nilmida has had her business for four years. She used to work cleaning homes, but then her and her husband decided to invest in basic food products and they started to sell meals, which has gone very well. She does this weekdays from 4pm to 11pm. She has managed to keep both activities going so that she earns more. Each morning she still cleans houses and each afternoon she prepares the meals she is going to sell.

With the loan she will buy kitchen utensils and food and drink as the more you buy the larger the discount, and therefore her earnings will increase.

Nilmida is 41 years old and has 3 children, one of which helps her with her business. She has managed to create a very hard working spirit in her family, which all of them still have. Her husband also cleans houses and after work he helps her attend to her clients. Their house is made of sugar cane stalks and the floor is of earth. She hopes that with the loan and their savings they will be able to start building it, little by little, of cement.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Nilmida tiene una experiencia de 4 años con el negocio. Ella se dedicaba a trabajar en casa realizando quehaceres domésticos. Junto a su esposo logran invertir en la compra de víveres y comienzan a vender meriendas. Actividad que le ha ido muy bien. Trabajando todos los días de la semana en horario de 4 p.m. hasta las 11 p.m. Actualmente ella ha logrado mantener las dos actividades que le generan ingresos. Por las mañanas continuas con su limpieza en casa y por las tardes se dedica a preparar las meriendas para su venta.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina. Además poder comprar víveres al por mayor con lo que obtendría mayor descuento. Y por ende las ganancias en sus ventas van a ser mayor.

Nilmida tiene 41 años. Y tres hijos. Uno de los cuales le ayuda con la atención del negocio. Ha logrado crear dentro de la familia un sentimiento de ayuda que todos lo están practicando en este momento. Su esposo también se dedica a limpiar casas. Luego de su trabajo le ayuda con la atención de sus clientes. Su casita es de caña y piso de tierra. Espera con la ayuda del crédito y sus ahorros poco a poco construirla de cemento.

loans.use: To invest in kitchen utensils and basic food products/Invertir en utensilios de cocina y viveres

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga has been a saleswoman for five years. She used to sell food from her home but had to stop due to health problems. Her husband therefore helped her to start her own business selling various products. He gave her $70 to start off and with it she bought various products which sell well. She works weekdays from 6am to 10pm.

She will use the loan to buy more products for her shop, such as: paper, notebooks and workbooks, pens, presents and household objects. Clients have asked Olga for these products and she hopes that the investment will help to improve her earnings.

Olga is married. She is 52 and has five grown-up children, two of whom help her with her business. Her house is being finished bit by bit. Her husband delivers construction materials for a living. All of her children live with her although 3 of them now have their own families. Her goal is to have a bigger shop so that she can serve her clients better.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Olga tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad de comerciante. Ella vendía comida en el portal de su domicilio y por problemas de salud tuvo que dejar la comida. Viendo esto su esposo le ayuda para que ella se inicie con un negocio propio. Decide ponerse un local de venta de artículos varios. Ayudándole el con un valor de $ 70 dólares para capital de trabajo. Con los que compro mercadería variada y le ha ido muy bien. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 10 p.m.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos para su bazar. Como lo son: papelería, cuadernos, plumas, regalos, y además desea comprar artículos para el hogar. Olga tiene pedidos de estos artículos y espera con la inversión que realizara mejorar sus ingresos.

Olga es casada. Tiene 52 años. Cinco hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Dos de ellos le ayudan con la atención del negocio. Su casita poco a poco la esta terminado de construir. Su esposo trabaja realizando fletes de materiales de construcción. Todos sus hijos viven con ella pero ya tienen su familia formada tres de ellos. Su deseo es poder tener un local más grande. De esta manera poder darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy paper, notebooks, workbooks, pens, presents and household objects/Invertir en papelería, cuadernos, plumas, regalos, y además desea comprar artículos para el hogar.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
When Dominga was young she worked selling chickens by the pound, but she had to stop because there was too much competition. Twenty years ago she started selling seafood. Her and her husband decided to travel to the coast and bring their products back to the city to sell. She also works selling jewellery and cosmetics. She has managed to combine these two activities and she earns well from them. When she has to travel to buy seafood her daughter attends to her customers. She works weekdays from 9am to 5pm.

With the loan she will buy more jewellery and cosmetics for her clients. She will also buy some dairy products, especially yoghurt, to sell in her local area as people have asked her for this product.

Dominga is married. She is 45 years old and has five children, all of whom are married. Her husband is a merchant sailor and works on a ship. They have a small car and her husband uses it to deliver products when he is free. Her goal is to finish off their house and therefore accommodate her family better. Her and her husband are working hard to achieve this.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Dominga desde joven trabajaba vendiendo pollos por libra. Actividad que la fue dejando por la competencia que había. Desde hace 20 años ella se inicio con la venta de mariscos. Junto a su esposo deciden viajar a otro lado y traer el producto aquí a la ciudad para su venta. Ella además de tener esta actividad trabaja vendiendo productos de bisutería y cosméticos. Ha logrado combinar estas dos actividades que le generan buenos ingresos. Cuando ella tiene que viajar a comprar mariscos su hija se encarga de atender la demanda de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos de bisutería y cosméticos para satisfacer a sus clientes. Otra parte del crédito comprara productos lácteos como lo es: yogurt. Para la venta en su domicilio y ambulante. Tiene pedidos de este producto.

Dominga es casada. Tiene 45 años y 5 hijos los que ya están casados. Su esposo es marino mercante y trabaja en una embarcación. Poseen un carrito el cual por las tardes su esposo se encarga de realizar fletes cuando esta libre. Su deseo es poder terminar su casita y de esta manera darle comodidad a su familia. Junto a su esposo están realizando esfuerzos para lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, jewellery and maybe dairly products too/Invertir en cosmeticos y bisuteria, y quizas tambien en lacteos

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria has been selling household objects and basic food products from her home for four years. Her opening hours are from 7am to 7pm as these products are much needed in the area where she lives. Maria was very motivated to start this business and she has managed to maintain it thanks to her dedication and good customer service.

Maria would like a loan to increase and vary her range of products as she is located in an area where there is no competition. Given the good quality of her products and customer service her clientele has grown, and she would like to take advantage of this opportunity to expand her business.

Maria is 47 years old and is married. Her husband does seasonal work outside the city but in his free time he helps her with her business. They have three children and they are all studying. Her desire is to improve her family’s quality of life with what she earns.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

Maria tiene su negocio de venta de artículos de bazar y víveres desde hace 4 años en su vivienda. El horario de atención es de7.a. m a 7 p.m. Dada la necesidad de estos productos y servicios en el sector donde habita. Maria se vio motivada a iniciar este negocio. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y buen servicio que Maria brinda a sus clientes durante el desempeño en su negocio.

Maria solicita el crédito para incrementar y dar variedad a su negocio ya que esta ubicada en un sector donde casi no tiene competencia. Dado a la buena calidad de sus productos, atención y servicio a sus clientes les ha permitido aumentar el número de ellos. Maria desea aprovechar esta oportunidad para crecer en su negocio.

Maria tiene47 años es casada su esposo trabaja como jornalero fuera de la ciudad, en su tiempo libre el la ayuda en la atención del negocio. Tienen 3 hijos y todos estudian. Su deseo es que con el producto de su trabajo mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To increase and vary her products/Incrementar y variar sus productos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase two deep fryers, extra tables and seats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a deep freezer and animal feed

loans.name: Luís

texts.en:
Luis is a fruit and clothing vendor who sells his products from his tricycle cart. After working in local markets for several years, he decided there was too much competition and preferred to take his fruits directly to the homes of his clients. He has had success because it is more convenient for people to buy fruits when Luis passes by rather than going to the market. He also sells ties, belts, and other clothing accessories. He is seeking a second loan with Mifex in order to invest in new home products and appliances. He used his first loan to fix his cart and invest in more clothing.

Luis is 46 years old and has one son. He and his wife have been able to buy and fix up their home through hard work and savings. He tells us that his wife and son are his inspiration to go out and work hard from 5 in the morning into the evening.

loans.use: Invest in more clothing and also domestic appliances

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta was born and raised in her small community of Los Botados. She is the proud mother of two children who are 21 and 9 years old. She is a hard-working woman. Before starting her present business, she used to make "quipes" (deep fried bulgur roll) and "pastelitos" (meat or chicken turnovers). Fifteen years ago she started the present day business, a "colmado" (mini-market or grocery store). Now she plans on using this loan to increase her supplies, especially chilled refreshments, without which she fears losing sales during heightened weekend demand.

loans.use: To increase supplies/inventory

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en:
Maria is a young mother of 5 children. For the past few years she had been able to sustain the family employing her husband to attend to the clients who frequent their cafeteria/night club. The husband does the hard labor, while Maria is the administrator.

Their business is located in a community that was built by a foreign government grant wherein their homes are built of thin sheets of cement, sprayed on metallic sightings, with wooden structure roofs topped by asphalt shingles. The community consists of about 500 living units where approximately 3000 people live. Thus, Maria’s business together with a few other similar micro-businesses serve the night time recreational needs of the community. As you might expect, the cafeteria has very old and decrepit boom box for sound equipment. They can only function when there is electricity, which is approximately half of the time. As evident in the picture, they have a refreshment chilling unit. But, Maria and her husband suffered perhaps not so coincidentally the loss of all their goods as a result of robbery. (Najayo correctional facility, the most modern correctional facility of the Dominican Republic, happens to be about a kilometer away from this community).

Maria hopes to get back on track with her business with this loan; however, she does hint that she wants to repay as soon as possible so that she can take a larger loan. Her husband is already working on reinforcing the windows and the doors to their 200sq. ft. business space.

loans.use: Inventory for Cafeteria

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 55 years old and married. She decided to start her own business 10 years ago with part of the settlement from her old job and no experience. Today, she maintains that business thanks to her constant dedication and work. Rosa sells ice cream, yogurt, candies, and beverages at her house. She runs the business every day from 9 a.m. to 12 p.m.

Her business is in a good location. She needs the loan in order to buy new candy products and ice cream novelties. Her clients want her to provide them with new varieties of products. She also wants to buy a better display case for them as well.

Rosa's business is located only a short distance from the city bus stop. The home is a mixed structure with a dirt floor. They also have a daughter. Rosa is the main breadwinner of the family. With the loan, she hopes to make improvements to her business as well as their living conditions. She is an example of hard work in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa tiene su negocio de venta de helados, yogurt y bebidas refrescantes ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Su horario de operacion es de 9a.m. a12 p.m todos los días. Sin contar con experiencia, y con parte de la liquidación que recibió de su antiguo trabajo se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y trabajo que Rosa le ha puesto.

Rosa necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar nuevos productos de confitería y una vitrina para mejorar la presentación y exhibición de los mismos. Por encontrarse en una buena ubicación, sus clientes le han solicitado que les provea de nueva variedad de productos.

Rosa tiene 55 años y tiene esposo. Su esposo no cuenta con un trabajo fijo y puede aportar muy poco para los gastos de la casa. Tienen 1 hija. Su casa se encuentra ubicada a poca distancia de la estación de colectivos. La estructura es mixta y su piso de tierra. Con el crédito aspira mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida siendo un ejemplo de trabajo en su comunidad.

loans.use: Buy an assortment of new products(ice cream novelties, candies, and beverages)

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel is 28 years old and a single mother. Her husband left her a year ago and that motivated her to start and work on her own business and get ahead. She started 2 years ago with very little capital. Mabel runs her business from home.

In her business, she sells clothes and small household items as well as providing beauty services for women. She works every day from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. Mabel has been able to maintain her business due to her dedication and good customer service.

She needs the loan to buy new products and a display case to better showcase the merchandise that her business offers. In that way, she can take advantage of the opportunity and increase her customers.

She lives with her son on a mixed structured house. Mabel hopes that with the loan, she can improve her business and living conditions and serve as an example of hard work for her relatives and neighbors in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Mabel tiene su negocio en el que vende ropa, artículos pequeños para el hogar y realiza trabajos de belleza para damas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. Su horario de atención es de 9 a.m. a 10 p.m. todos los días. Sin contar con mucho capital se decidió iniciar su propia fuente de trabajo. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y buen servicio que ella ofrece a sus clientes.

Mabel necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar nuevos productos y una vitrina con la que mejorara la presentación y exhibición de la mercadería que ella ofrece en su negocio. De esta manera puede aprovechar la oportunidad de incrementar el número de sus clientes.

Mabel tiene 28 años es madre soltera. Su esposo la dejo hace 1 año motivo por el cual se dedico a trabajar y salir adelante. Tiene 1 hijo que es menor de edad. Su casa es de estructura mixta. Con el crédito aspira a mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida siendo un ejemplo de trabajo y superación para sus familiares y vecinos del sector donde habita.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and products as well as a display case

loans.name: Purísima

texts.es:
Purisima is 56 years old and married. Her husband can't work outside his home due to blindness caused by his diabetes. He helps to look after the business. Due to this illness, Purisima lost her second son 2 years ago and almost caused them to lose their working capital.

For 18 years, she has run a grocery business from her house. The grocery store is open every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. Purisima and her husband started their business with some small savings from her husband's previous job.

They have been able to keep the business running thanks to their constant dedication, work, and service that she and her family had contributed. They have 3 other children that live with them. Their house is made out of wood with a dirt floor. Her greatest wish is to continue working and to help her family move forward

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Purísima tiene su negocio de venta víveres ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 18 años. Su horario de atención es de 6 a.m. a10 p.m todos los días. Con lo poco que había logrado ahorrar del trabajo de su esposo, se decidió a iniciar su propia fuente de ingresos. Ha logrado mantenerlo gracias a la constante dedicación, trabajo y servicio que ella y su familia le han puesto.

Purísima necesita de un préstamo para poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprar nuevos productos y brindar más variedad de los víveres que ofrece en su negocio.

Purísima tiene 56 años y tiene esposo .Su esposo padece de ceguera a causa de la diabetes. En la actualidad no puede trabajar fuera de casa pero ayuda en la atención del negocio. Por motivo de esta misma enfermedad hace 2 años, Purísima perdió su segundo hijo. Lo que motivo que casi se quedaran sin capital de trabajo .Tienen otros 3 hijos que viven con ellos .Su casa es de madera con un piso de tierra. Su deseo es seguir trabajando y sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To continue buying grocery products and provide a better assortment for her customers.

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne is 50 years old and lives with her children who are students. She is also a secondary education teacher and is conscious of the need to prepare her children very well for the future.

Ivonne has a fast food and stationery business located inside a school. She started her business with $200 that she saved from her afternoon job. She takes care of the business in the mornings.

The loan she is asking for will be used to make suitable improvements inside the business. She has noticed that she needs to improve her business' image in order to increase the sales. Ivonne needs to buy another display case and improve and embellish the walls at her location.

She trusts that the business will give them the economic solvency to help her children in what they need most. She has a stable family and a lot of enthusiasm for work.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Ivonne tiene un negocio de venta de comida rápida y de articulos de papeleria que atiende en las mañanas y esta ubicado dentro de una escuela. Dicho negocio lo emprendió con $200 que ahorro de su trabajo vespertino.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella utilizará el préstamo para realizar adecuaciones dentro de su local pues ha notado que es necesario mejorar la imagen del negocio. Para incrementar las ventas, necesIta comprar un vitrina mas y enlucir las paredes de su local.

Información Personal

Ivonne tiene 50 años. Sus hijos estudian. Su casa es de cemento y siendo ella maestra de educacion secundaria esta conciente de la necesidad de preparar bien a sus hijos para el futuro. Por ello confia que su negocio le dará la solvencia para ayudarlos en lo que más pueda. Tiene estabilidad familiar y mucho entusiasmo para trabajar.

loans.use: Improvements to her business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. V. has a store in which he sells appliances. He began this business eight years ago with the help of his wife and a loan he took. Today he has a team of salesmen who travel to rural areas of the city.

Use of Loan: He needs credit to extend his business and reach places where his merchandise have not yet arrived. He wants to buy more merchandise and offer new products that his clients have asked for.

Personal Information: Mr. V. is 38 years old and has five children that study. He has a concrete home and family stability. He wants to expand his business to better his children’s education.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio: E Sr. V. tiene un local donde vende articulos electrodomesticos. Dichlo negocio lo empezao hace ocho años con la ayuda de su esposa y un prestamo que hizo. Actualmente tiene una red con venededores que viajan a las zonas rurales de la cuidad

Uso del Préstamo: E l necesita el credito para ampliar su negocio y tener mas cobertura en otros sitios donde aun no han llegado sus mercaderias quiere comprar mas mercaderias y ofrecer nuevos productos que han solicitado sus clientes

Información Personal: El tiene 38 años y cinco hijos que estudian tiene una casa de cemento y estabilidad familiar. El tiene el afan de hacer crecer el negocio para darle un mejor educacion a sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase more products and have more coverage

loans.name: Italia

texts.es:
Business Description: Marlene owns a hair salon where she cuts, dyes and perms hair of people who live in her area. Her cousin motivated her to begin this business by teaching her the job. Then she studied and began her micro company with $200 of savings.

Use of Loan: Marlene needs a loan for her salon because she now has more clients and she doesn’t have enough space to seat them and display beauty products demanded by them.

Personal Information: She is 34 years old and has two children who are studying. Her house is made of concrete and she has a stable family situation. She trusts that the growth of her business will give her more profits and a better quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: Marlene tiene un local donde realiza corte, tinturado y permanentado de cabellos a las personas de su sector. Incio su negocio por motivacion de su prima que le enseño el ofico luego estudio y puso su microempresa con $200 de ahorro.

Uso del Préstamo: Ella necestia el prestamo para ampliar su local pues ahora tiene mas clientes y le resulta reducido el espacio donde los atiende ademas quiere porner a la venta articulos de belleza y cosmeticos que lson solicitados por la clientela.

Información Personal: Ella tiene 34 años y dos hijos que estan estudiando su casa es de cemento t tiene estabilidad familiar. Ella confia que con el crecimiento de su negocio tendra mayores ganacia y mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Expand and make improvements to her salon

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Business Description: Mr. Justo runs a business where he makes sweet flour rolls and sells them with the help of a friend and his wife. He began this business with his savings after leaving his job and bought a second hand oven.

Use of Loan: He needs credit to buy more prime materials at wholesales prices and install a wall to separate his business area from his home; it lacks dividers.

Personal Information: He is 39 years old, has four children who are studying. His house is made of concrete but is not yet finished. He has a stable family situation. He hopes for a growth in his business so he can finish building his house and better his quality of life.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: Don Justo tiene un local donde elabora roscas dulces de harina y luego las vende con la ayuda de otro amigo y de su esposa. El incio su negocio con unos ahorros despues de dejar de trabajar para una panaderia y de comprar un horno de segunda mano.

Uso del Préstamo: El necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima a precio de mayorista y separar con una pared el negocio de su casa pues aun no tiene divisiones en el interio de ella.

Información Personal: El tiene 39 años y cuatro hijos que estan estudiando su casa esde cemento pero aun no esta terminada tiene estabilidad familiar. El espera que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podra terminar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase prime material at wholesale prices

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Business Description: Mónica has a Soda bar inside the school where she works as a teacher. She and her daughter run the business during school recesses by selling to the children of this school. The school parents asked for a place like this for their children, which motivated to begin her business.

Use of Loan: Mónica needs credit to make an extension to the stand to meet the increase of children in school.

Personal Information: She is 36 years old and has three children that study. Her house is made of concrete and she has a stable family situation. She hopes that the growth of her business increases her profits to better her quality of life and assure her children a better education.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: Mónica tiene un Soda bar en el interio de una escuela donde ella labora con maestra y con la ayuda de su hija atiende en hora de recreo a los niños de la misma. Ella empezo su negocio por motivacion de los padres de familia que pedian un lugar como este para atender a sus hijos.

Uso del Préstamo: Monica necesita el credito para hacer una ampliacion de su local pues con el aumento de niños de la escuela se ve en la necesidad de adecuarlo para las circunstancia presentes.

Información Personal: Ella tiene 36 años y tres hijos que estudian y su casa es de cemento tiene estabilidad familiar.Ella aspira que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podra aumentar su ganancias y asi tener mejor calidad de vida y sus hijos tendran una mejor educación.

loans.use: Expand her stand

loans.name: Ving

texts.en: Mrs. Ving C. is a widow with two chidren.  She lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. She runs a farm on a small piece of land behind her house.  She barely makes enough money to help make ends meet for her family. Two of her children work at the local garment factory and contribute money to the household once a month. Currently, C. is requesting an $800 loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and cows to work on her farm. She thinks the loan offers the best opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and cows for her farm

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Mrs. Chi was born in 1964 and her husband is the same age. They have two sons, age 13 and 18, who are students at secondary and primary school. Mrs. Chi and her husband sell fresh fish at home. Their income is $11 per person/month. They hope to get a loan of $75 to invest in their business. They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell fresh fish

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is 45 years old.  She lives with her youngest daughter, who is an 8 year old and a student in primary school. Huyen runs a grocery store at home because she has no land for cultivation. She hopes to get a loan of $75 so that she can stock up her grocery store. The family income is $10 per person/month. Mrs. Huyen is going to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to add stock to the grocery store.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs . Chim Sambo is 50 years old.  She is married with three children.  She lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham Province. She makes a living by selling a variety of vegetables at the market.  On a typical day, she makes about $2.50. Her husband is a farmer and grows crops and vegetables, including tomatoes, herbs, carrots and different kinds of lettuce. Meanwhile, one of her children operates a recycling business and the other two are students. Currently, S. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a motorcycle to be used to transport her vegetables to the market.  In the future, she hopes to have enough money to own a grocery store near the market, so that she can make additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor-bike for her business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Chim Sambol has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thank your for your support. Thanks to lenders like you, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans to invest into their small businesses and families. We hope that you will continue your support  and reinvest your loan in another entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mr. Khiev Y. is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of three children, who are students.  He lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He makes a living by transporting passengers with a horse carriage.  With this business activity, he can typically make about $5/day in revenue.  His wife sells bananas along the roadside and earns around $2.50 a day in revenue. Khiev Y. is currently asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a horse and repair a carriage. He expresses gratitude for your help as you can play a very important role in his business's growth.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and repair a carriage

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en: Mrs. Sang is 34 years old and her husband is four years older. They have two daughters and a son. The two daughters are students and are in secondary and primary school. Their son is too young to attend school and has a heart problem. Since the Sangs have no land, they sell pork.  This yields a combined income of $22 per month. They hope to get a loan of $75 in order to improve their business. They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell pork

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mrs. Lun S. is 47 years old.  She is married and a mother of three children.  She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She works for a small restaurant in the area as a chef and earns about $1.5/day in revenue. Her husband is a construction foreman and typically makes about $5/day. Two of her children are construction workers, while the other is a student.  Lun Sintharn is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy her husband some contruction tools and wood frames for his job. She hopes the loan will provide the family an opportunity to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase wood frames and other construction tools for her husband's business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Lun Sitham has paid back this Kiva loan early.

Thanks to your support, entrepreneurs around the world have access to low-interest loans for their small businesses. We hope that you will continue loaning on Kiva.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Ms. Em was born in 1946 and is single. She has to support her old father, who is 86 years old. She has a small tea shop at home. From the shop, she earns $11 per month. She hopes to get a loan of $75 so that she can stock her tea shop to support herself and her old father. Ms. Em will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to supply her tea shop

loans.name: Phou

texts.en: Mrs. Phou S. is 37 years old and a widow with 2 children.  Her children are currently attending school.  She lives with her brother in a part of Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. In order to supplement the family income, the diligent widow works very hard on a small farm with her brother.  They grow vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, lettuce and different kinds of herbs. She then sells them to the wholesaler at the market. With this business activity, she can earn around $10/day in revenue. To maximize her harvest and revenue, Phou S. is requesting a loan  of $1000 to purchase more seeds, fungicides and other cultivation tools for her farm. She hopes the loan will offer her the best opportunity to expand her business and enable her to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fungicides, and other tools for her farm

loans.name: Toey

texts.en: Ms. Toey S. is 32 years old, married and a mother of three children.  Her children are in school. She lives with her husband and family in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a grocery stand from her home and normally makes around $2.50 in revenue each day. Her husband is a teacher and makes a meager income. In order to meet her clients' needs improve her grocery stand, S. is currently requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery products to sell at her stand. In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to expand her business with a variety of products to fulfill her clients' demand.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her stand

loans.name: Sakhi Dad

texts.en: Sakhi D. lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an uneducated man and he lives alone. The other members of his family are living in one of the provinces of Afghanistan. He has a shop selling personal products in the capital. He took his 5th cycle group loan and bought surplus personal care products and some extra things. He is doing a good business and he wants to take anther loan to expand his business and help his family. He wants to make a good income to rent a house for his family to bring them from the village to the capital. This is one of his fondest wishes and he hopes that he can solve his problems.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en:
A. Sabor lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has the responsibility for supporting his family because his father and mother died in an explosion in Kabul 4 years ago. He is the youngest of his brothers.

He sells cosmetics on the street in the city. He took his 5th cycle group loan and bought shirts, clothes for children, and some extra things and is doing a good business. He wants to take anther loan to rent a shop and expand his business to support his family better than now. He would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To rent a shop

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema B. of 28 Wife of Mr. Khonkon Miah of 36, is a member of Titas Mohila Somity since 2002 in Gazipur area. She has a girl of 7 years old. Her husband is the only earning member in her family and his income is very small to run the family. She decides to be an earning member for the family and receives training on livestock organized jointly by AF and Government Livestock Department. 

She takes a loan from AF and purchases 2 cows for rearing at home. She herself takes general care of cows and provides medical treatment when needed. She gets 5 liters of milk daily and sells them @ US $ 0.44 per liter. So, her daily income is US$ 2.2. She intends to buy another cow of high breed at a cost of US $ 600.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Maria Zacarias

texts.pt:
Maria Zacarias C. is 38 years old. She was born in the Matola province, in Maputo. She was raised by her parents whose financial situation enabled Maria to study until the 8th grade. In 1990, Maria divorced her husband and started a small business in order to support her family.

In 2007, she was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA where she requested her first loan. With this loan, Maria hopes to grow her business and increase her income. Today her business provides employment for 4 people. With the income from her business, Maria supports her family and pays for the schooling of her children.

With the loan of 30.000,00 MT, Maria plans to increase the stock of her shop. Maria’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Maria and 4 other people, and it also brings products closer to her community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro 02 - Boane ACTIVIDADE: Comercio CLIENTE: Maria Zacarias C. VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 30.000,00MT (1,200.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE: Compra e venda de Produtos Inicio: 10/06/2007 Final: 30/09/2008 Maria Zacarias C. de 38 anos de eidade, Natural de Matola Provincia de Maputo, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais, a situacao financeira da familia criou oportunidades para estudar ate 8ªclasse. Em 1990 divorciou-se com o seu marido e vem assumindo na integra a gestao de negocio da familia e possui um estabelecimento comercial. No ano de 2007 por indicacao da irma teve conhecimento da existencia da HLUVUKU ADSEMA tendo se aproximado e solicitado o seu primeiro emprestimo para ampliacao do seu negocio

Com este emprestimo espera fazer crescer seu negocio e ganhar mais lucros. Actualmente providencia emprego para quatro trabalhadores. Com o rendimento do negocio suporta os encargos familiares, incluindo educaçao dos filhos.

Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00MT, pretende aumentar o volume da mercadoria. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ela propria providencia tambem para (4) quatro pessoas, assim como coloca o produto mas perto do cliente.

loans.use: To increase stock in her shop

loans.name: Nurjahan

texts.en:
Nurjahan B. of 42 years of age, wife of 48 years, is a member of Achal Mohila Somity. She has one daughter and three sons. She and her husband set up factory in her won residence. She prepares 7 different types of biscuits and bread. Her husband and 2 sons assist her in purchasing raw materials and supplying finished biscuits bread to different food shops in Gazipur district. 

She is doing fine and wants to increase more production. She will purchase more raw materials and equipments for the factory. She requires US $ 1,175.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and equipments.

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.pt:
Armando Felisberto C. is 39 years old. He was born in the city of Maputo. Armando was raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation allowed him to study until the 10th grade. Since 2006, Armando has been supporting his family through a small business in Massaca and #1030. In 2006 he was introduced to HLUVUKU—ADSEMA by his uncle and requested his first loan.

Today Armando’s business is doing well. It provides employment for Armando and one full time employee. With the income from the shop Armando supports his family and saves when possible.

With the loan of 30.000,00 MT, Armando plans to increase the volume of his stock in order to avoid the shortage of goods when demand is high. Armando’s work has a positive impact in his community because it provides employment for Armando and his wife. It also brings basic products closer to his clients especially the students and employees of the Gaiato Home in the neighborhood of Massaca I,.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Massaca 1 - Boane CLIENTE : Armando Antonio C. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 30.000,00 MT (1,200.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade. Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim: 31/07/2008 Armando Felisberto C., de 39 anos de idade, natural de Cidade de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo,cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos seus Pais. A situação financeira da familia criou-lhe oportunidades para estudar ate a 10ª classe. Desde 2006 vem assumindo na intgra a gestao de negocio da familia e possui um estabelecimento Comercial em Massaca І. Em 2006 por por indicacao do seu Tio teve conhecmento da existencia da HLUVUKU—ADSEMA tendo aproximado e solicitado emprestimo para aplicacao do seu negocio. Desde entao a sua actividade conheceu outra dinamica tendo solicitado varios e outros emprestimo. Actualmente o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo razoavel e providencia emprego a um trablhador e com o rendimento do negocio suporta encargos familiares e faz alguma poupanca.

Com o emprestimo de 30.000,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de negocio de forma a evitar ruptura de stocks durante o tempo de maior procura. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar emprego para ele proprio e a esposa, coloca o produto mas perto do cliente com particular destaque para todos residentes do bairro Massaca I, trabalhadores e alunos da casa Gaiato.

loans.use: To increase stock in his business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel C. is 34 years old. She was born in the Matola, province of Maputo. She was raised by her aunt. Her family’s financial situation allowed Isabel to study. She studied until the 2nd year of technical professional training in the area of chemistry. Isabel gave up her studies in 1989 because of a pregnancy.

Since 1990, Isabel has been providing for her family through the sale of food and apparel for retail businesses. She serves the area of Boane and Matola. Isabel has 2 children. She was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by a friend. There she requested her first loan. Today her business is doing well. It provides employment for Isabel and one of her sons. With the income from the business Isabel provides for her family and pays for the schooling of her children.

With the loan of 25.000,00, Isabel plans to increase the stock in the shop. Isabel’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment and brings goods closer to the retail shops in the district of Boane and Matola.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO : Matola Rio - Boane CLIENTE: Isabel C. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Comercio VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO : 25.000,00MT (1,000.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de produtos de primeira necessidade.
